Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	The sentence translates to: "Thus begins the speech of Albucasim."
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O sons, I have finished this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, in order to perfect your faith in it, and for the praises of its works, and for the declarations of its secrets, it seems to me that I must complete this work for you, which is a part of my art, so to speak, surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For our region and our time, surgery is a perilous art, so that the science of it is almost lost; and its signs are few; and it remains only for a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which change all things and even makes void the greatest knowledge and strength of it
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	I declare that I have composed this treatise in such a way as to follow the way of exposition and declaration, and to abbreviate; and that I have added to it the forms of the cautery instruments and other instruments of the work as well as for the addition of the declaration, and for the preparation of the patient, which is necessary
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The greatest cause why you will not find a good surgeon in our time is that the art of medicine is long, and that it covers many actors who have not exercised in the science of anatomy, who do not know the joints and the shapes of these, and the connection and separation of these; and the knowledge of bones, nerves and lacerations, and the number of these, and their colour; and of the pulse veins and their sounds, and the places of their sensation.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And as Hippocrates said, I have no name in small works, but I have it in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	Indeed, as I said at the beginning of this book, he already mentioned that anyone who is not learned in anatomy will fall into an error which will cause the death of men, as I have seen many of these fall into this error, for they are formed in this science but they throw away this science and these experiments
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	I have seen a foolish doctor and expert who has incised an abscess of scrofula in the groin of a woman, and has cut some arteries of the groin so that there flows great blood within her, and the woman died between her thighs.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I have seen another doctor who believed that he could extract a stone from a man who had suffered from it for a long time, and the stone was great, and he went to him and cut out that stone with a piece of glass, and the man died on the third day
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	I have already mentioned this, and I see that because of the greatness of the stone and the condition of the patient I know that he will die from this.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I have seen another doctor who took the stipend of a duke from our land for surgery, and he owed it to a black slave who had been injured in the thigh; and in his ignorance the doctor, without taking any precautions, extracted the fracture, over the wound, with pins and needles, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And thus he left him according to his desires, and he relieved him, and he left him for a few days and commanded that he be unbound; and thus the thigh and the foot festered postoperatively and he came to his death
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	I went to him and found that he had unbound him, and he was peaceful and calm and relieved of his pains
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But indeed corruption was already confirmed in the limb, for that I could not restrain it, and I could not stop the corruption of the limb until the patient was in danger of his life
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I have seen another doctor who pierced an abscess of cancer, and he made an ulcer nearby for several days, until the malignancy of the disease increased and overwhelmed him
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of this is that cancer is pure melancholy humor, and it does not suffice for it to overcome the whole of its effects, but that it should be applied only to the limb which suffers, so that it should be host to all the rest
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	Therefore, sons, it is necessary for you that the art of surgery be divided into two parts: that which is associated with health, and that which is dangerous in the greatest precautions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already mentioned this throughout this book in which I have discussed the art of surgery in which there is error and fear; for it is necessary for you to preserve this and to leave that which may cause fools to speak and deceive you
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Therefore take up the sacred arms in the request and in the protection of God, and the sick minds in their facility and firmness
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And thus, through the mercy of God, you have overcome adversity and achieved salvation, and praised the blessed succession; you have banished the terrible diseases that were difficult to cure, and finally overcome the weapons of that which you were afraid; so that your faith and your name remain in his sight, for your might rests in his glory.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Indeed, I have already mentioned several times:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	“There is no cure for a bad disease, so that no doctor will be called a liar”.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already finished this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Let us begin the division of the book, and first of all from the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is arranged from the head downwards, concerning the forms of instruments and cautery utensils, and what is necessary for the operation
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter deals with swelling and perforation, windbag, ulcers, and extraction of arrows, all categorized and arranged in terms of the forms of instruments
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter deals with restoration and dislocation, treatment of fractures and similar cases; the chapter is arranged from the head downwards, concerning the forms of instruments
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	From cautery until fire and acute medicine and memory of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	Here begins the treatise of the whole book
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Since I have spoken of the qualities of the instruments of that cautery and the documents of them, and in what completion it is prohibited to make incisions
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the discourse on the quality of the instruments of that cautery and the document of them is a long and profound one, subtle for science, and a secret hidden; and many great scholars have spoken of it, and they have disagreed with each other, and I believe that a small part of their sermons suffices for me, fearing a lengthening of the discourse
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	Therefore I say that incisions comply with all universal completion except for two completions, which are caudal completions of its matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the caudal and dry completion of the matter disagreement arises; for some say that cautery is useful for that, while others say that it is harmful. For indeed, the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that a disease which is cold and dry should be treated with something that is also cold and dry
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And they say that the opposite is true, that cautery is useful in all cold and dry diseases that are seen in the bodies of men, for when you compare the body of a man with the humidity of his body to the completion of fire, you find the body of a man cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say concerning this discourse that I have already experienced several times in my practice
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	I do not say that I have explained all that has been said about that already exists and is practiced in the chapter on cautery after practice, and knowing the diversity of the humors of men and the disposition of diseases in them, and their causes, their accidents, and the passage of time in them
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other completions, it is not a matter of fear for you, and especially in cold and humid diseases, for all doctors have already agreed on that, and they do not disagree concerning the use of cautery in those diseases
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And you know, children, that the secret of treating cautery with fire and the gentleness of it is that fire is simple, and its action reaches only the part that is cauterized and does not affect the other part that is adjacent to it except for a small document.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	And the action of treating with fire for inflammation reaches only that part of the limb from which it is cauterized, and it makes the painful part of the disease of difficult healing come out more easily
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Therefore fire, for its sublimity and its gentle nature, does not do anything other than what we already know through experience and through the length of our studies concerning the art of truth about the causes; and for this reason I am excused from the length of this discourse because it is not legible to me in this place in this book the secret which is hidden with fire, and the quality of the operation of it in the bodies and the expulsion of the disease which it expels, as it is demonstrated in philosophical discourse.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And you know, children, that they disagree about the time when it is convenient to make incisions and when it is best to wait.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that the cautery is convenient at all times, so that for the accidental time it is immersed in the nourishment of that which I call the cautery, which is shot, and more so if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong and fiery, which do not suffer delay so that it is feared of those which come with malice, which is greater than a small nourishment entering for the time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And I say that it is not necessary to burn other parts of the body, or, fools, those vulgar people and foolish doctors, so that to that disease which is cured by the cautery, it is not ridiculous all the time, and they stop that consequence.</end_of_turn>
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not thus that they say, because the cautery is nothing but a remedy in place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries the humors which are the cause of these pains.</end_of_turn>
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	More however the cautery surpasses medicine by its delight and worth and greatness of its operation.</end_of_turn>
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that your disease will return at some time, according to the complexion of the disease and the location of the disease, and the worth of them, and what is prepared in the body of them by the gathering of the superfluities in them, and what is obtained by them in their acquisition in food and the like of those causes; but the disease in which cautery is administered is a subtle disease in a few superfluities and humors, just as if it were cautery of a tooth for pain and the like of that, possible is that in them the said pain does not return, even though it is made small.</end_of_turn
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it may be said vulgarly that the cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and is a miraculous thing, not as those understand it, because they grow that it is not a cure that makes use of either medicine or any other cause except the cautery itself.</end_of_turn
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and the understanding that the cautery is the last remedy of medicine is true only when they administer the methods of healing in certain diseases, and those medicines do not confer, and therefore in the end of the cause they administer man cautery, and make use of that.</end_of_turn
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And indeed it is said that the cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the understanding which the vulgar people and fools doctors have of it.</end_of_turn
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And I say that the ancients said that the cautery with gold is better than the cautery with iron, and I do not say anything but for the equality of the gold and the fineness of its substance.</end_of_turn
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And I say that the place of the cautery does not make it weak, as it is not absolutely true, for I have already seen that it does no harm to any other part, and that the cautery with gold is better than that with iron, as they say; however, when you make cautery with gold and fire, it is not your will that is the cause, for it is ignited according to the quantity you wish for the roughness of the gold, and that prepares to receive heat; and if you mix them over the fire the gold will be consumed by the fire, and if you do not mix them well some plates will be left unburned because the artist will take up the space of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this reason the cautery with iron must be made more lightly and more cautiously of the operation.</end_of_turn
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on the cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those from the head downwards, so that I may relieve the seeker of what he demands of me.</end_of_turn>
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of the cautery of head pain for coldness and humidity.</end_of_turn
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.</end_of_turn
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers on coldness and humidity about the accidental cause of which it gives rise, so it is the cause of soda and multiple fluxes rheumatic, applied to the head to the flanks of the heels and the swelling fluent, and multiple sleeplessness, and toothache and swelling of the tonsils, and universally of all diseases that come from coldness, even as paralysis, hydrophobia and apoplexy, and it is similar in these diseases.</end_of_turn
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The way of this cauterization is as follows: first command the patient to evacuate with laxatives for three or four nights, according to the excess of the virtue of the disease and the age of the patient and his custom.</end_of_turn
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to raise his head on a razor, and do that between his thighs on a fallen bench and that he rest his hands on his feet.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then stop the shaving of your palm near the bulge under the nose between the knees.</end_of_turn
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	May it be so, since the physician has said of the said limb that it has arrived, signify that limb at the source of the pain, and immediately apply the cautery with olive oil of the kind mentioned.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And immediately suspend that over the limb which is causing the pain, in such a way that it descends gradually, with your hand tightly clasped around it, and you rotate that
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And immediately lift your hand slightly and support the limb, and if you see any quantity of bone exposed whatever its quantity, as much as a grain of wheat, elevate your hand, and if you do not turn your hand back at that point, at another, if it is cold, until the bone is seen again as I have said to you
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And immediately take a little salt and dissolve it on the limb and keep it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And immediately suspend over the wound the edge bound by a border and keep it there until the burn mark of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And immediately treat the limb with tetracycline until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And I say that when the wound remains open, take honey from the brace, because it is better and more helpful
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	I say that the bone must be cauterized until it reaches the bone, and that the cautery must be kept on until all parts of the substance of the bone are solidified.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And immediately let there be rest that is appropriate for the bone, and immediately cure it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And I say that the cautery must reach the posterior part of the limb, so that in front of the bone it should strengthen the price in front of the bone rather than weakening it. This is the form of small alphbetization:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they consider that from that limb the vapor of the head escapes
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the wound remains open for a long time, and immediately cure it when it is solidified
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I do not see these two kinds of cautery in all my life, except for a few fools according to their way of thinking; and leave that, for me, is better for health, when it is; because the head is developed by the solution of continuity of its like in other members, and especially when the head of the patient is of fiery nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first kind of cautery is better and more helpful for me; and from that one here and from that work I find health.
Capitol segon.	End of document.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in the whole head chronic pain occurs for a long time and the disease is prolonged, and it uses herbs, poultices, cataplasms, plasters, butter, millet, garlic, vinegar, and radish, and especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery which they count on and which does not benefit it from those causes, then consider that if the head of the disease has great fiery nature; and it is not fiery nor does it find great cold, then cauterize with another cautery leaving a little space between them.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And immediately cauterize that over the joint of the heel with the cautery until the bone is fractured
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the bone and uncover from the bone the quantity that we have recounted and cauterize that with a cautery in the posterior part of the head in the area where wind is stopped.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And move your hand away from there, and do not uncover the bone, because the disease from this will find great pain other than the pain of all the other cauteries of the head
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	I say this cautery in its place, because the cautery of the corn of the head and the occiput is more subtle than that of the middle part of the head; and this is its form

De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of ancient cauteries.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is pain all over the head, or widespread pain in the heel, evacuate with medicines the head slightly flexible, and administer the other treatment which I have mentioned in the sections on diseases; and all this without benefit, for the cauterization in this case is in two ways: either with acute burning medicine or with a burn
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	The cautery with burning medicine is that you take a spoonful of alum, and sprinkle that on and remove the extremities of it from both heads
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And immediately prick the area of the pain in the temple with a lancet so that the bone is left visible

And now stretch over them and stop the constriction, and leave it for three hours; then remove it and bring it close, and leave the wound covered for two or three days, and then rest over it until the limb makes a brace.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And do the same until it is healed
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	If you wish, faith that many medicines which I have written in the previous treatise of medicinal remedies will combat these.</start_of_turn>

e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called closed nails, because its head is like a nail with a curvature, and in the middle of the limb there is a small protrusion.</start_of_turn>

And rest upon the place of the pain, and hold your hand — so that the wound which is left does not adhere — and slowly withdraw the needle little by little.</start_of_turn

De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cautery of antique embolism.</start_of_turn

When you have cured the embolism as we have said of the preceding treatment, and as we have said in the divisions of diseases, and you do not take advantage of the treatment, and sometimes for the disease that does not reach that which we have said of the first cautery with medicine or of the cautery with fire, when you light the cautery of the cuticle until it is whitened, since it signifies over the limb where the pain is in the line of length of which is the majority of the finger, or whatever; keep your hand still for a moment and stretch it until you have incised the artery and reached the bone.</start_of_turn
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme. Capitol .vi.	Chapter six.</start_of_turn
De cauterizacio de turtura.	From cautery of the torus.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	The torus which is cured and by cautery is nothing other than the specious things which cause swelling, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.</end_of_turn>
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cautery of the specious thing which must be dry or which causes spasm of the nerve.</end_of_turn>
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you have cured that specious torus of boils and carbuncles and abscesses, and you have completed the treatment, do not touch the cure, for at that time you must cauterize the patient three times: the first to remove the root of the abscess, the second a little beyond the temporal bone, and the third to join the two lips together.</end_of_turn
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And leave the cautery point untouched for the opposite of the affected part, for it does not matter except for the part that appears to be well.</end_of_turn
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the way of cautery is that you cauterize that which is at the root of the limb above a small amount over the head of the toe, and in the temple another, the length of which is according to the length of the finger which you are pointing to, and withdraw your hand from the cautery until the quantity of the matter of the species of the heel has been consumed.</end_of_turn
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, and it is of the surgeon, the form of which is like a table.</end_of_turn
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	More importantly, it is better to leave a little less rather than too much; and cover with it of excessive thickness a little.</end_of_turn
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area like that which is denant proceeds until it is healed.</end_of_turn

De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of cautery of melancholy
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humors and great inflammation, then cauterize that which we have said is to paralyze
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio. De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of cautery of water descending in the sweat

E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I saw that the knowledge which is in the extraction of arteries and the abstinence from those and caution of fluxes of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And each vein is cauterized at the root of two bones with two cauteries that are produced immediately.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the cautery of ancient tears
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears of the eyes are ancient, that is to say when they have been accumulating for a long time through veins and arteries that are in the visible part of the head and it is confirmed that these are useless fatty drools, then cauterize that which we recounted in the chapter on the commencement of water concerning the veins in the eyes, and at the middle of the head and at the two temples, and two cauteries at the root of two bones
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you disagree with the addition, then cauterize that in all the breadth of the heel on the edge of the nail with a small cautery
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of the cautery of the smell of the nose
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When your physician has said what we have said in the division and does not benefit from your medicine, then you appear and give to the patient to drink for three nights; and approach his head and cauterize that which is between the two humps and the olive
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And approach cauterizes that which is between the two nails with two cauteries over the two nails of the hair a little.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And take care that you do not burn the vessels that you do not burn those
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And concerning the cautery of the nail this is the form
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of the cautery of the softening of the eyelids of the eyes
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by disease or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery of this kind; and this is the way to do it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you do, cauterize that over the two eyebrows a little with two cauteries throughout, and let them stretch from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the quantity of the eyebrow
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too much your hand with the cautery, but as much as the third part of the eyelid is adhered
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of the cautery of the eyelid of the eye when it turns to black spots and turns the eye purple
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the spots of the eye are converted to black spots even if you prick the eye, cauterize in those two ways, that is either with the cautery or with medicine that burns.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you do the cautery with fire, command the patient to drink something that softens the eyes as those which cause them to swell up, until they are prolonged and equal; and if you prick that, you must strengthen the eyes of the patient with a bandage so that they are not painful until the spots disappear
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Therefore when they are prolonged and equal, the physician should remove the patient's head from the bed and approach the eyes of the patient with the tweezers, with a signal that is like the figure of a dead fern, and let the beginning of the signal be near the spots
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And approach pause in sponge soaked in vinegar or in mucus of herbs on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And approach cauterize in this way.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And approach cauterize over the signal which you have given, little by little, in soft veins, until the surface of the wound which is like a dead fern is completely consumed, that is to say like a fern leaf, all in appearance properly
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of the healing of the wound is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracting and the spots of the eye already raised beyond the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	Therefore raise your hand and leave it there for three days, and approach pause over it with a border until the scar is healed
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And approach take care of that until it is healed
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if it returns for any reason approach strengthen the eye again and the eyelid is softened, then do another cautery over that all just as you did at the beginning.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	May it be so that if they are pressed in the palm of their hand, then cauterize that which is elevated to the natural locus and is equal, and that they may not put out the smell.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	May the cautery be as with medicine, for it commands the patient to rest the pain within that it is prolonged and equal, and then make a burn of paper like the shape of a myrtle leaf.</end_of_turn>
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And take from saffron with wine a little bit. namely.</end_of_turn> Or what, mix those things together, and make a fomentation so that it is not heated; and spread that on the paper which is made like a myrtle leaf, and put a cover over the smell or both; put the patient's head in the gut in a basin of water, and the chief of the patient is in the belly.</end_of_turn>
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And say about the medicine and put a little on it so that the patient does not feel the bitterness of the medicine, for the bitterness is in them like fire.</end_of_turn
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when you perceive that the other bitterness has passed, then read the medicine and do not put it on the belly as you were told; when the bitterness has passed, then remain the medicine and wash the smell with water; and when you consider that the palm is already lifted like that which is washed after the constriction with fire or incision, for the palm is thus good; and if it does not return from the medicine on the place where you did not put the medicine and did not burn it until the operation is complete and the smell is contracted.</end_of_turn>
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And so rest over the wound until the swelling of the wound has passed away, and care for that which is painful in the morning or at another time until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you to know that you must keep an eye on the wound so that no more medicine falls out of the wound, and if the palm is somewhat bruised for several days, that any cause of the pain in the palm is softened, the doctor shall repeat the medicine on that place where the palm is softened, just as you did at the beginning, and in this way you will do away with the cause of the pain.</end_of_turn
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the shape of a myrtle leaf.</end_of_turn>
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you know that the humors of men are diversified according to their magnitude and their smallness, and therefore according to what is useful for your contraction.</end_of_turn
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not be ashamed of the way things are done in this art.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.</end_of_turn>
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cauterization of the fistula which is in the tear duct of the eye.</end_of_turn
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you cure the fistula with that which we have said in the divisions of the diseases and you do not confer your care, then you must know that you must cauterize that in the following manner: command the patient to rest their head on the belly, and keep their head supported by any attendant between the thighs in such a way that it is neither too tight nor too loose on the head.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And do so put the heel in a basin of water or in mucus on the palm of the hand.</end_of_turn
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And so burn with the cautery which is like this:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is convex, like the shape of a tube or like a scorpion's tail, from one extremity to the other where the cautery is applied.</end_of_turn
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you want, penetrate through to the other extremity.</end_of_turn
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish, come out like that which is trying.</end_of_turn
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, that which is convex is better for the work.</end_of_turn
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And if the fistula is open, then press on it to bring it to health and dry that.</end_of_turn
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it up and extract the pus from it.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And so rest over the wound for a little while after you have cauterized, so that your hand does not become numb or the patient is not disturbed, and then remove the cautery from the palm of the hand and cover the wound.</end_of_turn
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning of the treatment the cautery went through the bone, that is well; but if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice more, if necessary; and leave that for three days, and then rest over that wound near the border and send for it to be dried until it is healed.</end_of_turn
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If he has remained ill for several days and is not cured, then immediately suspend aggressive treatment until the bone is exposed and treated as you deem appropriate in the chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	Another method of cautery for fistula is as follows: enter the fistula and cut through it, then immediately stop at the root of the fistula. The amount of blood that escapes is insignificant; hold your hand firmly over the wound to prevent further bleeding, and do not cause the patient additional pain by causing more bleeding. Cover the wound with a cloth soaked in urine or water, as the blood will adhere to the fistula and promote healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	If the fistula is healed with the cautery and care described previously, that is sufficient; but if not, it is necessary to administer treatment through the nose and reduce the fistula to its proper location
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.</start_of_turn>
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Concerning the cautery of the wound.</start_of_turn>
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Motes of blood often accompany wounds, especially in children.</start_of_turn
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those wounds as we have said in the divisions and do not neglect your care, it is necessary to make a small incision according to this method:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And the curvature of the incision according to the thickness of the skin.</start_of_turn
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Immediately stop the bleeding around the wound as soon as the cautery reaches the bottom of the wound.</start_of_turn
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the wound until it is healed.</start_of_turn
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.</start_of_turn
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Concerning the cautery of a fistula in the mouth.</start_of_turn
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the wisdom of the uvula or on the palate or on the wisdom teeth there is an abscess and the swelling is great, and it is ruptured, and it is softened, and the fistula is formed, and you do not neglect the treatment, then you must ignite the cautery according to the amount of pus received in the fistula, and put that flame into the cavity of the fistula, and hold your hand over it until the flame reaches the bottom, and after that remove it with some blood clots; and take care of the wound as we have said concerning the treatment until it is healed.</start_of_turn
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	Therefore, if the abscess is simple and the wound is healed, that is sufficient; but if not, it is necessary to uncover the location and remove the corrupted bone as we will explain in the chapter.</start_of_turn
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.</start_of_turn
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Concerning the cautery of the teeth and the softening of the veins.</start_of_turn
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the veins are softened by humidity and the teeth are blackened, and you treat them with medicines and do not fear them, then immediately suspend the treatment in the bowels of the patient, and immediately ignite the cautery in the shape that will be useful, while you keep your hand over the tooth until the flame reaches the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And immediately remove your hand, and repeat the cautery a few times as you wish.</start_of_turn
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And keep the patient's mouth filled with salt water and keep it there for an hour, and then remove it, because the blackened tooth is calmed and the softened gum is strengthened and the corrupted humidity is dried up.</start_of_turn
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.</start_of_turn
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Concerning the cautery of toothache.</start_of_turn
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When the toothache is caused by cold, or if it is hot or does not respond to treatment with medicine, then the cautery can be performed in two ways: either by cautery around the tooth or by cautery with fire.</start_of_turn
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery around the tooth is to take the edge of the cow and put it into a crucible of iron, and take hold of the tooth with your hand and cover it with the edge of the cow, and immerse it in the cold, and immediately stop the bleeding around the tooth until it is cooled.</start_of_turn
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat the process a few times until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.</start_of_turn
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	Or if you wish, immerse cloth or cotton in the blood of the said limb and put it on the painful tooth, and keep that over the flame until the flame reaches the bottom of the tooth.</start_of_turn
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	The fire of the cautery must be strong enough to consume the quannula of fat or iron, even if there is any roughness in the body of the patient, for the intensity of the flame should not reach the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	The fire of the cautery must be strong enough to consume the shape of which it comes, and keep that over the tooth and hold your hand there until the cautery is cool; and do whatever vegetables are necessary so that the pain may subside on this day or on another day.</end_of_turn>
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And so it must be commanded that the patient open their mouth wide with good will and keep it open for an hour, and then close it; this is the way of the cautery.</end_of_turn>
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And burn as much as you can of the extremities according to your ability.</end_of_turn>
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is the way of the cannula:</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.</end_of_turn>
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of the cautery of extrusions.</end_of_turn>
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrusions are caused by cold humors and do not obey digestion by medicines, you must cause digestion of those lightly by fire. The fire must consume the shape of this, having two limbs covered so that the smoke does not reach the other limb, and keep the flame over that limb for a while, and do the same with the other if necessary, until the pain has passed the root of the limb.</end_of_turn
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the swelling is slight, keep the cautery away from the quantity of the swelling, and apply pressure to it for three days and keep your hand over it covered in fat until it has subsided the amount that the fire has consumed.</end_of_turn
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And take care of that which is burnt and tense and wrinkled until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the form of the cannula or give the cautery in such a way as to convey it.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.</end_of_turn
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of the cautery of the root of the tongue and of the constriction of the throat.</end_of_turn
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity is over the root of the lung, and especially when it is cold air, the patient must be evacuated with laxatives at the beginning with medicines, and then burn that which is beyond the root of the tonsil in the recessed part.</end_of_turn
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	Beware that you do not reach the tonsil with the cautery or burn the edge of it but only a little.</end_of_turn
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And burn that which is beyond the other burn beyond the joint of the colon at the back of the vertebra of the spine.</end_of_turn
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	The burn of the spine must be like that described above.</end_of_turn
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And take care of that which is before until it is healed.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIV.</end_of_turn
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	Of the cautery of the lung disease and cough.</end>
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are caused by cold humors and the patient has no fever or sweating and is old disease, then burn twice on the furcula in the recessed parts around the tonsils and below; and once in the middle of the foot between two nipples; and do the burn like that described above.</end_of_turn
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, make the burn with the cautery that is called punctate, the form of which you will find in the puncture of pain of the heel.</end_of_turn
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And give them punctures among those; and take care of that which is before until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And already the burn has three steps that the burn is in that one: one time you can make three burns according to this form.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.</end_of_turn
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	Of the cautery of the titillic which is the head of the assistant.</end_of_turn
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the assistant is displaced due to oily humidity and is not fixed at the time of harvest must be removed until it is accustomed to return, and in a small movement it is loosened as much as necessary, as we have testified, the patient must be instructed to reduce the displacement first, and then turn the patient over on the seat or on the side; and lift the heel which is in the armpit of the assistant towards the parts below which are on the side of your left hand if the joint is displaced towards the armpits.</end_of_turn
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	Then ignite the cautery twice without covering its head; this is the way to do it.
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	Then ignite the cautery twice without covering its head; this is the way to do it. And when it penetrates to the other side, the cautery figure will be that of four cauteries.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	and so adjust according to the quantity; and this is the way to do it.
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	Every burn is adjusted according to this count and because they are eight cauteries
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat. E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is at the base of the thumb and it is necessary to do so, then cauterize over the muscle under the thumb or over several points of the thumb, so that the joint is stabilized and the moisture is reduced and the patient is healed

De cauterizacio del stomac.	Of the cautery of the stomach.</end_of_turn>
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When there is cold and moisture in the stomach due to the excess of its digestion and if you continue your treatment methods and do not confirm, then it is necessary to place the patient on their side two steps up, extend their limbs and thighs, and then cauterize with three cauteries: on one cautery leave the toes for the quantity of one thumb under the thumb, and on two cauteries leave the two sides of the cautery, until the triangular figure of the cautery appears; and lengthen between those that are not adjusted that will make the pain less painful.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the burn is equal to two-thirds of the thickness of the nail of the thumb
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And the figure of the burn should be as follows: thus proceed with the addition. And if you wish, cauterize with a large cautery in the middle of the stomach as follows; and this is a burn in the shape of a circle as follows:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And cauterize the stomach punctate where it is sensitive from this burn. And that you mark on the stomach point according to the quantity that you wish on the thumb, and then cauterize at those points; and care for that which precedes until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter XXVVII.</end_of_turn>
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	Of the cautery of the painful heel.</end_of_turn
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When there is pain in the heel due to cold, moisture or excessive wind compared to the normal expulsion of the bowels, and it is cured by what we have said and without confirming, then it is necessary to place the patient supine on their neck, and mark with three cauteries as follows and with this quantity on the heel beyond the hip bones, between the heel bone and the malleolus.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And the space between each cautery should be according to the thickness of the thumb, and the cauteries should be according to the length of the bone to be treated
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	Do not press on the cauteries too much.</end_of_turn>
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the quantity of the liquid that is poured out is equal to the amount of the nail of the thumb, do not adjust it further; and if the patient is standing on their feet, if it is not standing, then be still, which has already extended their thighs, and lift the knees high.</end_of_turn
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	This is the shape of the burn:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And you may possibly cauterize these cauteries with a pointed cautery, when it is in your skill and prudence in the art.</end_of_turn
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And beware that you do not process too much in the cautery, and that you cover the entirety of the stomach so that the whole body is cauterized and reaches the intestines, for the stomach is subtle here; and take care that you do not burn it.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVVIII.</end_of_turn
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	Of the perforation of the heel abscess with a cautery.</end_of_turn
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When there is an extrusion or abscess in the heel and you wish to know if that abscess is in the bone of the heel or in the membrane of it, then if it is in the bone of the heel, the pain is intense and the swelling is increased.</end_of_turn
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the membrane of the heel, with great pain which often exhausts the doctors in their care of it.</end_of_turn

E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And burn until the whole area is covered, until it reaches the cartilage, until the wound is healed.

E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And do not use this method of cautery except for those whom we have studied in the art of medicine, and in whom many bad diseases have been overcome; for in this case, if you experiment too much with this operation, you will cause more harm than good.

De cauterizacio de plauresi.	Of the cautery of the sole of the foot.</start_of_turn>
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	I say that the ancient cautery of the roots of the aristology towards the sole of the foot is done in this manner; take from the roots of the aristology a long dry stick which is found, and which is of the thickness of the finger.</start_of_turn

E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And do not put your hand over the cautery, but rather in the manifestation of the heel in work.</start_of_turn
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And I say that the ancient people used cautery of iron similar to a ray and fire, and put that in that place which is between the ribs, until we reach that cartilage and it is healed, as we have said concerning the heel of the foot.</start_of_turn

De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	Of the cautery of the heel.</start_of_turn
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you have cured the disease of the heel according to what we have said in the division, and you do not confer your care, then the hour of cautery comes in three ways, which are all useful, namely that you make three or four lines according to the length of the heel according to the figure of the cautery needles of the foot, the figure of which has preceded.</start_of_turn

E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And bring together the two supports, ignite once, in that place where we have pierced the heel of the other side.</start_of_turn
