De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	Of cautery of the thigh near the abscess of their loin

Capitol .xxxvi.	If you burn with a large cautery on something, it is more dangerous in judgment.</start_of_turn>
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	When you burn fistulas that are useful in nature, it makes them worse in the parts of the body.</start_of_turn
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the work that we have recommended in its place, and the patient is terrified by it, whether he is healthy or sick.</start_of_turn
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore, when one sees a fistula in nature that is old, corroded by blood and corrupted humors, and it is more deserving than anything else to be treated with caution, and it is to be performed with great care.</start_of_turn
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Therefore, use the cautery that is similar to a ray.</start_of_turn
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And use that cautery ignited in this fistula, according to the amount with which the tenta is intertwined.</start_of_turn
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And repeat over that until those corrupted parts are burned to a reddish hue, two or three times, according to the amount of your need.</start_of_turn
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant. De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cautery of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When there is pain in the ankle area, caused by cold and humidity, the disease is cured with what has been said and not confirmed, and when it is old, then you must keep the patient away from humors which come from solid pills or artificial pills or something similar; and then cauterize that.</end_of_turn>
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the manner of cautery in this case is according to two manners: either with medicinal substances that burn, or with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat. E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	And do not evacuate the disease well-regulated and with the reception of medicines, for if it is well-regulated and inflamed, it is evacuated with this cautery without any other remedy, God helps.</end>

De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Capitol .xlv.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When there is a rupture in the joints and saying the bones are loosened from the skin towards the genitals, and when this is imminent, then you must order the patient to lie down and use soft cushions so that the wound coming from the belly will stop bleeding.

Capitol .xlvii.	Capitol xlvii.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	Capital xlvii. - From the cautery of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	The books many times cauterize with a great instrument, and indeed if the species of leprosy that is caused by putrefaction of fat and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And therefore when you want to cauterize it, consider if the leprosy is common or rare and cured by what we have said in the division and do not burn, neither this, and fear over the illness that the corruption comprehends all the body of the patient and all the entirety of it, for when you cauterize it over the head with two cautery instruments: one in the middle of the head, and the second at the back of the head, over the eyebrows; and two over the ears; and one behind, over the nape or servant.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally put your hand over the cautery a a little distance from the bone so that the scales are loosened from it, so that the exhalation of thick vapors is alleviated from it; and cauterize over the belly as much as is necessary.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy has already spread over the illness and appears obvious, then it is necessary that you cauterize that with those same cautery instruments which we said on the head; and cauterize over the root of the nose, and two cautery instruments over the two big toes, and two cautery instruments over two vertebrae of the collarbone, and six cautery instruments over the vertebrae of the chest, and one large one over the vertebrae close to the navel, and one over the navel, and two over the ankles, and two over the muscles, and two the nails of the fingers; and cauterize that over all the joints of the fingers and toes, and over each nail of the fingers and toes, and over the hair of the head.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And guard yourself from the nerves which are over the heel that you do not burn those.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And many are cauterized with a cautery instrument over the bone of the thumb and another over the mouth of the stomach, and another over the heel bone.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And you know that when you adjust many cautery instruments, it is more beneficial and safer; and you know that the illness does not feel pain in the cautery, just as before, for the body is already stupefaied
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And you know that the cautery instruments must be large or small according to the limbs and joints as it precedes the qualities of the instruments
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the cautery with flour of barley and oil and another care that it is healthy.

De cauterizacio de corrodent.	From the cauterization of the corrodents.</start_of_turn>
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	A corrodent is a wandering corruption in the limb, which consumes that as if with fire it consumes dry wood.</start_of_turn

Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore when such an accident happens, you must immediately place your hand over the opening of the artery, and pause until blood flow from the wound has ceased, and that no more blood comes out.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And immediately stop the bleeding with fine and coarse cauteries, several in number, and cool over those until they are no longer ignited.</end_of_turn
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And immediately take from those a little or a great one according to the place and the ulcer from which the artery is broken, over that vein tightly hold back the bleeding until it has been closed and that blood flow has ceased.</end_of_turn
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the wound is extruded from the opening of the artery when you have closed the vein and squeezed the cauteries, then take another cautery immediately alongside the previous ones which are prepared in the fire, and do not cease until the wound is closed.</end_of_turn
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And take care that you do not burn the nerves that are here, and that you go on to another illness over the patient.</end_of_turn
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And you must know that when an artery bursts, it is not possible to restrict the wound, and more so when the artery is large, except for one of four methods: either a cautery as we have said, or an extirpation when it is not extracted, or when it is extracted the limbs are burnt and the wound is closed, or that it is bound with thread or ligature to make a strong structure, or that it is held with medicines which have the property of restricting the wound; and that it is bound with powder or constriction downwards.</end_of_turn
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But indeed those who administer decent restriction downwards with thread and stricture with cloths or by position of the causes burn rather than comfort.</end_of_turn
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if this happens when the physician is not present or the medicine is not available, then you must order the opening of that vein immediately as we have said, and understand with great attention the extent of the wound until the wound has completely separated from the ulcer, and that the artery is not clotted; and that over the artery you should sprinkle with cold water of great coldness until the wound is closed and hardened; and indeed do everything that is necessary for the cautery or the medicine.</end_of_turn
Comensa la segonda partida.	(The provided text for the second part is not included in the prompt.)</start_of_turn>
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Concerning incisions and perforations and wounds and phlegmas and their similarities.</end_of_turn
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These words are from Albucazi.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter that in all diseases in which the cautery is convenient and helpful, and the causes and occasions of these, and the instruments necessary for them, are to be set out in their proper order in the following chapters up to and including the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And I shall proceed in this chapter concerning that matter which has been requested, so that what is desired may be relieved, as regards that concerning which demand has been made
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And since I am about to speak of it, know that in this chapter is to be feared that which is in the first chapter of cautery.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And for that reason it is necessary to take great care, because in this operation there are many things which may cause evacuation of the intestines or the loosening of the bowels, which is dangerous for life, because of the bursting of a vein or incision on the abscess or opening of an ulcer or emptying of the plague or extraction of a splinter or incision of a stone.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	All these things are accompanied by fear and trembling and in most of them death is imminent.<end_turn>
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I admonish you that you should not attempt anything in this matter which is beyond your capacity, for there are many things which may cause you to behave like madmen or like those who are mad with diseases.</start>
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	Therefore, it is better for you to depart from your disease than to die from it, and to help the gentleness of what you find in your disease, and for the length of your disease, and for the fear of the disease which signifies death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And these are the things which I have said to you before and will say, hoping for your salvation, and your speedy recovery from your disease.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	Therefore you should not consent to anything which is beyond your power; and your caution should be greater than your desire and your presumption about anything should not be made except for that which has certain knowledge which is useful to you and for which you have good reason to believe it will be successful
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the treatment of all these maladies the prognosis and the indication of them to which health is converted, because in that is to you the helper in the acquisition of fame and glory, of love and praise, and of lasting fame
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, children, God is with you and will teach you and direct you and protect you, for he is in your hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have ordained this chapter separately from the chapter of cautery, concerning the care of the head up to and including the feet, so that what you desire concerning what you need from what is above and what is below may be relieved
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the care of water which is contained in the head of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	It is known that this disease is not without danger to children, for it is when the wet nurse opens the head of the child that life is taken from him.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And many times the cause of this is a hidden one which is not known
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	I have not seen this disease except in children; and in all those whom I have seen it, death has been imminent, and for this reason I have been left desolate in this matter
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that a child whose head was filled with water, and whose head was always so swollen that he could not support himself, even when carried, until he died, and that the moisture increased until death.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	Or it is accumulated between the marrow and the bone, or between the bones over the cartilage
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	For if the moisture is between the marrow and the bone and the abscess is slight, then you must make a wound in the middle of the head with a fissure two fingers wide, until the moisture runs out, and this is the form of the cautery
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And if the moisture is greatly increased and the abscess is large, then two wounds must be made according to this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	If the moisture is outside the bones, this is an indication that you have eaten too much of the head and the water is squeezed out when you press with your thumb against the parts around it, and this is not the moisture which is hidden away
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	You must make three wounds in the middle of the head according to this manner:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And remove all the moisture from the incision; and strengthen the wounds with strips and cushions; and pour wine and oil over the wound until the fifth day; and then remove the ligature and care for the wound with sponges and compresses, and strengthen the head equally; and feed the patient with dry food of little moisture until the limb is healed and healthy
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	E es otra manera de incisión, que consideras hon la magnitud del apostema y la colección del agua, porque algunas veces la vejez es mayor en el occipicio, o en la parte denante, o en la derecha, o en la izquierda; y por tanto atención a la incisión donde aparece el apostema y la repleción del agua, y fén aquo según que a tú es más posible.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	Observe that you must not cut the artery, and that when the blood flows out freely from the wound, it brings relief to the patient by evacuating the humidity.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Regarding the incision of the arteries that are close to the heel, these are called hilasse vessels.
Capitol segon.	Chapter III
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When there are boils or carbuncles on the heel or foot, and it has been a long time, and one does not trust in the healing power of medicines, then the best cure in this case is the incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	Therefore cover when you want to make the incision so that the patient does not feel pain, and bring a rough sponge to the area to expose the arteries, and strengthen the patient's chest against the pain; and consider where the vein is located.  And the places where any of these are close to the heels depressed, and do not uncover anything except for a few bones.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And do the same with regard to the surrounding area, and make the incision of each part that is acutely painful at the incision to reach the bone, and do this for the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you wish, you can remove the surrounding tissue and tie off the artery at the incisions of the parts above
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And the length of the incision should be two fingers wide, because when any vein is incised the blood is ejected with a pulsatile flow, which leaps up frequently.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	More if the artery does not appear at the incision, however cover that you measure the heel to determine the amount of space of three fingers, and do the same with regard to the surrounding area, and do this until you reach the bone
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And what you must gather of the blood is the amount of a thumb and a little finger.<end_turn> and do not take too much or too little, but as much as appears from the virtue of the patient and the replenishment of the artery in them.<end_turn>
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And consider the plague, and therefore if anything remains on the bone of any cause of swelling, then do the incision so that no abscess arises from the cautery.<end_turn
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And strengthen the swelling with sponges and with silk thread of silk, and care for that which is within until it is healed.<end_turn
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Regarding the extraction of the arteries that are in the temples<end_turn>
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When ancient or acute boils or abscesses occur due to agricultural humidity or for the quality of the lacerations of the temples, or so ancient and resembling those, and when these cannot be cured by the methods of medical treatment, then we must resort to the extraction of the arteries in the temples or to the cauterization of those in this way as we have shown.<end_turn
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the manner of the operation and extraction of those is that the patient should support those that are in the temples; and understand that the artery that appears in the temple is the one that you have shown by the mark, and that it is hidden except for a few bones due to the intensity of the heat.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden, then strengthen the patient's chest with some support; and bring a rough sponge or evaporate the area with warm water until the artery appears clearly.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then you take hold of the sponge in this way:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And you grasp the thumb with your thumb and index finger and grasp the skin with your middle and ring fingers, and extract that which is above until you extract that from the heel and uncover that from the tunic which is left behind, from all parts.<end_turn
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	And if the artery is small, then you wrap that around the end of the toe, and make an incision of that part according to the extent to which the toes are swollen and contracted, and do not cut the blood supply, for if it is not cut it will not cure the blood of all the parts.<end_turn
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And evacuate blood from the thumb and a little finger. End of book.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	If the wound is large, it is necessary to ligate it in two places with strong silk or strong thread, and do not close it up until the pus has dried up and the wound has consolidated.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And immediately reduce the excess which is between two ligaments; and do so at that moment or at another convenient time.</end_of_turn>
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you wish, cauterize that which is within the bone within the bone cavity before the extremities are incisions are made, and stop that work in place of that matter.</end_of_turn>
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	It is better work when the patient has a fever or is suffering from scalded complexion; because the cautery is of those causes which aid the drying humors, and therefore is better in judgment.</end_of_turn
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	Cover also the extraction of the arteries that you see in the place of the old wound, and keep them covered with fine powder adequately made, and do so either with herbs or dry medicines which cause the flesh to swell and become soft until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while working another one sees the flow of blood from the artery, then in that hour you must restrict that blood, or the cautery, or that which fills the wound, and hold your hand over that place until the bleeding is stopped.</end_of_turn
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if for no other reason you are not present, then suspend the bleeding from the wound until the blood has congealed, and cover the wound with lukewarm water until the acute pain has ceased, and strengthen as much as you can.</end_of_turn
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And what is more curious in the extraction of an artery is that you cauterize the vein at this point having two hooks, because you have marked the two places at the attempt, and you have stopped any other, except for fire, until the bone is reached and the vein is divided in two places, so that it is elongated what is between the extremities of them, which are not consolidated at all by this cautery.</end_of_turn>
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	This is the form of the cautery:</end_turn
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And the sharpness of the two hooks is equal.</end_turn
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	More importantly, if their sharpness is less than two hooks, it is better, because if their sharpness is too great near any part of the body, it will burn the flesh too quickly.</end_of_turn
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore when there is any thickness, keep the fire's heat in those places and the flesh will be gently separated.</end_of_turn
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	This work is better in all work and lighter.</end_of_turn
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And the space between the two hooks is the quantity of the thickness of the finger.</end_of_turn
Capitol quart.	Chapter four.</end_of_turn>
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the care of the limbs affected by the acute and acid humors of the bones.</end_of_turn
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When the humors are acid, and the veins which are above the head of the tibia are affected, do not consult for any reason about the treatment of medicine, for the face of the patient will already be swollen and will be sitting in the chair like ants, and the bones of that limb will be extended, softened more than they were known to be, and the nails will be scaled by the sharpness of the tears, which is an old custom in the treatment of these operations, and now that treatment is done without space.</end_of_turn
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you command the patient to raise his knees towards you, and immediately make three incisions equally distant according to the length of the face.</end>
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the incision is two fingers: one incision should be equally distant from the length of the nose in the middle of the face, and the second according to the length a little bit below the tear ducts, and the third at the other end.</end_of_turn
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And guard yourself from the cutting of the arteries which are in two places, and lengthen your hand from the continuation of both mandibles.</end_of_turn
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space of each incision is the quantity of three fingers adjusted.</end_of_turn
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a piece of sponge or dry cloth moistened with these which you will use to absorb the blood.</end_of_turn
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And immediately between the two sharp extremities, this is the form of the incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	that is from the root of the temples to the second incision.</end_of_turn>
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio. E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut. Then stop the flow of blood from that blunt end towards the fatty part, and the blood from the loin does not reach the bone. Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	Maybe the incision should be continued until after the loin, and so make the other incision in the middle fissure enter the other fissure.

De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	The care of the eyes for the care of the limbs descends from the parts around the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When to some extent of acute catarrh continues, and sometimes the limbs of the patient extend little, and already with regard to them it is necessary to take care, ulcers appear on the eyelids and their edges become rough, and in the front of the head there is sharp pain and subsequent vomiting, the hours of greatest danger for these accidents are when the matter and the catarrh do not descend from the veins of the parts surrounding the head
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best care for these is this: that you order the patient to rest his front, and so make an incision in the middle of the forehead, a little for the width (and begin with the incision at the left temporal vein going to the right temporal vein; and let the incision be inside the bone; and lengthen your hand from the lacerations of the temples which are bitten by the chewing).

De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	The care of that which is in the ankles.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	Every cause which comes to be in the ankles is of four kinds, either mineral stone or that which seems like stone, such as iron and ivory, or that which is of plant origin such as thistle or bean, or that which is due to flux, such as vinegar and oil agar or something similar
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And therefore when the stone comes to be in the ankle or any other cause similar to these does not adjust or does not grow in the ankle, and stops the ankle from the sun, and if sometimes the stone is ejected in any of these causes of oil and vinegar or something similar, and so administer the extraction of it, and make it vomit with condiment, and pack the wound from the event of vomiting.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And so stop in the circumference of the ankle some parts of fat or bandage, and extend the ankle to the parts above, because the matters which are swollen are forceless with these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not forceless, the hour administer the extraction of it with the instrument called gesti epicicarios subtle of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is swollen with the thumb, well; and if not, the hour administer the extraction of it with an instrument of little duplication.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And therefore if it is not swollen by this, the hour make a canula of gutta and insert the extremity of the canula into the cavity of the ankle and close around the canula with wax and oiled material to prevent it from being torn except for the canula itself
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And so extract with the belly well drawn with great attraction, because strong matters which have been mentioned are seen.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	Maybe if it is not swollen in this way, the hour takes hold of the limb with a cold or wet cloth which has been taken from the armpit, and places it on the extremity of the ray, and so covers over that part conveniently stopped
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And thus we draw out the one in the ankle with ease, and expel the ankle from the moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And if it is not necessary for all of the causes which we have mentioned, then you should restrain the one biting or spitting that is causing the pain of apostema, whether from cautery or spasm.</end_of_turn>
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the way to treat that is to touch the patient’s pulse and extract the cause according to the virtue of the parts, and thus do that which causes the fissure between the bones of the ankle to appear, and make a small incision in the heel of the ankle where the bone is black and soft.</end_of_turn>

And if the fracture is of a crescent shape until it reaches the heel, and the heel is grasped, hold that if possible with appropriate instruments; and do so with speed, and care that it is healed.</end_of_turn

e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	And administer that which is the abscission of that humor which is causing the pain in the ankle.</end_of_turn>

And do not delay when you think that one has already been moistened by the vapor of the ankle, and keep it in soft parts, and thus expel it from those with nails or with a sponge, or as we have said, relief is found in the expulsion of it.</end_of_turn>
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water that enters the ankle, use that the patient should perform a sternutation at the beginning, and fill the ankle with a little bit of old cloth, and place your hand over that ankle in which the water is, and if by this means the pain is not expelled, it is not necessary; but if not, take hold of the patient’s toes and knees according to the length of the finger, and clench them in the fire for a while, and the patient put one of those in the opening of the ankle and jumps on the other foot beside that limb and strikes with the other foot on the foot that is causing the ankle to bend.</end_of_turn>

And indeed when the water has been expelled in this way, take paper or sponge.</end_of_turn And put one extremity in the ankle and extend the other extremity in the fire until the majority of it is burned.</end_of_turn

De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Care for the ointment of the heel.</end_of_turn>
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some mothers of children who have eaten large amounts of food without perforating their bellies, and that which has already happened to some men, should be oiled in the meat of the heel for the plague or for nothing in particular; and this oiling of some is useful in the preon of the heel which does not succeed at once, and some in the outer parts.</end_of_turn
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which happens in the preon of the heel, which does not succeed at once, is in the greatest degree of difficult healing.</end_of_turn
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that in which you succeed at once, cover that you stop the heel of the patient towards the sunlight and rest in that.</end_of_turn
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if sometimes the ointment appears, open that which is the cause of it, which is the fine sand from which this is made.</end_of_turn

Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	The paleness which is caused by the eyes of the heels is sometimes moist, and sometimes dry.</end_of_turn

Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Care for great swelling which occurs in the eyes of the heels.</end_of_turn
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Many causes arise in the eyes of the heels which are assembled to cause swelling in its strength and hardness, and for this reason it is called great swelling.</end_of_turn
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of thick moisture in the inner eyelid and outside.</end_of_turn
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore the operation in them is that you consider whether the swelling is due to the inward part of the eye and is widespread throughout; and the cause is light.</end_of_turn
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore, perform a flank incision over that fissure for the width, and then drain that from all parts easily as it escapes, and suspend that which remains once the other has gone.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	If the incision is not properly performed, or if you penetrate too deeply at once, it is possible that you will cause no damage at all.</end_of_turn>
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the figure is large, adjust it with sutures; and care for it until it is healed.</end_of_turn>

De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	The care of the wound is complete after the washing of the wound area.</start_of_turn
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Grayness is generated in the tunics of the wound from the children, more so in the young, because they cause the hair to fall out and darken it; and it does not prevent the brilliance of the sun because the fat covers them.</start_of_turn
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	Therefore, at times those who are working on the faces do so at all times, and over the faces they sleep; and over their faces they leave their eyebrows wet, which have already covered the inflammation, and the imminent appearance of swelling is on the heel; and that when you press the area with your thumb, you will find swelling within them.</start_of_turn
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	Every manner of operating is in that in which the physician suspends the patient’s head over the belly and grasps his limbs and makes a circle according to the amount of air contained throughout, and suspends that which is above and presses on the thumb of the area to bring about an increase in swelling in the middle of the circle, and then performs the flank incision over that moisture which has descended from the surface of the wound for the width, and the incision is not to be greater than the incision which is made in phlegm.</start_of_turn
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	Therefore, before you complete the incision, that you should have made the swelling throughout reach the swelling, because in the meantime there proceeds swelling of the wound according to the shape of white fat.</start_of_turn
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore, extract that which you have enveloped with the draps between the thumbs and index fingers and rotate between the right and left hands until it is dispersed.</start_of_turn
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And take care that you do not press too tightly in the incision so that the moisture does not reach the wound and remove the covering.</start_of_turn
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	If you do not see the swelling appear at the beginning of the incision, nevertheless, press in the incision a little to facilitate the swelling; and then extract that which we have said; and then cover with a wet cloth and vinegar and place over the area and remove those which are like dust.</start_of_turn
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And so when it is necessary to drain pus from the wound, place it in the concavity of the incision so that what remains of that moisture is absorbed.</start_of_turn
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And care for it until it is healed.</start_of_turn
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	If in the area around the wound there is pus after the cautery, care for that with absorbent dressings until it is healed.</start_of_turn
Capitol .xi.	End of treatise.</start_of_turn>
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Methods of wound care.</start_of_turn
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When in the eyes of the patients the natural tears are born from the adjustment of the eyebrows, then these cause the eyes to water and make various methods of illness appear, such as excessive tears and the softening of the eyebrows and the loosening of the membrane until such time as that which is the cause of the destruction of the eye which is called the tarsus, and care must be taken in four ways: by cautery of the focus; or by acute medicine as is said in the chapter of cautery; or by the application of an astringent for incision and suture; or by cannas as I will say.</start_of_turn
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	Therefore, you must suspend the patient’s head over the belly; convert the thumb of the right hand to your left hand, and if converted, it is not so; otherwise, insert the needle into that place where it is firm from the part of the pus which is left from the eyebrow, and when you have pierced it put your thumb over the part where the tears are born, and convert that which is above into the ray.</start_of_turn
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	The point of the needle should be inserted at the outer corner of the eye, where the lacrimal gland meets the tear duct; then extract the needle and leave a small amount of soot or ash on the eyelid, and press gently over the eye with your thumb, like a leaf of myrtle.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	However, it must be known that the degree of swelling of the eyelid varies between individuals, so that some people require that the larger part of the tear duct be injected according to the degree of swelling.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And thus perform the operation at the place where you have marked the two lines, starting from the major tear duct into the minor one.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if the wound is deep like that of a royal beard.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And place the sponge on one of the two corners of the wound, then remove the whole thing, and with the thumb and index finger of the other hand grasp the two lips and pull them towards the gut or toward the thread, and pull out the intestines, and if you wish, sew up what remains of the intestines over two eyelashes with various stitches, or leave it open as it is.</end_turn>
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And remove the stitches from the intestines within three or four days, and take care of the wound.</end_turn>
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	If you wish, leave the wound open and suture, and take care of it as before, because the swelling of the eyelid is alleviated by the closure of the wound and the adhesion of the edges; in this way there is less need to taxanize.</end_turn
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	However, in this case it is more urgent to address the patient's suffering, and it is a good operation, so do not be afraid.</end_turn
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	Another way of tying is to make a sign on the eyelid like a leaf of myrtle, and to raise the eyelid with three fingers spread apart and gathered together in this way:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	If this is not possible, take hold of the nails, and if they are not blunt, take a needle with a thread and pass the thread through the middle of the sign, and pass the other thread alongside the major tear duct, and the thread alongside the minor tear duct, and adjust between the two threads mentioned above so that they are equal, and then place your hand over the area and elevate the whole wound as much as possible, as we have recommended.</end_turn><end_turn>
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And adjust the two lips of the wound with stitches, and care for the wound until it is healed.</end_turn><end_turn>
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	If after this there should happen to be swelling beyond the wound or the incision, do not be afraid of it, but keep it moistened and clean, and apply ointment.</end_turn><end_turn><end_turn>
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	Every herb that is applied to the eyelid that has become sensitive from the wound should be discontinued, because in this case it is better to use what we have already mentioned regarding the wound; in this way there is less need for stitching.</end_turn><end_turn><end_turn>
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Taxanizing in this way is like this:</start_turn><end_turn><end_turn>
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And you convert the eyelid and split the sign that is inside as I have described; and then make two needles or two fine pins whose length is according to the length of the eyelid and whose width is less than the width of the sponge.</start_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn>
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already pierced at the extremities of each part where you have the threads.</start_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn>
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then add some slight thickness under the excess of the eyelid above, and tighten the pins of each part with great strength, and leave it like that for several days, because the wound will be very painful and will swell, and will probably fall out by itself as soon as it has been tightened.</start_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn>
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	And if it is late, break the stitches at the root of the eyelashes, and care for the wound until it is healed.</start_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn>
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	And thus when it is solidified, the eyelid is elevated and the nails do not penetrate.</start_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn>
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	This is the way to make two needles like this:</start_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn>
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	And there is the quantity of length and width neither more nor less.</start_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn>
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.</start_turn>
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	Of the elevation of the nails in the eye when the skin is tough.</start_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn><end_turn>
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the cause of the pain is unnatural, such as harsh and biting cold, and when the patient cries out due to the pain, it is appropriate to take an awl and pierce the flesh at the navel or below the navel, and immediately seize the extremities so that they do not move in an unnatural way.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And the length of the incision should be as great as the breadth of a palm
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And immediately take two other awls and leave them in their place briefly, and do not touch the extremities of the patient if you wish to do so
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	Then hold the patient's head in the groin, and let the sun be your witness so that your work will be declared, for it is a subtle and minor operation
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	Then insert the needle at the root of the hair adjusted as necessary, and make that penetrate the skin rapidly until you have extracted the foreign matter from the natural hair
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	Then draw out the hair together and insert it into an ointment, and keep it there for a few moments, up to three but no more
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	Then draw your hand over that which has been left behind until the hair is completely expelled with the ointment in the skin of the natural hair
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	More ointment can be applied outside than that which has been applied inside, but do not remove the hair until the ointment has been thoroughly absorbed through the wound.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And when the physician has observed the color of the wound, when the ointment has been applied and the pain has subsided, and when the patient cries out with a groan or cough, let the wound be closed for two or three days, until the hair adheres to the skin and grows out again naturally
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	If the hair is finer than that which is natural, then adjust a hair of a similar length, and elevate it as such, or that you leave it until it has grown out to an equal extent, and when it has grown out, elevate that.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Of the care of the wound which appears in the eye socket
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When the eye is irritated, and the eyelid is contracted when it is stretched to the right or to the left, because of bad consolidation of pus or of a wound or of a burn, and is called leporine, and this can be either natural or accidental, and is useful for consolidating pus or wounds or burns, or for preventing them from becoming worse
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The manner in which to perform the operation is that you make that consolidation and separate the eyelids, and place in them a little piece of lead, and bind them until they are healed
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And do not neglect to apply care to the wound from the causes which cause it, because if you do the pus will return more fiercely than ever before.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use in these cases something that softens, such as fennel, and soak in the water in which they are placed, or ointment of aloe, which is liquefied with some oil, and immerse in that the lead, and care for that
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	The treasure of your care is that you perforate with all skill that is not consolidated in the manner that we formerly did at the beginning
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation that we have mentioned, is nothing other than the rectification of the leporine that does not restore the shape of the eye socket as it was before
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the care of the wound which is useful in the outer part of the eye socket
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	The wound which is useful in the outer part of the eye socket is called vertadierament, and is either natural or accidental
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	More often it is useful for pus or for a wound or for a burn or for other things of that kind
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	The way to perform the operation is that you take a needle in which you make a double thread, and leave that in the flesh, and pass the thread from the left lacrimal sac to the right lacrimal sac, until the thread reaches the two extremities of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	And immediately extend the flesh around the needle with the needle and hold that with the needle, and make an incision at a sufficient distance from the needle
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	Therefore if you restore the figure of the eye socket as it should be, it is well done; but if not, take hold of the thread and stop that in the indented figure, and from that convert the eye socket, and make the two incisions on the side of the outer eye socket.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And the two extremities of the two incisions are at two angles of the incision, which has been made so that when they meet together they form a perfect figure
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	The figure depicted is the Greek letter: lambda.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	Then keep the amount that is in the guts outside of them, so that the pressure is relieved from the pupil
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	Then tighten the separated parts and keep those along the thread of silk; and take care of those as we said of the mollifying medicines and the calamus within which must be health
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if it be necessary to suture for a wound or cautery or puncture, then cover that the wound is made flat over the margin of the pupil as it is said before.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	Then separate the cloth between two lips as it has been said
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the sum of the words of the care of the alxacrati when it is detached or left, that it runs in its operation, according as it is prepared in the manner of alxacrati, and that is in the manner of diverse masses.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the wise artists always prepare an engine in any way possible so that it makes return the figure to its natural form, or in that way, and that disease according to what is convenient for the operation and the instruments in the greatest disposal
Capitol .xv.	End of document
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the adherence of the pupil to the conjunctiva or to the cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When these adhesion happen among many people it is necessary to solidify the pupil more detached from the limb of the pupil, and to prevent the facility of movement and its natural works, therefore cover that you remove the emission of rays from the pupil, and raise it up, or extend it with the nail
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And immediately touch the adhesion with soft sponge, which is not of the sharpness of the incisions, having made obtuse a small hole so that the patient is not disturbed during the operation, and keep the sponge so that it does not dry out the pupil in its sharpness
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And your incision should be such that it does not irritate that adhesion until the pupil is returned to its natural form and that the adhesion is completely healed
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	And put on the pupil salt water in which you wash; or distill from it vinegar dissolved in water
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	And separate between the pupil and the pupil by a piece of cloth of linen, and rest on the pupil a thread of gauze infused with alum, and use three times daily cataplastics until it is healed
Capitol .xvi.	End of document
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	Of the incision of the nail and the emergence of the glands of tears
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Know that the nail is according to two manners, either it is nervous, and it is similar to a hard soft sponge; or it is non-nervous, similar to white moisture solidified, which when you touch it, or force it to take it with the nail, it breaks and the nail is not fixed in it
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And both kinds do not begin until from the greater lacrimal until it gradually covers the sight and prevents the light and the movement of the pupil
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.
