Capitol .xxii.	Capitol XXII.
De curacio de alconati.	On the care of aloes
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This disease which is called aloes is nothing other than a wound which is adjusted in the blood vessel resembling descending water and is not like that.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	More diligently work on it so that the patient does not become more swollen and painful on the part affected, and take hold of his head with your two hands when you see the wound becoming healed towards the lower parts, and keep it dry and do not let it descend, and keep your hand over it, so that the patient may see the causes of the wound just as before.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not descend downwards, it is because it is water.
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania. Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	Therefore when it is expelled, then you distill in the blood vessel cold water in which you have mixed honey or water in which you have already boiled fenugreek and honey.
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And keep it treated with the other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Capitol XXII.
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	On the care of the descending water of the blood vessel.
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already said concerning the species of water in the division and what is necessary to perforate with certainty, however

Therefore, when the weather is dry and warm, extract the bile easily with some facility, and mix a little of pure salt with some vinegar and at the same time wash the area with lukewarm water; then wipe away the bile with a cloth or bandage of wool and oil, and wash with the water again.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	More recently, we have seen these things happen in our time, resting upon those who suffer from such indigestion with oil of poppy seed.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	If you do not obey your bile when it enters the belly because of its hardness — which is the case with many men of whom the bile is very thick —, then you must take a sponge which is called " alberid" in this way:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	Therefore, pierce at that junction there, and do not touch your hand to the wound, otherwise you will make the bile go astray from its natural course.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And then bring out the bile as we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	You must congratulate them on their work, whether they are prepared to sleep in the patient's bed downstairs or are prohibited from any movement
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	Stay away from the patient's nature so that their nature may be calm, and do not move their seat forward or backward at all
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And keep them quiet according to their condition for the third day.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	And remove that person from that gloomy bed and expose the cold air, and let them see some causes, and then return the liament within seven days.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	Do not do anything in the hour of care or at any other time related to the infusion.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	Indeed, you must keep the water away from them so that it does not cause them to become excited and aggressive towards you on account of their great and fierce hunger.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	If, however, the vomiting persists, you must remove the bile by the seventh day, and correct that which is responsible for the vomiting

E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	And gradually remove from that bed and converse with them about their causes
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And you must know that in no way is it permitted for the disciple of vision to see anything of those things, and you must be careful about the operation
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And it has already been reported to us by some of those who have seen the Lord that when the water is sucked out of the bladder through the opening made by the perforation, the water comes out with great force.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	Indeed, however, we have not seen anything like this in our land, nor have we read of it in the books of the ancients; and it is possible that this is a new thing.</start_turn>
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	These are the forms of the magpies which are about those who do not know about those things:
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	They are fatuous either with regard to their humors or with regard to their parts, and they emit these things in this triangular form which has a sharp point like that which is the shape of a wound.</start_turn
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter XXV.</start_turn>
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	Of the care of the flesh nothing is in its nature.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When there are various meats in the body which are adjusted to each other, of which there is some cause which is like a scorpion's head with teeth, or like a multitude of fish; this disease is called "polypus" which is like that fish represented.</start_turn><end_turn>
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And it is like cancer of the flesh, ulcerous, of pale color; and it is like the flesh of a lion not of pale color.</start_turn><end_turn
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore, in that which is like these lion's meats which are neither fraudulent nor cancerous, you must make the patient lie down between your thighs and place him in the sun, uncover his parts, and prick his belly once in those meats.</start_turn><end_turn
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And then extract that from the parts, and then infiltrate the water which you have understood from those things until you know that all the flesh is already consumed; for if there remains any cause from which the opening is possible, then you must retreat the water with one of the subtle instruments with facility until there remains no cause.</start_turn><end_turn
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	Indeed, if the Lord wills or if vomiting persists, then you must stop giving the water; or if it is malignant vomiting, you must cover it up and cauterize that until it is separated from the soul and all the cavities are closed.</start_turn><end_turn
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And immediately take hold of the nose, close the opening of the vein with vinegar or wine.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	If the nose is congested and there is moisture inside the palate, it is known that it is already healed.</end_of_turn>
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	If the moisture does not penetrate as it should, then you know that there is no pus in the pores of the nose, which is what causes the swelling.</end_of_turn>
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore you must enter firmly with your hand into the cavity of the nose, without moving the nose, and wait a while until the bleeding stops.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	When the bleeding has stopped, that is when you should smell inside the nose to see if the blood has drained from the nose's channels, and once it is gone, take away the handkerchief that was placed there. Note that children often faint from this action, and this is a light cause of it.</end_of_turn>
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	Then take away both hands from the nose, one that comes out and the other that remains in the nose, and immediately apply cold compresses to the nose, holding them there until you see that the bleeding has stopped.</end_of_turn
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	Then extract the blood, and close the nose immediately by pressing with the thumb against the bone, and do this for three days or more until the wound has healed.</end_of_turn>
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And at the end of the treatment, insert a lead cannula into the nose to prevent bleeding for several days until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	If you take care of the treatment, use this remedy.</end_of_turn>
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument for capturing the maker of the ointment that is distilled with oils and medicines in the nose.</end_of_turn

E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas. This ointment is precious: a recipe of castor oil, white balam, ginger, saffron peel, long pepper, mastic resin, and angelica root.</end_of_turn Mix it with vinegar and boiled water, and make small pills, and let one pill dissolve in lukewarm water, and give it to the patient in the nose as desired.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxv.	End of treatment. XXV.</end_of_turn>
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	From this time forward, the patient will remain in the nose's extremities.</end_of_turn

Capitol .xxvi.	End of treatment. XXVI.</end_of_turn
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of suture of the nose and lips and ear when the continuity is dissolved by plague or by chance.</end_of_turn

You must know that when continuity is dissolved in one of these cartilages, little confidence is had in that operation except in the case of very wise people.</end_of_turn
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when you must do something for some cause of these, consider if it is fresh plague on the face, and when you have adjusted the two lips of the plague with sutures, take care of that until it is healed.</end_of_turn

And so adjust the two layers near the suture and strengthen them, and over them sprinkle salt and powder, and place over the powder a pad of lint or another of the solidifying plasters, and leave that bound for two days or three, and then remove that and replace it with another, and leave that in place until the wound is healed.</end_of_turn>

May the skill of the suture be that you add the solution of continuity or with needles just as we have recommended in the suture of the belly, or add the solution of continuity with thread just as well as you please and tell.</end_of_turn>

De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of the incision of the bone adjusted in the sockets.</end_turn

Greatly of vegetable matters there is no more over the adjusted bone socket which they formerly called albulus, whereupon you must suspend that with one hand or that you have the forceps and make an incision there and insert the cause, and leave the healing run its course or the wound will heal.</end_turn

Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.</end_turn
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of the reason for teeth with iron.</end_turn
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When on the surface of the teeth in the parts inside and outside and between the gums there are adjusted rough scales, legs, and some are black and are citrine or green because of the corruption of the gum, which is harmful to the teeth that are left.</end>

Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	And if this remains at the beginning of the cause, it is not; and if not, then you must repeat the cause on the other side on the second and third days until the last degree is reached in what you wish.</end

E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	Therefore the razors with which the tooth is shaved from the inside part are different from the razors with which it is shaved between the teeth according to other forms, and these forms of shaving must be prepared by you, which you will see soon.</end
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.</end_turn
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of the extraction of teeth.</end_turn
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	Therefore you must treat the tooth of its pain with all your skill and later in the whole eradication of it, for there is no cause that replaces the substance of the tooth when it is eradicated, which is a sublime substance that is excused in the eradication of it.</end
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	Moreover, when the disease is urgent that tooth must be eradicated, you must firmly declare that it is the painful tooth, for many substances deceive the disease and cause that it be in a healthy tooth, and you must eradicate that and the pain will cease until the painful and diseased tooth is eradicated, as we have seen in the operation of the barbers.</end
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore you must be certified that this is the painful tooth, and that you know well, that you must mark on the circumference of the tooth with a spatula in which there is any virtue, until it is dissolved from the root of the tooth throughout, and you must do that with your hands or with fine forceps from the beginning gradually until that is complete.</end
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And now let someone strong hold the patient's shoulders firmly for good speaking or stupor, and keep the patient's head between the thighs that he does not move, and then draw the tooth according to the rule in a manner that neither the patient nor the greater pain does not increase.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And if it is not forgotten, then take one of those instruments and put it on his hands from every part to facilitate and expedite the removal of the tumor as it is done from the beginning
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is fractured or rotten, then take care that you cover your hand with that cloth and grasp that with the tip of your thumb so that it is not fractured when you tighten it up on that area that you hold
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And take care that you work diligently with sacrifice throughout the circumference of the gums and that you keep your hand firm so that you do not fracture that, and remain still from it, and return to the patient for the malice that is greater than the first pain of his foot.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And keep in mind that you do not do anything that ignorant barbers do in their fisting and audacity regarding the extirpation of their teeth, since they do not administer what has been recommended; for many veined patients make come greater evils than those that have been mentioned, and the causes of their miseries remain hidden, or some of them, or that they extract that tooth without any bones of the mandible as many veined patients have testified
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And for the extirpation of the teeth, let the mouth be washed with wine that has been boiled or wine with salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if blood flows out from the saint to aid, as many veined patients do, then take any amount of saffron and sprinkle it on the plague, and if you do not confirm that saffron, cauterize.</end_of_turn>
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the forceps and needles which are useful for grasping the tooth at the beginning is either of long handle and wide mouth, or of short handle and broad, so that they are not bent when working on them.</end_of_turn>
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And thus sometimes with a broad mouth and sometimes with a short handle, as soon as you begin with those, they are not bent, but if they are short handled they are stretched out.</end_of_turn>
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And they are useful of Indian steel descending as well as of bronze handles, and in the handling of those, teeth are introduced one into the other and are tightened with strong constriction. Some of the veined patients make the handles like the beak of a heron, so it is round, and are of strong constriction.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter xxxi.</end_of_turn>
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	Of the extirpation of teeth and the extraction of the bones of the mandibles fractured.</end_of_turn>
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When the tooth is fractured and remains for some cause, then you must keep your hand over the wound border for a day or two until the wound is softened; and then bring in relief or support the handles which are assembled like the beak of a heron called ciconia or round, of the form of the forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The handles are useful both as lime or as aloe.</end_of_turn
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if you do not obey your will with these forceps or needles, then you must fall upon the reason and uncover all the bone and insert the instrument which has the name of atali, so it is a small lever whose form is like this:</start_of_turn>
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And be of short handle large a little, and do not be grasped so that it is fractured.</start_of_turn
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore if for this the reason is forgotten, do not do it; but if you do, help with these other instruments of which these are the forms: the form of the first instrument is of a triangular handle in which there is any thickness:</start_of_turn
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The form of the second instrument is that it is triangular and of more subtle handle.</start_of_turn
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And already you have helped with this instrument having two slopes of which this is the form close to the following:</start_of_turn
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	And with other instruments which I will enumerate in the shaving of teeth; for help is useful with this instrument which is assembled like an onion, and this is the form:</start_of_turn
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	Of the triangular handle that is thick or short, which is any thickness, and do not be grasped so that it is fractured.</start_of_turn
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And other things that the instruments of the teeth are like those mentioned above.</start_of_turn
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	However, the learned and skillful artists in the art, finds for themselves the means according to what he understands of the operation and the various diseases; for these are the diseases for which the ancients did not say or even advise any proper instrument, for the forms of various species.</start_of_turn
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	May be if the jawbone or other bones of the mouth are fractured, or if necessary, the pain is cured upon that which is convenient for the instruments and forceps which we have mentioned in the extraction of the roots of the teeth, and it helps you with the way in which this is done.
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And in any great or small degree, and be it tight or loose at the mouth so that it does not escape or run until the bone is completely healed; and then restore the place with appropriate medicines at that which is convenient.</end_of_turn>
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	May be if the bone is slightly broken, reduce that of that break and of its blackness, and cure that until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter XXXII.</end_turn>
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Of the care of prominent teeth over the others.</end_turn>
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth are prominent beyond their natural shape for those of the same kind, and especially when they encroach upon the gums, and especially upon the holy lips; therefore you must consider: if a tooth is not properly aligned with another tooth, and it is not possible to file or ligate it, the pain must remain in that place; but if it is not attached to another tooth, you must insert that instrument into this area which has this shape; and it is like cutting through pork, and is done with a sharp iron of India for extraction.</end_of_turn
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And let your incision be at the place where you insert that instrument for several days because of the hardness of the tooth, and that it is not similar to that of other teeth.</end_of_turn
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if a prominent tooth is exposed to filing, then file that with a file of iron of India which has this shape:</end_of_turn
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And let it be all of iron of India and the margin be well-marked; and let there be little points as if with a needle, with which the tooth is filed little by little in several days with ease, so that it is not like other teeth which are jagged.</end_of_turn
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And then line that at the end, and reduce that which is in the socket.</end_of_turn
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if a tooth of which a part is fractured and the tongue is bleeding, the pain must cover that until the expectation of that fragment is overcome and equalized, and be filled so that the tongue does not bleed nor the word corrupt.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.</end_turn
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of the restoration of decayed teeth with gold or silver foil.</end_turn
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When accidents happen to the teeth before concussion and removal by percussion or extraction, and the patient does not suffer from pain, and you have cured that with soothing medicines, and it has not been of use, the pain must be remedied by placing gold which is strong in those which are strong, and not of silver which becomes green and is soon weak, even though it is more expensive.</end_of_turn
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And let the gold be in such flexibility and roughness as the quantity which must enter between the teeth; and the way of placing is that you take hold of the gold and take twice its length between two healthy teeth, and that you make it grow between two crooked surfaces of the gold between two decayed teeth, or if one or two, until the tissue reaches the healthy tooth of the other side.</end_of_turn
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And then repeat the tissue inside the part from which you started, and strengthen your hand with ease and wisdom until it is not decayed.</end_of_turn
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let your striction be at the place where you strengthen the gold must not escape.</end_of_turn
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And then remove the excess of the gold with forceps or pliers, and add those to the area where you are working, and convert those and hide them between the healthy tooth and the decayed tooth, so that it does not harm the tongue.</end_of_turn
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And thus read that again carefully.</end_of_turn
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	And if it is slipped or rough, strengthen that or those with another gold in such a way at all times.</end_of_turn
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the shape of the teeth and the figure of the restoration of two healthy teeth and two decayed teeth, as sometimes these are linked:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when you return a tooth or two back in place near some other, and they have fallen out, let them recede as we have recommended, and let them remain.</end>
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	Do not do anything except a good craftsman and a wise man.</end_of_turn>
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	Many herbs are suitable for various causes of bone fractures, and it is useful to them as a kind of tooth, and is placed in the place where the tooth is absent, and is strengthened as we have said, and remains and serves for a long time.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxxiv.	Capitol .xxxiv.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	The text reads: "From the beginning of the ligament which is seen in the tongue and prevents that."
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament which is seen in the tongue and prevents that ... This ligament which is seen to leave the tongue some veins or is naturally associated with it, or is accidental and caused by an infection which has already hardened.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation for it is that we burn the mouth of the disease, that is, the soft palate which exists in the belly; and elevate the soft palate, and then we cut that ligament of nerves as far as it is necessary until the tongue is freed from its retraction.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	Maybe there is some hardness or denudation, and that is because of the consolidation of the infection; however, when you have cut once and split that (ligament) as far as necessary until you have cut the ligament and the nodulation has been dissolved
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And take care that there is no tear in the preparation of the flesh and that you cut here the arteries and let blood flow freely.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And then wash the remnants of the incision with oil or vinegar or with cold water; and then leave the tongue loose; so is the cause of which the patient has left the tongue in any night so that it is not consolidated again by any vein.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	Maybe there is bleeding of blood, leave your hand over the great toe which is treated; maybe the blood boils, then cauterize the area with a pointed cautery which you will apply to the blood.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then take care of the other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	The text ends here.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Extraction of wisdom tooth leaves the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Some veins accidentally leave the tongue swollen like a small nail which hinders the natural operation of the tongue; and because of that it is greatly increased until the mouth is dry
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation for it is that we burn the mouth of the disease sitting in front of the sun and consider the swelling.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if sometimes you see a yellow or black, dark spot, tough, to which the patient does not feel sensation, then do not touch that which is wrinkled.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is inclined to whiteness, in which there is moisture, then put on your glove and cut that with a sharp lancet, and cut it out completely; and if blood boils at the time of your operation, then leave your hand over the great toe which is treated, so that it is not dry, until the blood is contained
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then return to your work until you have finished with it, until it is washed with oil or vinegar and salt; and take care of the other care for the blood until it is healed
Capitol .xxxvi.	The text ends here
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Extraction of wisdom tooth of two carpal bones and of that which is nothing in the heel and of the other wisdom teeth.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When the wisdom tooth is embedded in the jaw, so are the glands which are assembled together and which are causing the pain, they are two carpal bones which when you treat them with water as we have said in the division and they are not healed, then you consider if the wisdom tooth is tough, yellow, without sensation, then do not touch that which is bleeding
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of black color and the root is large, then do not touch that which is bleeding for the flow of blood; take away that which is soft, and you can either extract that or leave it broken by itself
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of white color, soft, and the root is slight, then that which is that must be cut out.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation for it is that you consider, before your operation, if the wisdom tooth has already rested calm for a complete rest or if it is diminished by any diminution; and when you have done that, burn the mouth of the patient, put the head of the patient in the belly, and burn the mouth of the patient, and the servant takes between his hands the tongue of the patient leaving aside noble instruments of which this is the form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it is done with silver or with gold, and it is slight like a tile.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Therefore when you promise that to the patient and he shows you the wisdom tooth, and you put your hand over that which is in the belly, then take your glove and stay there, and pull that out to the outside as much as you can
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another one which you must pull out is the cause of the tunicas, and then cut that with that instrument of which this is the form
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	And it is assembled like forceps, however the extremities of these are bent, so that the orifice of each one is in the belly of the other, not acute, which is iron inside.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	If this instrument is not at your disposal, the mark of this spatum is that it is acute at one end and blunt at the other.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And since you have made an incision, now make the other according to this manner of handling, and immediately apply cold water to the patient to prevent swelling
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If blood flows too freely, keep cold water of decoction of meadowsweet or ivy leaves and adhere to what has been said concerning the causes until the flow of blood is restricted, and take care of that which has been said to be healthy.</start_of_turn>
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And every vegetable that grows in the ground, others after these two ankles, and make an incision according to what has been said and as I have said concerning the incision of two holes that equal.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I have already treated a a woman of apostemas who was born in the ground of her, who had a tendency to dark color, little sensation, who had already closed the ground of her, and the woman breathed with difficulty, and I had already forbidden her to eat and drink water, and she was already on the verge of death if more water had not been given for a day or two.</start_of_turn>
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the apostema had already protruded so much that there were two ramps between that and the heel for two steps.</start_of_turn>
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Therefore I stitched it up fistulously and remained on one of its sides, and I pulled out that which was large from it, and I threw it away from me, and I immediately closed that which I had left open, and I squeezed its tongue, and I put its thumb in that apostema.</start_of_turn
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And I immediately bled away a great part of it, and it did not run from it except for a little blood.</start_of_turn
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Therefore the ground of that woman is absolutely healed, and she immediately began to drink water, and to eat food, so I did not cease to make an incision of that apostema for a long time, and afterwards there appeared another apostema in its place, which I also incised as long as that.</start_of_turn
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Therefore I pray and cauterize the ground of her, so that there will be no more addiction; and immediately I went out and did not stop until I saw that God had mercy on me concerning that.</start_of_turn
Capitol .xxxvii.	End of document.</start_of_turn>
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	From the incision of the heel when it is apostematized.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When the heel discharges downwards, and it is apostematized and is long, the hour is not called perpendicular; and if it is in the outer part large and round, and the hour is called bubbly.</start_of_turn
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	If when it is cured with the water that we have said in the division, and you do not take care of your wound, and sometimes the apostema is burnt out already and is subtle, the hour covers that you must make an incision which is round; and if it is in that length, and there is blood, of a dark color or black, and it is not at the center, the hour covers that you must fear the incision of it, because there is fear of the patient.</start_of_turn
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you do it according to the manner that I have said of its whiteness and length, that you make the patient groan and press the tongue with the instrument with which you shape it, and immediately put the thumb on the new one and throw away the old one, and make an incision with one of the two instruments which I have mentioned at the incision of two holes.</start_of_turn
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And cover that you do not make an incision except when it is adjusted according to the natural term of its addiction, because if you make it more, you will make it worse.</start_of_turn
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And immediately after the incision, use the water which we have recommended at the incision of two holes, and take care of that which is healthy.</start_of_turn
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	If the patient is frightened by the incision of the heel, cover that you use an instrument in the cauterization of the heel in your fear, and the manner of the cautery is nothing but acute water, and that you keep the head of the patient still, and immediately press the tongue with the instrument which we have mentioned, and immediately take some water which we have mentioned in the chapter of cauterization, and comfort that which is alive, and stop that which is not thick or subtle, and from that fill the hollow of the instrument which has this shape.
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	As well as the bending of the cavity in which the medicine is placed is like the curvature of the heel of a ray, and stop the instrument with the medicine on the nail, the patient will lick over the lips for so that he spits or wipes away the mucus from the mouth of that because of the intrinsic medicine, for so that there is no discharge from that of any cause over the ground of the heel and that he recover that.</start_of_turn
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And keep your hand firmly on the medicine, and express it over the uvula for about a minute until it becomes numb and sedated by the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	If you wish, take a piece of cotton and wrap it around the end of the ray, and immerse the cotton in the medicine, and put the ray onto the cotton in a tube so that the cotton adheres to the tube, and do so until you have achieved what you desire from the cautery of the uvula, and then remove that which makes it dry and fall away in about three or four days.</end_of_turn>
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	If you doubt that the medicine has been completely absorbed, repeat it, and when you have finished cauterizing the uvula, remove that which is in the circuit of the ray above the coto, and apply something that will harden that which is in the circuit of the medicine, and wash with cold water, and cure with ointment, and bind with bandages until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of treatment is more useful than the beginning and more long-lasting.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Some diseases of the uvula are cured with things that are more subtle than cautery and more beneficial, which is cured by fumigation in this way: mix cinnamon, rue, origanum, rosemary, bitter almonds, chamomile, broth and similar herbs, and add all these things together, or some of them, in a bowl, and pour vinegar over them, and let them bubble; and let the vinegar be poured onto the area of the bowl steadily, and under the vinegar there should be a sponge, on which should be placed an instrument of iron according to this manner; let it be made of silver or iron.</end_of_turn>
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And let the limb be introduced into the mouth of the patient until the vapor makes the uvula rise above the canula, until the uvula is not opaque.</end_of_turn
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And repeat over that swelling until it is dry, and keep that you do not perform this treatment at the beginning of the swelling, because it would be too severe for the swelling, and would not be enough to cure it, but you must declare the swelling to be over after performing this treatment.</end_of_turn>
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	Or if you do not have this instrument, take a tube and apply in the limb a cloth of wool, so that the mouth of the patient is covered, because the cloth of wool prevents the vapor from burning the mouth.</end_of_turn
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	This treatment is good for health.</end_of_turn>
