De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	Of extraction of splinters and of that which adheres in the cavity and of the other causes.</start_of_turn
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Swelling adheres in the cavity or spine of the foot or any other cause.</start_of_turn
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then cover that which appears to be causing the swelling, on which you cast your glance, with a pointed instrument of steel, so that you can be informed of what is in the cavity.</start_of_turn
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And that which is hidden in the cavity, cover that you vomit the patient while the food is still in the stomach, because it strengthens the underlying cause of the swelling if it is left undigested; or that you swallow the patient a spoonful of bread or radish or a spoonful of dry bread; or give her a spoonful of sponge of marine lime, which you must bind firmly with faith, and hold that firmly in place.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	Or take an eel and bind it firmly with thread, and keep it bound; or take a bowl and bind it firmly with thread.</start_of_turn
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	And if the underlying causes have not been removed, take an instrument of lead according to this manner:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And it should be thicker than a ray, and in the limb there should be a cavity in which you put your finger into the cavity of the patient.</start_of_turn
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And keep the patient’s head elevated above his heart, and keep that your touch of the hand does not touch the belly, so that you do not damage the bones or the spine, or that the physician put his hand on it.</start_of_turn
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	However, if the patient vomits excessively, because of his knowledge of the location of the underlying cause and of the swelling in his belly, he should remove his hand from the instrument in his hand, as much as he is able, until it is expelled.</start_of_turn
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXXIX.</start_of_turn>
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of the extraction of blood clot which is annexed to the cavity.</start_of_turn
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When blood is medicated with what has been said in the division of care with medicines and not confirmed, consider the hour in the patient's groin towards the sunlight, because you have compressed the tongue of the patient with the instrument which you have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore if sometimes the bloodsucker, extract that one which is small or slightly sticky downwards adequately.</end_of_turn>
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible to extract from that, take a curved needle and insert it into the patient's groin, and place on the concave side of the needle a burning iron, and do this until the bloodsucker is dead and remains outside the cavity.</end_of_turn
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then prepare a basin full of cold water, open its mouth in that, and wash the mouth with that; and do not allow anything to pass from that until an hour has passed, since the bloodsucker has suffered as much as when the water is cold.</end_of_turn
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	However if it is not recommended in that which we have said, the hour overshadows the patient with their head bowed or stifled by the instrument which we have recommended for the fumigation of the uvula.</end_of_turn>
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do thus, so that it falls away.</end_of_turn>
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	This is another way of operating in the fumigation of that, that you take a bowl in which are burning coals and cover the bowl with a cover in the middle of which is a hook, and compose that hook on the extremity of the instrument; and then withdraw the cover from the fumigation; and place the patient's mouth over the extremity of the needle, and close the patient's mouth so that the fumigation is not too strong until you know that the fumigation has reached the bloodsucker, since the bloodsucker has fallen away.</end_of_turn
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not fall away, the hour repeat the fumigation many times, and abstain the patient from drinking, eating salty foods and other things, and do not drink water, and if necessary is that in this regimen is excluded.</end_of_turn
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which the bloodsucker is treated from the groin when it is seen; and it is similar to forceps in this way, but it is curved in some way:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed upon the groin, and the extremity of it is similar to the beak of a heron, which is hooked, in which is inserted the thumb, so that when any cause is compressed, that does not bite.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xl.	The text ends here.</end_of_turn>
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the words in praise of the termination of ailments and sections of them.</end_of_turn
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	The apostemas are various, of various methods, as it is remembered from some of them in this book.</end_of_turn
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are various in perforation and section of them by two methods, one for the kind of apostemas in themselves; and for what they compress of humors.</end_of_turn
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method is for the places where the ailments occur, because the apostema that occurs in the head is different from the apostema that occurs in the buttocks; and the apostema in the fleshy part is different from the apostema that occurs in the joint; and each one of them is its own judgment for operation.</end_of_turn
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And there are some apostemas that should not be perforated but only at the right time of the illness in those or in addition to them.</end_of_turn
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	So other apostemas which must be grasped when they are crossed, and are not matured according to their complement, just as apostemas which are proper for joints, for an apostem which is in a joint, the thing is to prolong it until it becomes poor in the circumference of it, and that it does not corrupt the ligaments or nerves of that joint, because it is a harmful cause of contraction of that limb; or that it is a prop of the main limb, and if you delay the perforation of it when it is matured it does not help the main limb; or that it is proper of the buttocks, so perforate it only when it is not matured; and do not perforate it blindly, without completing digestion, but only that which is proper of the buttocks, so that you do not weaken the heel of the buttock and that it is elongated to the parts below the buttock, and that there is a fistula, or that it is beneficial in the end that it is not healthy.</end_of_turn
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	It is better that you know the time of the perforation of the apostema, and that is when it is matured.</end_of_turn
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you know that it is matured when there is the cessation of pain and the ceasing of fever, and also the diminution of swelling and pulse, and the sharpness of the head of the apostema, and the other signs.</end_of_turn
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	The wound must be closed from below the groin towards the navel, and comes from the care of the prominence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	The wound must be closed along the length of the limb or body, if the abscesses are in the armpits or the feet, and in the places of the lacerations, of the nerves' cords, of the arteries; and finally, in all places where there is no reflection; for in those where there is reflection, use perforation as in that limb.</end_of_turn>
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	More when the abscess is in a fleshy place, then you must let the wound close until the digestion of the abscess is confirmed according to custom, as we have said; for if you perforate it before, you prolong the suffering of the patient and cause more pain, and you harden the edges of the wound and its depth.</end_of_turn>
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	More abscesses must be perforated according to the breadth of the limb or the body as necessary, or according to what the limb digests.</end_of_turn>
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you must give a small perforation, and in large abscesses great perforation and wide or many sections according to the diversity of the size of the abscesses.</end_of_turn
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And others are the abscesses in which you must make the cordena concave and inflamed, when it is finished that it should already be stiff, as in the case of trops of boils and abscesses.</end_of_turn
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those that are incised with section having three angles; and of those that are incised thus like the figure of a ivy leaf, thus the abscesses of the armpits.</end_of_turn
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of those there are those in which round section and lunar section are administered, and they resemble the latter.</end_of_turn
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	More of those to whom it is not possible like external abscesses, you must perforate that with superficial perforation, or only flat.</end_of_turn
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the abscess is large and has collected much pus, that you perforate that and do not hesitate to extract all of that in that hour; having extracted from that a part, then you must fill the abscess again the next day, and extract another part the next day, and so make that the pus becomes softened gradually until it is forgotten.</end>
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And more if the patient is of cold temperament, or a woman in her period, or a small child, or an old man in decrepitude, for the animal spirit is resolved with the evacuation of the pus, and thus the patient is relieved, and you must leave it like that.</end
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Be careful to keep this chapter with great care, and when you perforate these abscesses, that you remove the boils and consider whether the boil of the abscess is little or is a flat section, when you administer which of them or of the coto in antic; and if the abscess is large and the cracks of the perforation are many, that you stop mechanically in any place until they have healed together.</end
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess a part of the cordena has been broken or has sunk into the surrounding area, that you must support it with old cloth or with thread of silk, just as when you have brought bread or cheese, because of its humidity; and strengthen that within the third day; and then proceed with that and care for it so that it heals without any inflammation until it is healed.</end
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	More if an outflow of pus occurs in the hour of your operation, then you must administer cold water and vinegar in which there is a thread of silk, and stop that over the place of the outflow of the pus until the pus becomes softened.</end
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	More if the outflow of the pus continues, then you must administer regimen and care and the powders which I have recommended in many places of this our book and division.</end
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	More if it is in winter, and the place of the abscess is a place of many nerves, then you must cover with powder in wine and oil caut, and put those on the places.</end>
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in summer, and the places are fleshy, then you must cover with powder in almonds with water and oil or in wine and oil, and all that until the third day, as we have said, and then you must remove the abscess and extract that, and administer the care that is appropriate for it until it is healed.</end
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And thus is what is necessary for the cognition of the care of abscesses universally, more according to the way of distinction that I have already said of every abscess in what way it is to be cared for according to the chapters singly.</end
Capitol .xli.	Chapter LXI.</end>
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the section of abscesses which are in the cordena of the head.</end
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	The small bones at the ankle are connected by nodes that contain sacs filled with fluid; and these sacs move freely.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	They are like small pearls, and in those there is moisture similar to wax.</end_of_turn>
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And in those there are those that contain moisture similar to resin, resembling stones; and those are hard.</end_of_turn>
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all this, and in the extraction of these, there is no fear, as when you extend these does not cause damage to the artery.</end_of_turn>
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	The operation of extracting these is that you grasp them with an instrument of the kind that you see, which is called tweezers, until you believe that it contains.</end_of_turn>
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if that which is contained is moisture, then split that by section according to its length by superficial section in this way:</end_of_turn
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin in the section from the line of B to the line of G. So when the moisture is evacuated, then you wipe away that from which that moisture was contained, and do not leave from that any cause of this, for if there remains from that any cause, it will return.</end_of_turn>
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And immediately immerse the limb in Egyptian unguents, if there is any, or in water and salt; and fill that with the ointment and leave that until tomorrow, for that which is corrupted will be consumed by that.</end_of_turn
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And repeat over that limb with Egyptian unguents several times if you wish, until you believe that there is no longer any cause of that limb; for the ointment will cure the wound while it is healing.</end_of_turn
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the ankle contains fat nodes, then you pierce that as follows:</end>
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	with a section having the shape of a cross, and grasp nails between two lips of the section and tear that from all around, and exert your skill in extracting the sac which contains that.</end>
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	May it be that your artery is damaged by this, but I will tell you first.</end>
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do in the lapizated ankle of section and care according as you have been told; and the section of the lapizated ankle is less severe, for it has little pain and little moisture.</end
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And many times these veins are liable to these ankles which are in the head in bones which have no moisture; the cause of which is that I do not know of any ankle in the head of an old woman which does not swell like a deaf stone, rough, white, which cannot be softened, and if any of those is struck in that place, the ankle will swell.</end
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in the other ankles there is another thing which is not in this book, namely the ankles which are found in the heads of children, and you must take the reason for the swelling of the ankles, for indeed the section of these is superficial section.</end

De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the section of the scrofulas which occur in the ankle.</start
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Moistened veins cause these ankles to swell in the heel and in the instep and in the ankle; and some veins cause swelling in the other parts of the body.</start
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And so those which happen in the heel, and those which are generated between them, and all the scrofula of these is due to the rupture of their own sac, just as in the nodes and ankle of the head, as we have recounted.</start
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the species of these scrofulas are moist, for some of them are like stones, and some contain moisture, and some are malignant which do not obey treatment.</start
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore in that case when you have good opportunity in the touch, of which the color of the liquid that is manifested is appropriate for the color of the heel, and it is bad throughout, and is not annexed to the nerves of the heel, nor to the veins, nor to the artery, and is not a swelling, you must pierce that which is like superficial skin of the part from the part beyond the body of the line G within the line B, and remove that from all around, and stretch two lips of the heel on an inch, or on nails if necessary, as we have said concerning the ankles of the head, and extract that little by little.</start
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	Beware lest the vein or nerve be injured.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	Do not make the wound too acute, for thereby you may damage the patient, or irritate the illness, and you may thereby introduce something which is not necessary to introduce; for if you cut the vein or artery, you will prevent the flow of blood, and this will delay the healing of the wound, and cause further suffering.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood has clotted.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore return to your operation when you have completed it
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And inquire whether there is any other small swelling, for these also must be cut away and drained.</end_of_turn>
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	If it is in the root of the large vein, cover that the while time you are cutting away that swelling.</end_of_turn>
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Then cover that with a firm bandage and keep it there until it has fallen out by itself.</end_of_turn>
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with old cloth which you have already soaked in vinegar, and then care for that.</end_of_turn
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you cut away the entire swelling, then cover that you adjust the two lips of the wound and extract as much pus as possible so that there is no excess liquid.</end_of_turn>
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	More often, however, if there is still excess liquid due to the great size of the swelling, cover that you understand how to cut away the root of that, and remove that and administer stitches and what is said.</end_of_turn
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And as for those swellings which contain moisture, pierce that superficial perforation here where you see the mature parts of them, and do not perforate further than that, for if you do you will bring pus from below the belly, just as we have said.</end_of_turn
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And administer the perforation cautiously, warming it in vinegar and keeping it wet, so that it will not irritate the surrounding area.</end_of_turn
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And when the wound has already healed, then care for it by applying ointment of generative ointment until it is healed.</end_of_turn

De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	From the incision of the heel of the foot to the healing of the wound it is necessary to keep the patient under observation.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	I say that this section has never been known in our land.</end_of_turn>
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	This is the inscription of the sermon of these people.</end_of_turn
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	In women it is not advisable to extract the heel, for this may cause damage to the veins and arteries of the patient.</end_of_turn
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	In those who have swellings caused by bites in the mouth or swelling or two abscesses, when the disease is not in the bone, it is useful to perform an excision of the heel to prevent the loss which is caused by perforation.</end_of_turn
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore we must say that when we wish to perform an excision of the heel, we must make three circles around the circle of the heel, or four if the section is to be extensive, for the quantity between two circles is great; and the section should be made in fat, not in cartilage, for this place is private of fat and the vessels of blood of the heel are loosened.</end_of_turn
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is inexperienced, cover that he should extend the tendon of the heel with an incision, and then open the tendon until it reaches the canal, but avoid the blood vessels if you see any cause.</end_of_turn
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And administer the incision according to what we have recommended; and it is significant to perform the section of the canal for the inflammation which is caused by that pus which is from it and for the rupture of the voice.</end_of_turn
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	Leave the wound open for some time.</end_of_turn
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore when the hour has passed in which the perforation is feared, add two lips to the edge of the wound, and cut only the cartilage.</end_of_turn
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And administer medicines that will cause the fat to disappear until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	Indeed, the sum of the sayings which we have recommended is that the exposure is nothing other than to see that some of these abscesses have already rendered the heel of the foot useless, and that the disease is overcome within death, and the marrow of it is dried up, and the fat is separated from it, and the latter goes to perforate the epiglottis so that the disease can escape through the wound on every breath, and is saved from death.</end_of_turn
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And thus I command you to leave the wound open until the malice of the disease has passed; for the malice of the disease lasts for three days; therefore I command you to close the wound when the disease is gone, and heal that which remains.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And thus I have seen for my purpose that a maid brought a pot and poured it into his groin and burned him with that a part of the edge of the lung, and I was called to his care, and I wiped away the mucus just as it is moved from the dead, and I uncovered the wound and wiped away the pus that was in it little by little.</end_of_turn>
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore I confess that there was neither vein nor nerve injured, and that the swelling went down from the wound, and I cured that when it was healed.</end_of_turn>
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And I did not blame the maid if she remained hoarse, and after a few days she returned to perfect health.</end_of_turn>
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the section of the groin there is no fear.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLV.</end_of_turn>
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the section concerning the swelling that happens outside the groin, and it is called hernia of the groin.</end_of_turn
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This swelling which is called hernia of the groin is great according to the color of the body, and it is not in women.</end_of_turn
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is according to two methods, either it is natural or accidental.</end_of_turn
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural it is not capable of healing.</end_of_turn
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental is according to two methods, one is like grass knots, and the other is like a swelling which is caused by the bursting of an artery, and in that there is fear.</end_of_turn
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	It is not necessary to fear it as with iron except for that which is small.</end_of_turn
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you must know that if you find it like grass knots, and if it is not suspended from any vein, then you must prick it just as if it were a node, and extract that which is under the skin and the pus; but if not, it is necessary to examine all the groin to see if there is anything else that requires care, and to take care of that which is necessary until it is healed.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLV.</end_of_turn
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of the section concerning the species of nodes.</end_of_turn
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	Of the nodes there are many species, and I have already mentioned all the species in the division.</end_of_turn
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And it is necessary to know the difference between a node and an extrusion in order to avoid doubt.</end_of_turn
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore I say that an extrusion is a quality which has heat and fever and severe pain until the swelling of the fluid subsides; and it is accompanied by corruption that when the fever ceases the pain and the heat cease.</end_of_turn
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But a node is not heat or fever or pain, but it contains that thick liquid which is in the belly or sac itself.</end_of_turn
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body, and its commencement is like cheese and is found just as well whether large or small, and there are two species, one of which is like fat and contains moisture, and the color of the moisture is various, as I have already said in the division.</end_of_turn
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you arrive at the care of a node, you must extract that and inquire about the commencement of the pain which is called internal, according to how its form will be in the chapter which is adjacent to this one.</end_of_turn
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And this is the method of inquiry for swellings and for all nodes, that you grasp this pain and bring that which is in the cavity which you find in the swelling, and you will remove the strings which you see until you know that the pain has penetrated the skin.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And finally put your hand according to the measure of the size of the swelling, and extract the internal part and consider what remains of it.</end_of_turn
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the current moisture of whatever color it is, you must prick it on the superficial layer according to what I have said concerning other swellings.</end_of_turn
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no moisture left from the internal part, you will know that it is fat.</end_of_turn
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry it over it in a cross shape according to this figure:</end_of_turn
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	Ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	May be if it is fractured in the operation, it is not possible to extract that callous matter, and many veins have been seen to bleed thereupon, and therefore you must extract it piecemeal until no cause remains.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if there remains any cause, slight or much, the node returns according to the way
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if sometimes some small part remains, then complete the wound with several corrosive powders and strengthen the wound, and place your hand over that which is to be sutured, and care for the other care until it is healed
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if the node is great, then you must clamp its lips and care for that which is inside.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	May be if the pulse is towards the opposite, or is not pulsating, then you must cover and empty the area of the wound with chaff which is old and rough, and apply that thread for two days or three until the wound is healed and the swelling has subsided; and then return to sawing what is left of the node.

And the ancients say that some inflammations of the joint are in places where it is impossible to eradicate them, just as in the breasts or in the groin and in the vicinity of the limbs that are allocated to expel all that, and more so when it begins small.</end_of_turn

And the operation in this case is when it is allocated as we have said, that you precede and leave the patient and purge of black bile some herbs, and I order you to care for that, if it is found to be useful in replacing the visible symptoms.</end_of_turn

Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recounted, in the division, of the species of dropsy of the water, and their signs, as well as the treatment of them with medicines.

sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	either of two sharp tongues long, or of sharp extremity thus as sponges; however, let it be little by little in each, so that in the operation there does not pass into the belly, and that you see that.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh. Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	However, if the generation of dropsy is from kidney disease, then your incision should be to the left of the navel for three fingers.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the generation is from the spleen, then your incision should be at the flanks
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And do not let your incision be over the rib where the patient is vomiting, so as not to cause the fluids to run to that place

E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And extract that and insert an instrument of this shape
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	which is like a silver cannula; it is made of silver or lead or gold, and in the lower part of it is a small hole, and on the sides of it are three holes: two on one side and one on the other side; and its use is to pierce according to the manner of a pen, as sometimes:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And in the extremity of it is an arm, because when the instrument reaches the water, then it immediately releases so much water that if you evacuate more than this in an hour, it will cause great harm to the patient for the resolution of the spirit animal, or injuries to the five senses which is close to death
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	However, evacuate according to the quantity of the vomit and according to what you understand from the patient’s disposition of the vomit and of the state of his body.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And extract the instrument, and retain the water which is the cause of this, because it is retained by the corden which retains the hole that is over the sac from which we have recommended that you pierce according to that manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And repeat the instrument another day if the patient tolerates it, and extract a small quantity of water, and do this for several days in fear, and take care that there remains no water except a little.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	However, if you are afraid of the patient, and you see a great quantity of water, then cure that which you must bury in fine sand, and bathe his wound in bath, and expose to the sun for a long time; and cure that which you must give drying medicines until he is healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize over the stomach, and the spleen and the kidney at the time of the extraction of the water, as I have recounted above in what precedes.
