Capitol .lvii.	Chapter 77
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Concerning the care of children and the treatment of those who have undergone circumcision
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution to all ailments, just as other diseases: more importantly, however, in children, since it is done of our own free will and for their own good, it is necessary that we assign in this operation a greater care and less suffering for the child.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore I say that the ancients did not speak of circumcision in their laws, because they did not use it, and it is only because we have learned through experience that the greatest part of physicians and barbers use circumcision for the novice and the barbarous; and they do so with thread and with an incision at the nail
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I myself have tried all these methods and I do not believe that there is a better circumcision than with forceps, with thread and with a faithful grasp of the nail, because with these methods the codena escapes more easily, because the cord of the prepuce is doubled, and the tension remains better, and it is less painful
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And in digital circumcision which is useful for alphbetization, and which is practiced by the barbers, the incision of the extremity of the member is not followed, for it is strong enough to enter through the opening of the member
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	More in the operation with the nail, attention must be paid to iron and corrupt your operation
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the cord of the child is short by nature, and often it is not necessary to perform circumcision in this way, and I have seen cases where this has been the case
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	More of the circumcision done with forceps and thread and faithful, the better, experiment has shown me that the forceps are in proportion to the incision, because the pain that results from the former is as great as the pain that is left; and therefore when you place your hand in proportion to these two pains, you make an incision according to a comparison in a time; and it is useful to compress the thread with a figure containing the entire cord of the penis, to which there is no error of any kind.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	The first method is that you must keep the child still if he is young, and if he is old you must only lie the thread in his penis alone, and you must read him to sleep within the other day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And so do that with all your ability so that he may receive his intelligence
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And so do that with your hands placed calmly prepared, and do not be stupid; and hide the forceps in your hand or put them in his foot, so that the child does not see them or any other of the instruments.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And so put your hand on the penis and blow on the cord, and pull that until the head of the penis is withdrawn, and then perform that which is added to it from the moisture.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And so tie a loop with the thread doubled, and then tie another loop below that one, and then place your thumb and index finger on the back of the penis and indicate the place where you want to make the incision, and make the incision between the two threads
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And so elevate the cord gently and pull out the head of the penis; and read to him to keep still, for it is better; and when the powder has settled down, place a swab of lint on the wound where there is blood with congealed blood in watery urine containing oil of rosemary recently boiled; and leave that on until the next day; and care for it until it is healed
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The form of the forceps for circumcision is as follows:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	The one that is not curved at the tail and the other is curved, that it does not reach the root of the claw, and that the length of the two points is as great as the length of two fingernails together
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	More an error in circumcision is that it causes the excision of the entire intrinsic cord or part of it from the incision
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Therefore take your time with your hand and with your nail before the apostemaction of the area and make the incision according to equality
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot take it with your nail, take it with your thumb and make the incision there
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	More if three days have passed, and the swelling of the penis has subsided, then you must read to him when it is convenient to make the incision, and remove the clot with ease, and make the incision as you are prepared
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	Keep your head still, for it will not help you.
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	Therefore take care of that which is at the root of the disease that has been recommended in the treatise on humors.</end_of_turn>
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	And if it is necessary to make an incision according to measure, and you obey the orders, then it will not cause them any harm.</end_of_turn
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	And take care of that which we have said is necessary for their recovery.</end_of_turn
Capitol .lviii.	Chapter 58.</end_of_turn>
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Of the care of retained urine in the bladder.</end_of_turn
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is caused by excessive fullness due to stones or sand, or by poverty or carbuncles, and it is similar to what we have said concerning the methods of treatment in the division.</end_of_turn
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	And if the urine is not dissolved, and you see that the retention is due to stones that are already in the neck of the bladder, then you must order that the patient be encouraged to walk around for a while.</end_of_turn
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	And then put the patient's feet on the bed of the sickroom and extend the lower limb from the hip downwards, and the patient will strain out the stone as much as possible.</end_of_turn
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore when the stone is expelled from the bladder through the posterior parts, the urine will be perfectly clear.</end_of_turn
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if it is not dissolved as we have said, and it appears that this is the cause of the disease, then you must administer the extraction with an instrument called a siringua, which is like this: made of silver or bronze, with a needle like a barleycorn about half as long, to which is attached a tube of about the same length.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the manner of extracting the urine from the patient is that you take the loop of the tube and bind it at the exit of the bladder with good ligature; then you introduce the loop of the tube into the cavity through the opening of the bladder, and remove any excess by means of forceps, but do not insert the needle too deeply. And then tighten the bladder around the tube and around the hub of the needle.</end_of_turn
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And do the patient sit on the edge of the bed, and bandage the bladder and the groin with oil and wool, and olive oil and vinegar.</end_of_turn
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And then withdraw the needle slowly so that it does not cause any pain; then bend the bladder downwards towards the navel; then grasp the tube with your thumb and index finger; and finally grasp the bladder itself with your other hand. When the needle has passed through all these layers, the patient will feel relief from the pain, and this is not in vain according to this order, but in the place where there was previously pain, there will be no more.</end_of_turn
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And slowly pull out the tube with the urine, so that the urine does not irritate the bladder.</end_of_turn
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Thus extract and care for the urine, and use a siringua, do not cease to do so until the bladder is empty and the patient experiences relief from the pain.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .lix.	Chapter 59.</end_of_turn
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of the qualities of the clamp and instruments for bladder irrigation that are suitable for this purpose.</end_of_turn
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When there is an ulcer or swelling in the bladder, or sand, or if the bladder is narrowed by a stone, and you wish to instill water and medicines, then it is necessary to use a clamp to hold the opening of the bladder. This is how it is made:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	So if the bladder neck is deaf, it is closed.</end_of_turn
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And there are three parts to it: two from one side, thus as many times.</end_of_turn
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	In the beginning is the loop with the liquid which is to be instilled, and as much as it covers that, so much more is added, until when any cause is overcome by this, that is to say, when it is expelled, it is expelled along with the liquid, and when it is expelled long, as the clamp holds that which is in the bowels of the sea.</end_of_turn
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore, when you wish to instill liquid in the bladder, insert the clamp into the liquid and draw out that liquid which is in the bladder, because the liquid is expelled from the cavity of the clamp.</end_of_turn
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And then insert the clamp into the neck of the bladder according to what has been said concerning the siringua; and grasp the liquid with the clamp, because that liquid will reach the bladder in this way, and the patient will experience relief from the pain in this way.</end_of_turn
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	The bladder is crystallized in the shape of a prism.
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	Whether it is caused by silver or lead, of which the head has more, or resembling a small pen, leave it as it is, bound by ligament.</end_of_turn>
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	Then take the bladder steadily, and suspend the humidity you wish to crystallize in the bladder, and then bind that between two strong ligatures, and heat that humidity over the fire.</end_of_turn>
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	Then pull out the extremity of the prism into the groove.</end_of_turn
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then open your hand over the bladder with the humidity that has been stretched out so that the patient does not feel that humidity has already reached the bladder.</end_of_turn>
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	If there is no bladder present, then take a piece of sponge and make a circle of it; pierce that through its entire circumference; and then insert a strong thread firmly through those holes, even if they are revolting; and then join the circle again as it is joined to the sponge, because you rest in that water which you take from the humors, and oil and water.</end_of_turn
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then bind that in the instrument as you did with the bladder, and express it with your hand until the humidity reaches the bladder.</end_of_turn
Capitol .lx.	The treatise ends here.</end_of_turn>
De extraccio de peyra.	From the extraction of the stone.</end_of_turn>
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already said in the division the species of stones and their care with medicines, and the difference between a stone engendered in the humors and a stone engendered in the bladder, and we will remind you of that.</end_of_turn
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said the stone in which catz operation is made with the hand, and section.</end_of_turn
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone engendered in the bladder itself is that which is left in the bladder.</end_of_turn
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And thus we have narrated that which is the exhibition and abreviation.</end_of_turn
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore I say that the stone which is engendered in the greater bladder mostly appears in childhood; and concerning its signs, that the urine which is excreted from the bladder is similar to water in its transparency, and appears in that sand; and the patient often has frequent pain in his groin, and swelling in the legs, and is dressed; and in that water there is found in the stool of those.</end_of_turn
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is laughable the healing of the children of that until they have reached thirteen years; and it is difficult to cure them in the old.</end_of_turn
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	More easily in the young than in the old.</end_of_turn
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that of which the stone is greater and the care is lighter; and if it is little, it is contrary to that.</end_of_turn
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore when we come to the cure of that, we must begin by making modification to the patient's pain by extracting all the pus that is in the abscesses that are in the groin; for that abscess with many swellings hinders the infection of the stone due to the inquiry of these.</end_of_turn
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And thus be present the patient with the groin pain and sit with knees bent and feet up so that the stone may descend to the bottom of the bladder, or that some swellings may jump from place.</end_of_turn
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And thus do that which is between your thighs prepared, and the greater part of them leave the cushions of their thighs, so that the entire bladder is made to lean downwards towards the parts behind.</end_of_turn
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And thus require that and all that surrounds it.</end_of_turn
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore if you feel the stone in the space, the hour you cover it so much with incision over it.</end_of_turn
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you do not feel it all, leave it touched slightly, and put oil on it as an indication of the left hand, if the patient is a child, or say half if it is a complete youth, and insert that into the groin.</end_of_turn
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And require of the stone until it is left touching it.</end_of_turn
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And convert that little by little into the belly of the bladder.</end_of_turn
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And thus place your hand over that which you touch, and expel that to the outside beyond the location from which you made the incision.</end_of_turn
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	Command the minister to hold the bladder with his hand; and command another minister with his right hand to extend the buttocks to the outside, and with his left hand to compress the cord which is left by the buttocks, in the part of the place where the incision is made.</end_of_turn
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And immediately insert the spatula, since this is its shape:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	And immediately insert the spatula, since this is its shape. Split it between the hip and the knee, not in the middle of the limb, towards the outer side of the left thigh; and make the incision over the heel of the foot and the heel itself. Make a transverse incision, so that the outer incision is wide and the inner incision is narrow according to the quantity of pus that comes out of the foot, and do not make it larger, for that would compress the heel that is in the buttock.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that from the foot there is some angle and margin, for that its essence is difficult to grasp by that.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And from that pus there is something like slime, which is round, and it is the cause of its lightness.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore if it is that from which there are angles and margins, adjust it in the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not thus forced, then you must hold that limb above that, or strengthen it above that limb conveniently, the limb which is like that to the limb which you strengthen over the foot, and do not neglect it; or that you insert your instruments under the curved limb.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	Or if you cannot do that, then expand the wound a little, and if you see discharge of pus, cut off the violent vomiting.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	Or if the foot is larger than one, then immediately put your hand to the mouth of the bladder, and immediately insert the spatula over it; and immediately push out a little of the pus; and do the same if there are clots of pus larger than two
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	Or if the foot is large, it is known that by making a great incision, two things happen to the patient: either that it is left there or that it causes the continuous dripping of urine, for which reason the limb is not completely consolidated
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	Or administer the evacuation of the pus that is outside, or engineer the fracture of the limb with forceps until you extract that in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Therefore when you have completed your operation, then fill the wound with aloe leaves and dragon's blood, and strengthen that.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And rest upon that limb immersed in oil and vinegar, or in scented oil and warm water, so that the cautery will be softened
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	And keep the patient lying down on the side, and do not remove the dressing until the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when that has gone, bathe the limb with water and oil, and care for that limb with ointment and diazepam until it is healed
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	Or if there is pus in the wound after the cautery, adhere and dissolve it, for if there is urine in the bladder (and that is known as the evacuation of the bladder), then immediately remove the heel of the foot from the wound and extract that pus, for if it remains it will cause the corruption of the bladder and its decay.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And finally wash the wound with vinegar, water and salt, and against all spices, with oil that will facilitate its healing.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And keep throughout the treatment that you lie both thighs together and adjust the medicines that are placed on the limb.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the foot is small and is in the heel of the foot, and is fixed there, and the evacuation of urine is prohibited, then it is known that the treatment must be prolonged, for this treatment is accused of cutting; and already I have mentioned that, and it is that you take a needle of iron to perforate it, of which this is the shape.
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	Triangular, extended, acute, fixed in flesh.</start_of_turn>
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	And immediately take hold, and keep that limb so that the foot does not return to the bladder.</start_of_turn>
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	And immediately insert the needle into the heel, perforating easily until the needle comes out at that foot
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And rotate the needle in your hand over that small foot, and you will perforate the wound until you have passed that of the other part to penetrate; for the urine will be discharged completely.</start_of_turn>
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And immediately put your hand over that which is remaining of the foot of the heel, which is tornated, and is forced by the urine, and the patient is healed.</start_of_turn>
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	Or if this treatment does not please you for any cause that hinders you, then immediately tie a thread around the foot and another thread untie the foot.</start_of_turn
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.
E aprop extratz aquela.	Then extract that.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	Then remove the ligament and restore the limb with ointment, which is useful in the plague
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And do not ligate the vein, but only that it does not return to the bladder, and the other ligate only when it is detached, because when it is detached the vein immediately resumes its course and causes the plague.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And for this reason when you have detached the vein, elevate the limb above the level of the bladder, or that it returns backwards through the belly, and cause the plague as we have said.

De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	From the extraction of stones from the thighs.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Stones in the thighs are rarely engendered
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	If however one sees stones in any of these, it is difficult to cure them, and it is prohibited by experienced physicians.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is that the strong thigh is pregnant.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	The other is that you do not find the stone unless it is expelled by the patient when it is cast out by the physician, or is from women who have had intercourse
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is that you do not find the stone unless you are taught this art, especially the operation with the hand
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	The fourth is that the place of the incision concerning the stone in the thighs is far from the place of the stone, because it indicates danger of incision, and in that there is fear
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	If however necessity compels you to do so, take a large stone that is well known, and little is found.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	If you have none of these, take a large stone that is almost white, or present a matron woman who has been proven in the art, or a woman who in this art has given birth easily
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	So present her and command her to do everything that you order her, from the inquiry concerning the stone from the beginning; for the reason is to learn if the woman is pregnant, for the hour that she puts all this aside and wants the stone
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	If you find it, cover that with what you have said, and command her to mark upon that place

E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	And then put your hand on the tendon of the testicles to the parts outside, and with your left hand stretch the white substance outwards, and elevate the blood to the part of the incision; and command the minister to stretch the blood outwards and you will dissolve the adhesion that is behind with the solution accomplished.</start_turn
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	And seek in the guts that there is no cause for the belly covered in the white hard substance.</start_turn
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	May it be that you find in them some cause, however, you will leave it inside the belly.</start_turn
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	And take a needle in which is strong enough to make four holes, and enter with it that which must be left under the tendon of the testicles, which is the incision; and when you have pierced as far as four holes, then join the ends that you have pierced so that they make a cross; and tie with it the part from which we have said that the tendon of the testicles is left with strong thread of two parts.</start_turn
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	And then cover the ends of the holes and tie them with strong thread until some of the blood vessels that nourish them do not cause any cause so that nothing bad comes from here.</start_turn
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	And wait another wound like the first wound, long of it less three times; and when you have put two threads that lie outside the belly that is left from the tendon of the testicles as much as the size of the thumb, and pierce all that remains round about, and keep the blood inside.</start_turn
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	And then pierce behind the tendon of the testicles for the incision from which blood runs freely and safely as we have recommended that we have said.</start_turn
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	And then administer lard submerged in oil, and cover in the wound; and administer the thread that we have recommended (for some wounds the white substance of the blood is cauterized, which we have said above to be the fear of the flow of blood, for many wounds happen that these things happen).
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	And if the case is delayed, the cold water should be covered, and cover on that until it falls as we have said.</start_turn
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the wound with the other care of wounds until it is healed.</start_turn

De hernia ventosa.	Of intestinal hernia.</start_turn
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this hernia nothing has been seen that has been omitted in its care with the iron.</start_turn

De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	Capital . lxvii.
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Some veins become broken in the joints as we have said before, and we must examine the area
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And do not cause any injury to the veins of the geneius; and if you must, that is little; and return it quickly in all its entirety

E la cura de lu es am cauteri ayssi quo es precedida la narracio de lu.	And the treatment of them is like this, as soon as the story of them is finished

De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	Of the softening of the navel of the testicles.
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	Many veins the navel of the testicles in the cold season is softened to help soften the flesh that is between those and is feared for that reason

De castracio.	Of castration
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	Wise men say that castration is forbidden in our law, however, I remember it in this book; and it is not necessary to recall it except for two reasons, of which one is that the physician should know how to cure it when he is asked about it, since he knows how to cure it; and the other reason is that we often have need to castrate other beasts for our youth, for those such as dogs, and sows, and pigs, and the like.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore I say that castration is useful in two ways: either by traction or by incision.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	May be in that in which it is useful by traction, the way of the operation is that we must cut off the beast in cold water until the testicles are softened and limp and hanging down
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And then take hold of them with your hand until they are resolved and do not appear to touch each other
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	May be in castration useful by incision and section, cover that you have the beast and grasp the navel of the testicles of it with your left hand
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And then ligate the surgeon, and make an incision over every vein with a section so that two veins protrude.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And then make incisions of those which are more likely to be excoriated
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not neglect any cause of the abdomen of any kind, but only the abdominal fat which is over the veins
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And this method of castration is better than that which is for attrition, because attrition strongly preserves any cause of the testicles, since the beast desires to mate.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And take care of the plague until it is healed.</end_of_turn>

Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels. But if the other limbs are relaxed and the head is returned, the matron inserts the left hand; but if the mouth of the thigh is open, the matron inserts the hand into the groin, grasps the head, and pulls that which is said to go into the mouth of the thigh, and at the same time inserts one or two nails into it and pulls them out toward those.

But if the mouth of the thigh is closed by swelling caused by the cautery, cover that it is not beaten over it; and cover that you administer an effusion of oily humors.
E aministre emplastres; e segua le pacient en ayguas que mollifican e humectan.	And administer plasters; and keep the patient in waters that soften and hydrate him.
E si le fet es sobre le sieu costat, lahoras si possible es, sia agulat: e sia aministrat aquo que havem dit en le fet viu.	But if the foot is over the knee, if possible, is to be ligated: and to be administered what has been said of the foot living
E si aquo no es possible, lahoras sia inscidit en pessas, e sia extrayt.	But if that is not possible, cover that it is pierced in pieces, and that it is extracted<end_turn>

E si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras deyssendas en ayguas stipticas e aministra l’autra curacio.	And if an abscess occurs, cover that you drain in styptic waters and administer the other care.
E yeu ja e vist una femna en le ventre de la qual era fet mort, e aprop sobre aquel foc autra veguada emprenhada, e aprop foc mort es le fet autre.	And indeed I have already seen a woman in the belly of whom there was a dead foot, and I put another sponge over that one, and the other foot was dead.
Accidit al u aprop lonc temps apostema en le sieu embelic; e inflat es entro que foc ubert, e comensec a getar brac.	It happens to me or to someone long time postpartum in the belly; and it inflates until the foot or thigh is broken.
E yeu fu appelhat a la cura de lu, e medicat a lu per lonc temps, e la plagua no es consolidada.	And I was called to their care, and I treated them for a long time, and the plague was not consolidated
Adonc yeu pausegui sobre lu de alscunas causas emplastra de forta atraccio, e eyssic de lu un os, e aprop passero alcus jorns, e eyssic un autre os; e yeu fu trop meravilhat, cum en le ventre no sia os. E adonc yeu cogitegui que eran dels osses del fet mort.	And then I thought that these were the bones of the foot that had died.

De las formas dels instrumentz que so necessaris a extrayre le fet.	As for the forms of the instruments that are necessary to extract the foot.
Forma de vertitge am la qual es uberta la mayre:	Like the way of seeing where the major opening is made:
Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	This is the way of holding the limb in which the veins are ligated, to which two incisions are made at the ends of two toes
May empero aquesta virtitge cove que sia pus subtil de strictori, e sia fayt o de eba o de fust de boys.	May the incision therefore be made as small as possible, and may be made with a needle or with the edge of a knife or with the tip of a pair of scissors.</start_of_turn>
E sia la latitut de quascun fust quays dos ditz e le marge de quascu amdos quays un dit, e la longitut de quascu es un palm e mig; e en le mieg loc de dos fustz so dos ajustaments de aquel meteys fustz les quals ja son fermatz, dels quals la longitut es la maytat de un palm e un pauc mes, e la latitut de quascu es quay dos ditz, o un pauc mes.	And the width of each incision should be as much as two fingers, and the margin of each should be as much as one finger, and the length of each should be one palm and a half; and between two veins there should be two adjustments of that middle vein which are already closed, of which the length should be half a palm and a little more, and the width of each should be as much as two fingers, or a little more.</start_of_turn

Forma autra semblant de aquela pus subtil e pus leugiera:	Another form similar to the previous one, but more subtle and lighter.</start_of_turn

De extraccio de la segondina.	Of the extraction of the second toe.</start_of_turn

But if it remains close to this cure and is not expelled, when you command the midwife to immerse your left hand in olive oil or in milk of elder, and when you have introduced that into the wound and until it has become soft, when that has been found, take hold of it and gradually stretch it out, but if it is attached to the mother's belly, take hold of her hand as we have recommended, and when you have found the second one, pull that out little by little as directed so that the mother does not suffer excessive pain.

De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	For the cure of the child's buttocks that are not perforated.<end_turn>

De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	For the cure of fistulas that arise from behind.<end_turn
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	The fistulas that arise in the lower part of the buttocks are nodular and bulky, which arise from the buttock or in the space of the one part.<end_turn
E es una fistula o motas.	And it is a fistula or boils.<end_turn

E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm. E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.

And that which is known as fistula which penetrates into the belly and does not penetrate, is that you must tell him that it is at the end of the belly, and that you must try to remove it with a needle or with fire when it is crooked.

And take care of that which is wrapped in cloth around the border until all those tissues which have been adjusted are soft, and take care of that which is the medicine which engenders and consolidates the flesh, and if it is healed, it is well; but if not, it is not well in any other treatment

E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	Therefore, if you sense the tentacles and between you and her there is either bile or blood, and it is likely due to penetration, do not perform an operation on her except according to the way of faith and hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	The cause of which is to administer in her three ways: either that you cauterize that area as we have said; or that you drain that which you consider to cause the curvature of her [foot] in order that it is possible for you to introduce the instruments and the cure itself; and do not proceed without causing damage to the wound containing the bone, and that you take care of the patient immediately regarding the exit of the disease; or that you strengthen that which we have said that is strong if she is sick; or that you stretch her out very much and tell her to pull out that pus which you drained from her foot, just as we have said, or with another sharp instrument, and that you modify those wounds that have burst open which are in the incision that you make; and that you endeavor to restore the whole of the wound that you opened, and if the pus is not consolidated, and the fistula remains open in the part of the foot, and if there is still pus in the wound.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes the fistula is ended in this way: when you insert the finger into the fistula, and it is at the back of the foot around the surface of the body and on the edge of the foot, then take hold of the finger and perforate the extremity, that is just as if you were preparing the flesh in this way.</end_of_turn>
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and insert it into that firm covering of flesh or around those; and then insert the finger with force into the fistula until you have caused the curvature of her foot.</end_turn>
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	Maybe if it has penetrated the edge of the foot properly, then extract the thread from that wound as soon as you have introduced it into the foot; and extract the extremity of the thread and adjust the two extremities even, and bind each one, and keep her quiet for a day or two, and when it has subsided somewhat reintroduce the thread into the flesh; and when those flesh has been injured between the two extremities of the thread and has become soft, break it off.</end_turn>
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And take care of the wound until it is consolidated and healed.</end_turn>
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	Maybe if the opening of the fistula is not penetrating, then do that which will penetrate, in whatever way you are prepared, but do not do it carelessly, for that would be your fault if you were to cause her injury; and do that until it is healed.</end_turn
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The way of treating the spiny thorn of which the fistula is formed: the curvature of which is not acute and the other part is not blunt, so do not cause any damage that is not necessary, even as sometimes.</end_turn
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	Suturing of wounds in which there is running suture in the incision of those.</end_turn
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Wounds are of two kinds, either those that remain between the thighs as if they were of cartilage, or those that are like grass seeds.</end_turn
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And of those there are small and large, and that run from these to these places and is one, and is not many, and is outside the thigh, and in the extremities of the thigh.</end_turn
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	But indeed those that are outside the thigh are according to the measures of little humidity, of which run citrine water or a little of white ointment continuous, and according to the color of the flesh.</end_turn
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the treatment of that which is inside the bone is that you order the patient to rest and express himself until the bone is healed and the wounds appear on you.</end_turn
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then you will keep me shut and suspend the thread or that you have at your nail, and in this way you will prevent them from bleeding.</end_turn
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	Maybe if you do not have nails in those for the humidity of them and their softening, then take the thread from those which you have at your nails and make it rough or thick or flabby of wool, and extract those from the wound, and then insert those again and sprinkle over them some fine powder near the incision, so that it adheres to them instead of cauterizing; or cauterize those as it is said in the chapter on cauterizing.</end_turn
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And take care of those as well as with the other treatment until they are healed.</end_turn
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	And if the thigh does not obey discharge, then order the patient to cry out in the place where there is slight pain, and wash it with the water that is in the bone and let her discharge willingly when the patient groans.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	Maybe if the wounds are outside the thigh, the cause of them is light, and that you take hold of those with your nail, or that you take hold of those with a thread, and insert them, and take care of those with water as we have said until they are healed.</end_turn
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	He guessed the translation as follows:
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And thus do all these things, and leave one of them out and do not burn them, so that the excess of the sacred oil may flow from that.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	And then place your hand over the groin immersed in rose oil or in beeswax; and place that over the heel and command the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then leave that enter which case; and when it is closed, care for those at ease or another care within that it be healed.
De curacio de fistulas.	Of the care of fistula.
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Moist wounds arise from the excessive secretion of pus or from the constriction of nature.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And since they are ancient and have no value in that medicine, when you see that they are moist and the pus that comes out is soft and hosts the scurf of pus that prevents them from solidifying; then care for them until they are solidified
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	When you see them again in a more violent way than the first time when they are raw and are excoriated; then care for them until they are healed
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	Of the care of wounds, this is key
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	You must know that to apply pressure is key, and it is not if you do not notice redon according to the color of the body resembling the head of a nail, and it is useful in all parts of the body and especially in the lower parts of the feet and the buttocks, and because of these pains you must support them.</start_of_turn>
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And then cover that which is in the circuit of the key, and keep it with forceps or a clamp, and extirpate it from its root; and then care for that.</start_of_turn
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you wish, cauterize according to what is said beforehand in the head of the capital.</start_of_turn
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	More of a verucca is a small rough fistula round about the surface of the body, and moist wounds are found in most of the children.</start_of_turn
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And the care of them is to stretch and scratch that, or to stretch that with a faithful thread or with a needle inside the box.</start_of_turn
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you wish, cauterize that as we have said, with fire or acute medicine.</start_of_turn
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And thus they are eradicated both backwards and forwards with the instrument which I will tell you.</start_of_turn
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	More of a wasp is a small fragrant or large fistula around about the surface of the body appearing like a bruise in it, and is useful around the body.</start_of_turn
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And the care of them is that you take a needle of fine awl or of needle of turtle, and that it is strong, and place that on the wasp inside that it contains the circle of the needle of the parts of it; and then rotate your hand with the needle until you have instilled what is in the circuit of the wasp, and place that in the crease of the flesh and that you evacuate the wasp from its root.</start_of_turn
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you wish, do that with a needle of barley or iron according to this manner:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	The part behind the needle will draw towards softness, deaf (that is not perforated), enclosed so that over the thumb the learning of the hand is ablated and the revolution of that.</start_of_turn
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you wish, cauterize the wasp as it is said above in the cauterization of the vein in the head of the cautery.</start_of_turn
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	In the way of the instruments that are administered to give comfort.</start_of_turn
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Some moist wounds are useful for the comfort of silver or lead or tin or malleable; and some moist wounds are useful for those instruments that are administered, for those that are administered in the care of young children should be small; and for those of which the buttocks are rough or painful, the comforts of those are small.</start_of_turn
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The form of great and little comfort.</start_of_turn
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The head of the needle in which the bag is bound is wide according to this manner; and be distinguished by that where the bag is bound thus as often.</start_of_turn
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	The limb affected with the pus is that which is included in the groin (so it is not opened like a lion), lagging behind slightly; and on one side of the limb there are two incisions, and on the other side one, and the size of the incision is according to the size of the rays, and the larger the better.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And the dressing in which the medicines of bladder of beast or of goat's skin are placed, and the size of it should be like a palm
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it should be pierced with four incisions as if it were a wheel; and if the space between the incisions is the thickness of a finger
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And insert into those incisions faithfully strong thread, or around those; and adjust so that the dressing is firm; and when it is placed in them the dressing should be straight on the tip of the penis between two cushions, and press firmly on each incision: the better the quality of pressing on each is that you fill the dressing with medicine, which should be scaled according to the amount of the patient's tolerance; and take care that it is not too cold or too hot
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And the patient should be placed lying down on the two buttocks, and lift up their limbs above and rest them on something on which they already rest or a cushion; and anoint the affected limb with oil or with white of egg or with fennel mucilage or with alum; and insert that into the groin with ease, and the minister should support the dressing and express that out through two more times with great force until it is evacuated in the belly all that is in the penis; and then remove the penis and the patient takes back their limbs to the side.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces him to vomit, keep him under control as much as possible; and if he sleeps like that for the whole night, it is better to delay the treatment
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	Better if you keep quiet about the belly troubles and the vomiting of the patient, the hour you will repeat the cautery until he is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if in the groin there are embolisms or blood clots, the hour the penis should be stiff like a lion, from the penises with which the children are accustomed.
De curacio de las plaguas.	Take care of the plague.<end_turn>
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	I have already said in the division of the care of the plague that it was appropriate for the free man, and I say the same about the care of those with wounds and medicines according to the compliment
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore I say that the plagues are diversified according to the cause of the plagues and according to the place where the plagues occur
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes for which many people suffer from plagues are various, such as from a bite of a dog, or an incision of a space or a nail, or percussion with a lance, or with a fist, or with an arrow, or like those of many other causes
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	Better the plagues that are in the places of the body are like the plague which falls on the head, or on the arm, or on the leg, or on the belly, or on the heel, or like those of the members
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I recommend the care of some plagues so that you stop that reasoning and rule about the others.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will start with the simple head plagues, for the memory of the compound ones will come at the beginning of the third chapter
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore I say that when there is a simple head plague and it is not a fracture, consider: if it is from a bite of a dog or something similar, and if it has only drunk the codena and it is a great plague and you fear that there will be a fistula because of it, then you should immediately cover the head and perform a cephalic flebotomy as soon as possible; and extract according to what is necessary of the virtue of the medicine, as long as there is no other prohibiting cause of flebotomy, especially if the medicine that is to be extracted is that of the plague and is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And the bleeding of the opposite side of the afflicted area; and keep the patient from eating and drinking and eating coarse food
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	Better if from the beginning you prohibit any cause of vomiting, although it is not prohibited, reduce the food and do not approach meat or wine
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And rest until the plague, if there is a fistula caused by the cautery, soak in oil of rue solet or in wine where it is stipped.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	Better if you are sure of the cautery fistula, the hour you rest until the plague, if it is recent at the buttocks and the air has not changed that dust which I recommend to remove little by little
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed that, the hour you rest until it is healed
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	May be if the plague is great or if it is due to insufficient space and crowding, and the lips of the patient are not adjusted for vomiting, then adjust those at the sutures according to what I recommend for the sutures of them.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	Maybe if the plague has already been expelled from the limb and is not retention but a slight swelling, then prick it and apply medicine to the wound and restore the limb in its place instead of excision, and command the patient to abstain from eating foods that are coarse: heads and brains and the like for them, until it is digested.</end_of_turn>
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find decay in the limb and it does not adhere to the bone, then prick all around the area and evacuate it, and then apply medicine to it.</end_turn
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	Maybe if in these plagues there is an artery or vein from which blood flows of a healthy nature, and it is not closed by medicine, then inquire about the artery, and if you find that it is not closed, then prick it with the spatula or ligature; and if necessary you must cause that which we have said must not be done, then cauterize it until the blood is clotted.</end_turn>
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these plagues are simple and small, then the cause of them is slight; thus sprinkle over them this powder, which when solidified will cause the air to dry them out.</end_turn
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: take olive oil half a part, of blood one part, of vinegar two parts; let them all be ground together and sieved, and let the plague be filled with it, and let it be bound by good constriction until it adheres, and let it be coagulated with blood.</end_turn
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.
