The quality of the phlebotomy of these people is that you strengthen the limb with a tight ligature or with your hand, since you have placed it in cold water, until the vein is swollen and is clearly visible; and then perform the phlebotomy on the transverse; and if you prick it in this way it does not cause any pain in return
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And keep that you do not touch your hand with the phlebotomy, for it leaves the nerves of the fingers denuded of flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And repeat the hand in cold water and let the abscess run in it, for if you do not repeat it in cold water, the abscess will coagulate in the orifice of the vein, and this is prohibited from flowing
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	When the abscess is extracted according to the quantity of need, then leave the vein covered with oil and salt, so that it is not solidified too much; and immediately cover that you have made a complete wound
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	More useful is the phlebotomy of the left hand, as it is related to the diseases of the heel.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And do the same thing in the phlebotomy of these people as you did in the other one.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	The advantage of the phlebotomy of the median vein is for the diseases that are in the lower part of the body, as well as for major diseases, such as retention of menstruation, and the diseases of the veins and ulcers of the buttocks and old wounds, and the like of these
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	The quality of the phlebotomy of these people is that the patient puts the whole foot into cold water and makes over that friction until the veins appear; and leaves over the wrist joint with the vein appearing from under the skin, and the part of the vein that is seen outside must be grasped by the thumb and the four fingers of the hand.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	Therefore, phlebotomy is better with a wide opening or by leaving the limb over the ankle rather than by causing the accumulation of blood in the limb which is more harmful and salty
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	If you phlebotomize on the face of the foot, then you must take care of the nerves that are left over on the face of the foot, and stop your phlebotomy at the level where you phlebotomize, as if you were going to prick it
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And so be it.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	If it is prohibited to drain the abscess; then repeat the foot in cold water and let the abscess run in it until it is evacuated
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	If the phlebotomist makes a mistake in the first attempt, then repeat the phlebotomy a little later, because the limb is salty; and do not be afraid of it, but take care of the nerves as we have said
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And do the same thing with the other foot in the same way
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	As for the sciatic vein, the part as we have said is over the heel of the heel bone.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	The benefit of flebotomy in such cases is to do it when the cause is known to be from caut.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	The quality of the flebotomy is that the patient groans in pain, contracts and tightens the flesh of his belly up to the navel, and keeps it pressed down by four fingers on a long strap, which does not appear except in such cases.</end_of_turn>
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And therefore, when it appears, do the flebotomy according to each case, as to the vessel, and it is better; or insert it by incision or extract it by incision, because the location is outside.</end_of_turn>
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is in most men more hidden; and if you find it and it does not appear to the feeling of all, do the flebotomy of some branch of it, and that is the one that appears in the two of the foot between the heel and the ankle.</end_of_turn
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	Beware of the nerves, and make the incision run smoothly as much as you wish.</end_of_turn>
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Then remove the stricture and place your hand over the area of the flebotomy to keep it firm, because it is healing.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	From the instructions and qualities of its use.</end_of_turn>
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Winds are of corn, or of hemp, or of ivy.</end_of_turn>
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And the wind is useful in two ways: the one is by sacrifice and extraction of blood, and the other is by incision.</end_of_turn
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this incision that is by sacrifice is done in two ways, either by fire or by knife.</end_of_turn>
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And to the winds that are administered with sacrifice and extraction of blood are fourteen parts of the body, of which one in which winds are stopped is the ankle; and the middle part of the thigh; and winds from the mouth go beyond the jaw; and winds of two spatulas; and winds of alohoster, which is over the heel; and winds of two flames; and winds of two bras; and winds of two cavities; and winds of two nails.</end_of_turn
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And the wound does not extract blood from the great veins scattered throughout the flesh, and for this it does not possess the power for these; just as is the case with flebotomy; neither does it suffice that the incision should be made by fire or by knife in any disease that is not cured by the evacuation of all the blood from the body.</end_of_turn
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	Maybe if necessary we will cause an incision for disease or for continuing, let us administer it at the beginning and at the end of the month, and in the middle and at any time.</end_of_turn
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause of which is that in many men in whom blood is multiplied to such an extent that they do not digest the extraction by incision and find in the head a great gravity and sadness; and in those the finding is repletion and swelling in the face and head, and in the chest; and in those the finding is itching in the face and front of the head, and darkness and debility in the legs; and in those who vomit the place of their incision; and in those whose laughter is multiplied; and in those who find a bad taste of blood in their mouth, or that their tongue is swollen and spitting blood; and in those whose sleep is multiplied, and in those who see blood in their sleep swelling, old age, spots and other causes that remain with them.</end_of_turn
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore, when in any case of these, and properly when it is in the third or half of the month, it is commanded that the wound should be made more beneficial than it was passed over two or three hours ago.</end_of_turn
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	The benefit of the incision of the nape is that when this confers gravity to the head and to the belly; more than that, it is that it is almost the evacuation of all the body.</end_of_turn
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this incision is in the place of the cephalic flebotomy.</end_of_turn>
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	It is not proper that it should be used by anyone who is fatigued or in whom is catarr, because it gives great harm to that.</end_of_turn
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And because of this it does not suffice that it should be used by the old, and in the heads of those in whom there are feverish diseases.</end_of_turn
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	More than that, if on that one should continue with it, it is beneficial to forget; and for this it is commanded that you order the cauturer to stop his hand a little with the vein at the edges, fearing the generation of forgetfulness.</end_of_turn
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	And the incision of alochohel is in the place of the flebotomy of the jugular and of the basilica: and for this it confers to spasm, and to the constriction of bile and to the scissura of the suffering of bile, and to coughs, and to repletion.</end_of_turn
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	The wind that proceeds from the alekel, if it is stopped, generates weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	The exhalation of vinegar causes headaches, ophthalmia, diarrhea, and toothache; it is in place of the quibble of the bile.</end_of_turn>
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And let the exhaler keep his hand away from the scarification so that he does not wound the artery and cause blood to flow excessively.</end_of_turn>
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	The exhalation causes nausea in the mouth, corruption of the gums, and remains of the diseases that are in the mouth; it is in place of the purging of the bile that is in the two lips.</end_of_turn>
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	Better is the exhalation that is made over the two spatulas than that which is made over the head, which is useful for replacing heat.</end_of_turn
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	The exhalation from the armpits brings relief from the phlebotomy of three veins, that is, of the basilica, jugular and cephalic, for those that accompany the blood from all those veins that are more abundant in the body, and those smaller veins that are among the larger ones until they reach the attraction of the three veins.</end_of_turn
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the exhaler not to proceed too much with the scarification, for the location is denuded of flesh, and leave the nerves and arteries.</end_of_turn
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a wind that is exhaled over the cushions and causes hemorrhoids in the buttocks and ulcers afterwards.</end_of_turn
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And let the exhaler take a great breath, and that it be from the chest, for the location digests of great heat; and take away the slight exhalations and perform the scarification with a scarification.</end_of_turn
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	Better are the great winds from the armpits rather than the small ones, for they bring blood to all the body, and relieve ancient pains of the coughs and of the belly, and of the bladder; and they cause the menses, and relieve swelling and pain; and they are in place of the purging of two large veins, and of the vomiting, and of two cavities.</end>
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, do not let them do all this throughout the body, for it makes the pulse accelerate in many people.</end_of_turn>
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And the exhalations from the armpits bring relief that is proportional to the relief of the winds of two armpits.</end_of_turn
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	The quality of the position of the winds is that it stops the initial exhalation and lets out a temperate exhalation, and do not prolong the position of the winds, but rather pause them leisurely, and remain in them moderately, and that the humors arrive at the location immediately to follow.</end_of_turn
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease this until you see the location already shrink and swell and that the color of the blood returns.</end_of_turn
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And when you have finished the scarification, repeat the exhalation slowly and gradually, and pay attention to the condition of the body.</end_of_turn
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For a person who has tender flesh of rare pores, command that you do him a single scarification and no more, for the location is not to be ulcerated.</end_of_turn
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the exhaler to expand the scarification a a moderate degree and breathe slowly, and do not hold your breath.</end_of_turn
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if there is thickness in the blood, then command that you make two incisions, for in the first incision open the way for the subtiliation of the blood and the moisture of it.</end_of_turn
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	Better is the second to the piercing of the extraction of the thick blood.</end_of_turn
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is not thick, then command that you make a third incision so that you can achieve the fourth degree.</end_of_turn
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And finally, when you wish to extract the blood slowly or a little, suffice with a single scarification.</end_of_turn
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if you wish to extract a lot of blood, make several incisions; and if you know that the blood is thick, then command that you make a transverse incision.</end_of_turn
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the end of the incisions is only the depth of the groove.</end_of_turn
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if that from which the groove is large, hard, tough, and has narrow pores, command that the locations of the incisions be oiled with gentler unguents, resolving; if it is in summer, thus as olive oil of aloes or oil of violets, or oil of rosemary buds, or almond oil; and if it is in winter, then oil of nutmeg, or oil of lily, or oil of chamomile, or of alum.</end_of_turn
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	If the excess is great, hot, then let it be applied with marigold, or balsam oil, or aloes oil, or anise oil, and so forth.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	If the wind is strong from wide fields of barley, then let it be forbidden to apply oil, and let instead the parts of the wind be washed with vinegar or cold water of the sun, or with water of lilies, or with water of meadows, and so on.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And as for him from whom the moisture is excessive, wash his windings with wine vinegar, or with water of myrtle, sumac, and so on like those.</end_of_turn>
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And as for him from whom the excess is great, wash his windings with strong vinegar, or with water of rue, which is elderberry, or of decoction of anise, or of chamomile, and so on like those.</end_of_turn>
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And let the wind be kept away from the bath; having said that, let it be administered alongside the bath for an hour or two, and let it rest alongside the bath.</end_of_turn
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is it that is useful to return the wind from a phlebotomy before the wound?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	Let us consider at the outset: if the wind or the one who must perform the phlebotomy is coleric and has a wound over him acute and inflamed, then let us anticipate frigid causes, such as many vinegar and lettuce, and sage, and fennel, and chamomile, and so on like those.</end_of_turn>
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And abstain from foods such as poultry, fatty meats, and foods seasoned with vinegar, and the like.</end_of_turn
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And as for him from whom the complexion is hot, let us anticipate the use of cold baths, or of cold decoction of sage seed, sumac, and fragrant herbs between wool and linen; and let him be recommended to drink little and eat sparingly, and abstain from poultry, meat, fish, eggs, almonds, and cabbage.</end_of_turn
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And let the drinks be greater in the day of the wind and phlebotomy than the food.</end_of_turn
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And let him be given in drinking water in several hours before breakfast, or medicine of musk, such as muskroot, or alum, before or alongside the wind or phlebotomy or alongside, so that the principal parts are comforted and the wound is soothed; and let them not take vinegar or wine.</end_of_turn
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	And the winds which are harmful are those which irritate the chest, and the foot, and the navel, in the joints, and the scrotum, because these members suffer from no sacrifice.</end_of_turn
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired for those except for the attraction of the wound of a member, as when a wind is held over a wound of the body in a disease of excessive flow of humors from the head; and they use it so that the cold wind is dissolved from the member, as when it is held over the belly and the navel; because thereby the member is softened and the pain that resolves the cold wind is removed.</end_of_turn
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is already said concerning the hiccups when they happen together with vomiting, because by their attraction a strong wind is produced which evacuates vomiting from its place.</end_of_turn
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	Similarly, when it is held over the chest and the foot, it expels the cold wind in those closed spaces.</end_of_turn>
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	These winds are administered cold with vinegar only; and some are administered with fire.</end_of_turn
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some are administered full of cold water in the diseases of the foot.</end_of_turn
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is because the wind must be full and great, so it is cold water alone or cold water in which appropriate herbs are boiled.</end_of_turn>
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of wind administered with fire: the breadth of the orifice of two fingers, as we have formed it; and the quantity of resin is that of a palm; and let it be placed on the flank, in the place where it is in the circuit, as much as it can hold, the neck be small according to the quantity that enters it with a needle.</end_of_turn
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Let there be applied vinegar or lemon, marigolds, laurel, ginger and ivy for so that it does not make the member move from its place over it.</end_of_turn
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And let there be placed between the thumb and the little finger a sponge or iron, where a candle is held with the fire.</end_of_turn
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And let this wind be much greater than the one we have recommended; and let little be taken of that according to the diseases and the condition of the one who uses it.</end_of_turn
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	The winds of the elderly are more widespread than those of the young and of robust bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	The quality of placing this wind on the limb is that it extends the flame towards the wood with a slight touch of candle wax, and place that above the middle of the transverse vein in the middle area of the wind, so that the flame is kindled around the edge, so that it does not burn the body of the patient.</end_of_turn>
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And so it should be kept on the limb of the patient, and it is said that when we have said these things, when we have the winds and do not order that they stop and that the vapor escapes from that wound, the wind will be so dispersed.</end_of_turn>
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And so we light the flame according to its custom, and repeat that if you order it thus.</end_of_turn>
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	More in the wind that is administered in the disease of pleurisy, with water, in which there is no transverse vein or wound, and is not administered except that it be full of water, and is placed on the limb alone.</end_of_turn>
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the way: And this wind, the more it is great, the better, because it receives a great quantity of water.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xcvii.	(The text ends here)</end_of_turn>
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Blood does not flow in all limbs, but only in those in which the position of the wind is not possible due to their small size, thus as with the thumb and little finger; or in limb denuded of flesh, as it is said of the nose and nails, and in such cases.</end_of_turn
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those which you have found in the deep waters of poppy flowers.</end_of_turn
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And so they should be left lying down day and night in deep water until they are faint, and that no cause remain in their belly; and that you evacuate the body at the beginning with a phlebotomy and with winds; and that you cool the limb until it turns red; and that you place them over it.</end_of_turn
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And thus they are full and cases.</end_of_turn
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to extract the area from the wind, it is better later in treatment.</end_of_turn
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, the hours wash the area with cold water and add a little more; and keep it cool and squeezed.</end_of_turn
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the duration of the treatment is prolonged, add to the case of bloodletting, and when that is done, put on a cold pack in the water, and place that on it until the discharge is finished.</end_of_turn
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the disease is multiplied, the hours sprinkle over it powdered vitriol, or urine and it resembles the causes of stagnation, until the disease is expelled; or that you place over the area the masses of scraped honeycombs, and that you leave them until the honeycombs adhere to the area, and the disease is expelled.</end_of_turn
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if necessary, repeat the bloodletting, when possible change those.</end_of_turn
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if bloodletting is prohibited, the hours keep the limb fresh or leave a needle in the area until the disease has gone away; and so they are placed, so that when any disease should happen again it is supported.</end_of_turn
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want to close, sprinkle over those a little barley flour or salt, or ash, and close tightly.</end_of_turn
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus ends the procedure of the third part: restoration.</end_of_turn>
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very useful necessary in the art of medicine; and is the restoration of fracture and dislocation of bones.</end_of_turn
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, wise men, listen to me! The fools of doctors, the vulgarians, and those who at some time do not remember the ancients or do not read their books.</end_of_turn
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason it is useful that this manner of science on our land is private; and I have not forgotten it at any time in my life; and I have not omitted anything from it, except for the length of reading the works of the ancients and studying to understand them, until I have extracted the science from them.</end_of_turn
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And so I direct to experiment and study throughout my life.</end_of_turn
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all that concerns my science and about which I have experimented; since I have abbreviated it from you others and released you from the burden of lengthening; and I have opened it at the end of abbreviation; and I have shown you at the end of the declaration; and I have formed in you various forms of the ailments that are administered in this way, as it is done in addition to the declaration, as I have done in the two preceding chapters.</end>
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collection of this fracture of the bones, from which it is necessary to make a preliminary statement before we proceed to the description of the fractured limbs and their various conditions.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us speak in the preface of this chapter of the sums of the speech; and the chapters to understand of which in the beginning is forced to learn the artifices and to be fixed on the truth of those things; so you and those who know or learn this noble art from you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	Therefore I say that when an accident occurs to a fracture or dislocation or twist or casement, it is necessary to start immediately with bleeding or to apply a bandage, or whatever, if you do not prevent any cause, even if it be with the greatest virtue, or if it be an infant, or an old person in decrepitude, or if it be a time of great heat or of great cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And so be content in food with fresh herbs and fish and crab; and prohibit large meats and fill them out with foods and all food that fills the veins of health, within that you are sure of the after-effect of the cautery, and if you do not fear the effusion of matter from the limb.</end_of_turn>
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And so return the patient to their first position as they usually do.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	Therefore when the bone is being restored, it is necessary that the patient be given nourishing and nutritious food that is not too thick and difficult to digest, such as porridge made with flour and water, broth, eggs, fish, beef, almonds, and peas, and in this regimen there is a coagulation of the fracture that is more tenacious and lasting.</end_of_turn
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And you must know that bones break when they are in the homes that are in the first youth and in the decrepit, it is not possible that they should continue and be consolidated according to their nature except for the dehydration of the limbs.</end_of_turn>
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature at all times by the dehydration of those limbs, and they continue and are consolidated those that are of them at the end of the convalescence, as in the bones of small infants.</end_of_turn>
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	More importantly, however, nature adjusts and remembers that the fractured bone of any kind that remains swollen and tense adheres to that which adheres to it until it is congealed and united together, until the end of inflammation and convalescence, as fire is at the beginning, until any cause does not prevent it from doing its work.</end_of_turn
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary to rest the food of the patient, food that is heavy and viscous and large, as we have said.</end_of_turn
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Many different fractures according to the diversity of the limb.</end_of_turn>
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And you must know that the species of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the limb, for example the fracture of the bone of the thigh is different from the fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the foot is different from the fracture of the bone of the forearm; and similarly all the others are diverse among them.</end_of_turn
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I shall return with a reminder of all the species of fracture, which are explained in the different chapters of this book.</end_of_turn>
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Many different fractures in general.</end_of_turn
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And they are diversified the species of fracture of the bone in their metaphysis; for example, a fractured bone in its star is different from one that occurs in its marrow; and a fractured bone is different from a fractured bone according to its length: and the fractures of the tibia and fibula are caused both by traumatic and untraumatic factors, just as it is in writing when it is prepared to be written, and is a fractured bone with plaque and disruption in the head, and is a slight fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And for each species there is a peculiar remedy or treatment in the restoration of the limb as will be reminded in the different places.</end_of_turn
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Sign of fracture of the bone.</end_of_turn
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And for this it is known that a fracture of the bone: there is stiffness of the limb, and swelling and prominence of the limb to the touch, and pain when pressure is applied to it with the hand.</end_of_turn
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	Therefore when there is no apparent stiffness or when it is not believed to be present, do not touch the bone with your hand, for the patient does not experience great pain in that case.</end_of_turn
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	There is also possible that it is a slight stiffness or a small fracture, in which case you must not touch it with your hand or compress it; there must be rest from the medicines of which you have been reminded at that moment when it is convenient; and take care to avoid strangulation.</end_of_turn
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	The pain that arises when the joints are affected by cold humors, which infiltrate every part of the body, and when pain occurs in the feet, is commonly called gout by physicians.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	If the swelling persists after the cautery treatment, let it rest for a few days until the swelling subsides; and in the meantime, apply any means that can lift and suspend the limb.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	It is better to restore and elevate the limb than to fracture the bone in which the discomfort originates.</start_of_turn>
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	Therefore, remember this case for future reference.</start_of_turn>
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	If the limb is fractured in the bone, it is necessary to extend the limb in two parts, whether it is the hand or the foot; or hold it with your hand if the limb is small; or bind it with two strings or one string and the hand.</start_of_turn>
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And keep the limb in the position in which it naturally rests, while the fractured parts are extended, for in this way you will prevent them from becoming swollen and causing further discomfort.</start_of_turn
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	Be careful not to cause additional pain or injury to the patient during the treatment of the pain; and use the amount of force that is necessary to effectively perform the operation.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	Take advantage of this opportunity to touch the patient's hand at that moment, and if there is any other cause, rectify it and suspend it to the extent of your ability.</start_of_turn
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	Avoid excessive extension and compression, just as wise doctors do when performing cautery treatment, for this can cause swelling in the limb.</start_of_turn
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And finally, take note of the following: apply cold compresses, equators, and gentle traction to the limb, and rest and tranquility; inform the patient about the treatment and have them rest during the night and day, and observe their progress and pain; and do everything in your power to prevent any movement of the limb; and change the position of the limb if necessary, so that no discomfort is caused; and keep the limb in a relaxed and comfortable position, so that the limb does not suffer from any deformation when restored.</start_of_turn
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	The quality of the limb's traction is that which you will recommend; for you know that fractured limbs are diverse in size and shape.</start_of_turn
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And as for those that are small, such as the arm, the finger, and the toe, it is necessary to wrap them with a soft bandage.</start_of_turn
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	As for those that are large, such as the thigh or the forearm, it is necessary to wrap them with a firm bandage, which will securely connect the large parts to the small parts with the engagement of the surrounding tissue.</start_of_turn
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And finally, start by evacuating the fracture, and then apply appropriate traction to the limb with three or four bandages as necessary; and hold the limb firmly with your hand.</start_of_turn
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	Observe the most elevated part of the fracture location, and tighten the traction more than necessary to ensure the stability of the fractured area.</start_of_turn
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And gradually lengthen the bandage over the fracture location, and soften the traction gradually until a large part of the limb has been recovered.</start_of_turn
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And take another bandage and cover the other bandage over the fractured part with the previous bandage; and see that the bandages are placed at a distance from the fracture; and that your treatment is in the traction and softening of the bandage as we have said concerning the first bandage.</start_of_turn
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And if there is still discomfort in the limb, stop between the stops of the lion or leopard that supports the fracture, if there is discomfort; but if not, do not stop for any reason.</start_of_turn
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And stop again on the other side, and gently wrap over these bandages that are properly placed without causing swelling or cautery-induced swelling; and leave it for a few days; and in the meantime strengthen the surrounding area.</start_of_turn
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura.
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura. Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter two: On fracture when it occurs in the head
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The varieties of fractures are many, and their figures are diverse, and their causes are diverse, for every fracture is caused by impact of space, and the impact hinders all the bone within the cavity, which is left in its place, just as happens in the forearm; and for this reason this kind is called spiral; or the space impacts any part of the bone, and impacts the marrow and does not pass through the back of the bone; and this kind of fracture is called elevation absolute.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the plague of these two fractures is great or small, and of a fracture that is contracted or retracted; and the cause of these is impact with the palm of the hand or by falling onto stone, and their symptoms resemble each other.</end_of_turn>
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating, which has already approached the nerve which is left in the bone; or it is in the face of the bone, and the plague of these two fractures is great or small.</end_of_turn>
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And a fracture is that which is hidden in the bone, in the small groove of the bone, and for this reason this kind of fracture is called capillary.</end_of_turn
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And a fracture is caused by impact or by falling or by impact of stone, and its symptoms are that any layer of the bone enters the surrounding parts, and it is caused in the hollow part just as happens to the fingernails when they are impacted and some of them enter the surrounding parts.</end_of_turn
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And most frequently it is caused in the bones of humous substances, just as in the heads of nails.</end_of_turn
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these mentioned fractures are traumatic, just as separated stars.</end_of_turn>
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I come to regret all this.</end_of_turn

And I know all these kinds of fractures by detection on those which are open and for inquiry of their extent and in order to determine whether there is corrupted bone over them.</end_of_turn
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And the capillary fracture is known because it is discovered on the bone, and it is excised, and the surrounding area is tented, so that the fracture appears black.</end_of_turn

Moreover, in the treatment of fracture, one must take into consideration at the outset the signs of illness, and when sometimes for the signs that signify importance appear, such as vomiting of bile, extension, loss of consciousness, loss of voice, fainting, fever, and sudden loss of consciousness and rigor of these symptoms, despite all this, if the patient does not recover.</end_of_turn>

And this is the form of three species of superficial marks: The quality of perforating in the circuit of the fractured bone is that you pause the mark on the bone and rotate it with the thumbs saying that the bone is already perforated; and then change the perforation to another place and stop when there is between all the quantity of the thickness of the ray or send it away.</end_of_turn
