And in addition to the inscription of the inscribers between each fracture of the bone, do that which is more subtle than to do over that in order to avoid lifting, as we have said, until you have eradicated the bone, or with your hand, or by any other cause for some tremors which appear over that, as for example, nails and fine forceps.</end_of_turn
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And be sure that the inscriber does not touch any cause of the hernia.</end_of_turn>
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And therefore when you have perforated the bone and if it is continued with it, and if you take that out, be sure that you raise and expel that which is in the roughness of it from that which is in the bone like another inscriber, but indeed that it be more tender and subtle than the others.</end_of_turn
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any small parts of the bones and fragments remain, then take that out easily with that which is due to you from the pangs; and indeed take care of the wound with liniment and ointment which we have mentioned.</end_of_turn
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And another manner of operation is light, long, which says dissect Gualia and laze for great relief; and this is the word for it: it is necessary for you at the beginning to discover the part of the bone in the place where the fracture is the most acute and obvious, until when you have discovered that part and you have stopped leaving that extremity of that inscriber slowly and joyfully of which this is the form:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And that the blunt part is round and does not touch any cause, and the acute part is of it in two directions forward and backward, as sometimes; that the blunt part be adjusted to the hernia with the face of the acute inscription on the bone.</end_of_turn
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And indeed pierce upon the inscriber with a little hammer so that you inscribe all the bone easily as it is rotated, and you will be sure of the accuracy that it does not happen by chance that the physician is the most fool of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he was sleeping.</end_of_turn
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	And if there remains any attached cause to the bone in various places of the bone, inscribe that at the extremity of the inscriber that is blunt, and expel that which is at ease; that is delayed of it spontaneously and by fear.</end_of_turn
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate inside the hernia, and that which is broken or remains of the bone is the face of it, and remains in it roughness and subtle fragments, then be sure that you raise that roughness and expel those fragments with subtle reasons for which you have prepared the number, of various quantities so that it is possible for you to manage them in all places with the greatest convenience and the greatest safety of those according to which you have lost your operation that fractured bone and its figure.</end_of_turn
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And be sure that you manage in your reason the quantity of the bones at the beginning of those reasons, and indeed use almost all of the soft parts of it, and do not cease until you have finished administering the greatest and the most subtle of all those.</end_of_turn
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	Indeed in any other small fractures capillaries and subtle fracture, be sure to manage carefully according to what you have lost to rectify it.</end_of_turn
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	It is because it is not known to anyone who has studied that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And so we have learned from the great fractures that...
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	If the swelling is rectangular when you radiate it from the bone, then take an amount of lint corresponding to the amount of the swelling, soak it in oil of ravens, and place it over the wound; and take another lint doubled or tripled and soak it in wine and oil of ravens and place it over the first one, and do so until the pus comes out readily from the wound without causing damage; and then apply on it some lint of lint and do not tighten it except as much as the swelling itself.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave it like this for a day or two until you are sure that the wound has healed; and then remove it and administer medicines that are appropriate for such cases, such as flaxseed and oatmeal, and powdered gentian and aloe, and similar things to these.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is that you must sprinkle these medicines finely over the swelling; and generally, administer any medicine that has the property of stopping and not killing.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	Observe with your wisdom that the swelling in your treatment should be neither too little nor too much; neither should you irritate it with oil or any other substance; and do not add any venom to it, for when it is applied to the bone it corrupts it and brings about the death of the patient, and brings about evil to the patient.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it is necessary to take into account in the fracture of the head, as it is more difficult to heal the bone and especially when the treatment is negligent, and is black on the surface; and therefore consider that if such an accident befalls the patient, it is dangerous in every way
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if no blackening has occurred except from the medicine that is being used, and it is because of that medicine that this blackening has occurred, then take a little more of the medicine and three parts of oil of ravens and mix with these the mentioned balsam, and place it on the fracture; and do so until it is healed
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	On the restoration of the nose when it is fractured.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Observe that the nose is not fractured but rather that two larger portions have been separated from each other, or one of them is somewhat softened, so that there are two bones remaining, for the separated part is cartilaginous and is not fractured but is rather soft and flexible and susceptible to bruising
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	If indeed one of the two parts is fractured, then you must insert a little bit into the nose at the site of the fracture, and stabilize that fracture by means of the tape called indicator and the cushion, until the nose returns to its natural shape
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And do so easily, and keep in mind that you should not cause him any pain during this operation on the patient's pain
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	If the fracture is in the soft part of the nose, and you say that it is not necessary, then keep it equal to the width of the ray in which the thickness is small
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, do the same for it as for the other
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	Close up the restoration of the nose on the first day of the fracture, if possible; otherwise, leave it for six days or until you have seen signs of healing
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And insert into the extremity of the nose a bandage of lint, if the fracture is in one part, or two cushions, if the fracture is in two parts, and the thickness of the cushion should be such that it fills the cavity of the nose
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	Tell the old restorers that the cushions must be bound in border, and must be changed throughout the day, although you are not told to me; because it must be covered with an albumin of egg with powdered lead.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And there are some who say that instead of a cushion they will put honey into the nose, because it is more enveloping of the bone than the lint; and that when the nose is fractured the patient is not prohibited from inspiration
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	This is not necessary for you; and if you wish, do so, and if you wish, do not do so.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another remedy has happened post-caut, plaster the nose with cheese or with lead soaked in wine and oil of ravens, or with vinegar.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	Although it has not happened post-caut, nevertheless you must plaster the outside with barley flour and powdered gentian mixed with egg white; and put over it a layer of lead, and do not touch the nose for any reason whatsoever
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	May it be that if the bones of the nose are fractured in a slight or great degree, that you split over those [fractures], and extract those with instruments that are appropriate to those; and then close the wound, and care for that which has been rent in and consolidated, and with appropriate plasters.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if there be pus in the nose, then care for that which is scaly and administer lead canulas until it is completely healed.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter III.</end_of_turn>
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	Of restoration of the mandible when it is fractured.</end_of_turn
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the mandible is fractured and the fracture is not accompanied by pus, it is necessary to determine if the fracture is displaced only, and not fractured in two and bent outwards. In this case, the knowledge of the fracture is slight.</end_of_turn
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	Therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, insert the index finger of the left hand into the patient's mouth; and in the same way if the fracture is on the left mandible, insert the index finger of the right hand; and push with that the swelling of the fracture outwards, with your other hand on the outward part of the bone; thus you will equal that side.</end_of_turn
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the mandible is already separated into two, then care must be taken to administer extension of two parts according to the rectitude until it is possible to equal them.</end_of_turn
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there be displacement of teeth with fracture, then strengthen those which you expect to remain with gold or silver or ivory; and place a cerate over the fractured mandible, and place over it a bandage of gut or silk, and a pad over the large hip bone adequately placed; and tie that which is displaced according to what is appropriate for the ligature of that and convenient for the application, until it is not destroyed.</end_of_turn
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	Command the patient to rest and tranquility, and abstain from eating spicy foods.</end_of_turn
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you find that the figure has already been altered in any way, then you must cover yourself and remove that on the third day; and then rectify what has already been altered in it and plaster that with powdered gypsum, glue of hog, or oatmeal, because you have left them without support, and place over the plaster bandage of linen.</end_of_turn
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And now when it is fixed and adjusted that plaster over it, and the position of the bone is not altered, leave that for a while, that is, do not remove it until it is healed and the fracture is strengthened; for as many wounds as are left open will grow stiff in three months.</end_of_turn
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another wound occurs afterwards, care must be taken of that which has been said of open wounds until it is healed, and remove that aftercare.</end>
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is accompanied by pus, consider if it is a broken bone or a swelling, because in this case you must order the removal of those swellings in order to remove those which cause discomfort.</end_of_turn>
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the opening of the wound is narrow, care must be taken to widen it with the flebotome according to the quantity of your need.</end_of_turn
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And when you have removed those swellings, and of those you do not remove them, care must be taken to close the wound if it is wide; otherwise, place over that one of the plasters which is convenient and consolidate that.</end_of_turn
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.</end_of_turn
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Of restoration of the thyroid when it is fractured.</end_of_turn
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	A wound is called fractured when the thyroid is fractured from the front towards the back of the muscle, and that fracture is caused in three ways.</end_of_turn
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	For it is fractured, or separated, or is separated into two parts without causing swellings; and it is difficult to restore it; or it is accompanied by swellings, and is difficult to restore it; or the fracture is accompanied by pus.</end_of_turn
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation in that is that two assistants are present, one to support and follow the fractured thyroid, and the other to extend the collar towards that part.</end_of_turn
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	Then wrap the fracture with the index fingers of both hands until the shape is restored according to what you consider, neither too taut nor too concave.</end_of_turn
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you need more extension, care must be taken to suspend the patient's breath by holding his breath or by applying a bandage to his mouth; and the degree of this must be according to the quantity of your need; and extend and elevate the thyroid and cover the wound with your hand until you have secured the fracture as you consider appropriate.</end_of_turn
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	If the wrist cannot be drawn out beyond the joints, so that it reaches the preon, then cover that the patient's head should be supine and rest a cushion on their muscle.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	The minister should support the limb beyond the joints until the wrist bone has been elevated to the preon, and then rectify the fracture and bind the parts together.</end_of_turn>
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	If you feel the wrist bones dislocated and swollen, cover that area and extract those fragments with ease.</end_of_turn>
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the fracture is retained in the bone, generate an incision of the limb with one of the instruments that you have provided, because you have left the wrist bone with the pain it had before; and this pain is of the kind of fist or iron from which this is the shape of it.</end_of_turn>
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	It is similar to a wound from which this is the cavity; and its width according to what you need of it, according to the size of the bone or the thinness of it.</end_of_turn
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	The length of the incision should be as much as possible for the operation; there should be two limbs available as many times as possible, and one limb should be wide and the other narrow.</end_of_turn
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the disruption of the membrane that you have incised when you extracted the fragment from the bone is wide, and you are sure of the hemostasis, then you adjust the two edges of the wound with sutures.</end_of_turn
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is slight, or if you fear hemostasis, then you should cover the wound with a dressing and powder according to the amount of the wound.</end_of_turn
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if bleeding occurs, apply pressure with wine vinegar and olive oil, and hold it over that area.</end_of_turn
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	When the bone is fractured and the wound is closed, place a plaster cast made of wheat flour and egg white, and place it on the limb, stopping the tingling of the limb, if you have noticed it, and take nourishment, for the Saracens say that it should be long enough to reach the elbow and as wide as from thumb to wrist; and cover the wound with double powder. Take a splint of moderate size, which is three fingers wide and of a length similar to the limb. Wrap the splint around the limb and the cast on the part above the fracture; and take nourishment in the same way as before, and rotate the limb and the patient’s hand over the fracture, and reduce the fracture to its original position, and when the fracture is relaxed with the fracture, that is what is not hidden from you.</end_of_turn>
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	All this, however, that the splint should not rest on the fractured bone; and so that you can see the patient every day, because when the ligament is softened or the splint is already softened, then you should rectify this and strengthen the bandage.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And so keep the patient’s hand elevated over the limb, and let the tingling of the limb be covered with a small cushion at night; so that the adjutorium of the limb is elevated to the level of the wrist joint; or that the arm is bound to the limb at the wrist.</end_of_turn
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	Do not remove the ligament if bleeding does not occur in the place or if hemostasis is not achieved, within twelve days.</end_of_turn
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And if you have seen the face of the limb at that time, renew the plaster and adjust the fracture, restore that and leave it until the fracture of the wrist joint is healed and has coagulated.</end_of_turn
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	It is strong and comfortable according to the month in xxviii days, and several visits in several homes is done in the space of that time.</end_of_turn

De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Recovery from wrist fracture.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The scaphoid bone is fractured in the lateral part of the limb and is not fractured at the edges.</end_of_turn
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And therefore when it is fractured in the middle of the limb – and it is fractured in the middle of the limb – and is not known except by touch, then according to the figure of the fracture force you to prepare it and reduce it according to the natural figure in every way that is possible for you to do.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And so keep over the powdered wheat flour and egg white with an egg; and cover the limb with a splint of moderate size.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	If there is a depression in some parts of the spatula, then you should cover that depression with a soft stop, and equalize the splint.</end_of_turn
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And thus stretch out their arm with a long handle from the constriction downwards until it reaches the ankle bone without being impeded by the heel of the foot.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	Consider the ligaments in every limb; and when any is softened, stretch the other until it is equal to the ankle bone if it is impeded by the heel of the foot.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And I grasp the patient over the ankle bone like this
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	The spatula is restored in twenty days or in twenty-five days.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And thus when this number is completed, then dissolve the ligament, and know that what has begun from the bones should not be feared or dissolved
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed from the ankle bone and put down the tendon, then split over them, and keep them apart, and do as has been said concerning the fracture of the scaphoid bone after excision of the callous.

De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the foot bone.</start_of_turn>
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The bones of the foot are fractured in the middle of the limb and thus it is necessary; but the extremities of the limb must not be moved until they are cicatrized and reduced.</start_of_turn
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And concerning the accidents of the limb when the middle is fractured, that it declines towards the heel and causes great pain, and difficulty in walking, and sneezing, and vomiting; and is declared in the cavity of the fractured bone and is not hidden from sensation.</start_of_turn
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of the limb is that you rest the patient over the two ankles, and put between the heel of the limb a cushion; and then press on the muscles of the limb, and adjust the ribs of the limb to the greatest extent of two ribs, and suspend yourself in the operation of the limb and in the equalization as much as is possible and convenient, until you return the shape of the bone as it was before.</start_of_turn
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	And thus suspend over it the plaster and bandage and pause over the heel of the limb a soft cushion of gauze or leather and keep it like that; and close that in a loop; and suspend yourself over the fractured bone that it is not maimed; and move along the limb following the rounding of each bone, and stretch that which is strained downwards; and consider the ligament in every hour, and when it is softened stretch that one.</start_of_turn
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if necessary you must provoke a swelling of that, you must correct the fracture or pain, or swelling that occurs in the limb; then you must withdraw and remove that and evacuate the plaster and rectify what has occurred in the manner of limb care; and then return the plaster, sometimes to the extent of the face; and adjust the fracture until it is healed.</start_of_turn
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.</start_of_turn
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	Of the restoration of the ribs when they are fractured.</start_of_turn
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	You must know that a fracture of the ribs does not crack through but in hollow places that follow two; and from the extremities of them from the upper part does not happen except for that which is cartilaginous.</start_of_turn
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And you must take cognizance of them, you must not hide the inquiry from the sensation of them as it is said.</start_of_turn
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration is that you bind the fracture as it is said according to the possibility, until it is bound as it is enough, and then plaster it and stretch the fractured bone with the ankle, if you wish.</start_of_turn
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the fracture of the ribs is declining towards the heel, then it causes the patient severe pain and puncture, as if it were a puncture that occurs to that which has pleuracy; and for that reason the bone is put under the membrane; and it causes difficulty in walking, and sneezing, and vomiting without relief; and this is of difficult care.</start_of_turn
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And already the Ancients have invented in that that which is not to be moved is to be held.</start_of_turn
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And thus they say: keep the patient still from eating and drinking that which brings about swelling and wind, so that the belly is not swollen and is extended, and the fracture is not impeded by the parts outside.</start_of_turn
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	But let us beware of that so that it does not become the cause of causing callous. If it does not happen, we will help it to happen.</start_of_turn
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And I say to you of some of them that it is to be stopped from their excessive windiness; and that they should succeed with force; and indeed it is like reasoning, but indeed it is feared lest the wind should tear away the superfluous things from the limb for the fracture.</start_of_turn
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	He said to them: cover the area with a cloth that is already immersed in oil, and sprinkle powder between the ribs until it is full; let the ligature be tight when it embraces that according to its roundness; and then cure the patient with a plaster of food and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	If it causes acute constriction of the patient who does not suffer from it, and if the bones are pierced with a pointed needle, remember about the patient, for when you cover the area, uncover the ribcage, and then take off that instrument which conserves the bag, recalling which is prior, and that it incites the bones easily, and extract it.</end_of_turn>
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And also let us adjust the two lips of the wound, if it is large, by stitching, and cure it with plaster until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if it happens that pus comes out, then cover the area with powdered charcoal in oil and rest over the area, and let the patient be cured with what covers the pus.</end_of_turn
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And rest on the side on which you sleep, until it is healed.</end_of_turn>

De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	Restoration of fracture of the spine and the pelvis.</end_of_turn>
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Some veins are seen to be fractured in the bones of the pelvis, and the physician must attend to them, and similarly to the vertebrae of the spine.</end_of_turn
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And when this happens to someone and you want to know if he is healed or not, consider that sometimes the wounds are already softened and softened and softened and dead and you cannot move them or extend them or flex them without causing them pain, and when you squeeze them with your fingers or prick them with a needle and they do not feel any pain, then you know that he is not healed, and in such a state it is mortal.</end_of_turn
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if you touch them and feel that they are constricted with the fingers and pierced, then you know that the bone is saved and the patient will recover with care.</end_of_turn
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see the vertebrae of the spine like this and you want to know if he is healed or not, then consider the weight of his feet.</end_of_turn
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	Sometimes when they are softened, accidents happen to those which are accustomed to it in the greatest, and when you sit on the two feet, you feel dizziness and vomiting, which is its will, and many veins are seen supine on the two feet and they cannot urinate, then you know that it is mortal, and do not work in his care.</end_of_turn
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	Maybe if no other cause is seen in them, the cause is better and lighter.</end_of_turn
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the treatment of them is that you pierce the cavity of the pus with a cautery needle which rests on the fractured vertebra, with oil or with cold poultices of vinegar; rest over that any vein that gives blood to the fractured vertebra until the pus is softened.</end_of_turn
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	And let us pause one of the existing comfortable plasters and stretch over that which binds; and command the patient to rest and be quiet and not to sleep on the side where he feels pain until he is healed.</end_of_turn
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if an accident causes the fracture of the sacrum or any other cause which has already been separated from it, then cover that area and keep that bone still; and adjust the two lips of the wound, by stitching if it is large; and care for that which is inside the wound, until it is healed.</end_of_turn
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	Maybe if the heel of the bone is fractured, and it is the end of the limb, then cover that area with your left hand on the buttock, and grasp the fractured bone with your other hand as much as is possible for an equitable proportion; and then rest over that plaster and bandage, if necessary, and stretch that.</end_of_turn
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	And if you feel the sacrum fractured in it, then keep that area still, and keep that, and care for the wound with the care that precedes until it is healed.</end_of_turn

De restauracio de la ancha.	Restoration of limb.</end_of_turn
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the limb have fractured, and if they fracture, the fracture of them is nothing but communication in the extremities of those and are inscribed in the length and decline to the inward parts; and an accident happens to the patient pain in the area and puncture, and the limb is stupefacted when it is fractured.</end_of_turn
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And the restoration of them is that you extend your hand over that which is over the fracture which is the figure of it.</end_of_turn
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	If the fracture is only in the extremity, then embrace that part as much as is appropriate until it is reassembled to its natural shape.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	If the fracture is on the thigh or that it has already declined downwards, then make the patient sit on the edge of the bed until the fracture is restored

And thus when it has been restored, place your hand over the plaster, and also over the heel or ankle, and hold firmly over the area where you do not fear puncture of the fracture or loosening of the staple.

If by chance the cautery should slip, cease the extension of the limb and the restoration of the limb until the burn of the cautery has subsided; and place your hand over the limb until it has healed; then return to the restoration of the limb, and hold firmly as before

De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	On the fracture of the ankle and the bones of the foot and the toes.</start_of_turn
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	The ankle does not usually fracture; however, the bones of the foot sometimes fracture; and the toes rarely fracture, and it does not happen to them except in cases of great violence.</start_of_turn
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	And if the bones of the foot must fracture and sometimes those bones must be elevated between them, then you must place the foot on the prepared ground like when going out.</start_of_turn
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	And suspend one foot over that which is elevated of those bones, and support them, and press, and heal those until they are restored in their places.</start_of_turn
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	And suspend plaster and stop discharge, and keep the belly of the foot a little wider than a small loaf of bread with two plaster caps.</start_of_turn
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	And strengthen that which is stretched out that has been straightened, because you have covered it with cloths and other causes that indicate.</start_of_turn
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And when three or four days have passed, then you will remove the ligament, because you will find the bones healed, or fractured or dislocated, and the operation in those is as dangerous as with the needle.</start_of_turn
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	However if any of those bones are fractured, then restore those, and keep those as I have said and recommend concerning the restoration of the fingers of the hand.</start_of_turn
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	Then pause for a moment, according to the length of the finger, and put a little pressure on it; and then let the patient rest on this table which is recommended to you, and strengthen that restriction downwards.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	May be if these bones are fractured two or three or more, then you pause on each finger until you have grasped the amount of their circumference covered in soft leather, and strengthen the table at the bottom of the foot, and stand on one of the feet of the table to keep the belly of the foot well retained.</end_of_turn>
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	And it is convenient for you to remember that you must not neglect other causes which we have mentioned in other fractures of the accidents which we have mentioned; and be attentive to every mishap in which you suspect a fracture.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.</end_turn>
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	Of fracture of the bone of the thigh and of the fibula and of the heel bone.</end_turn
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	When the bone of the thigh is fractured, then cease that movement in the groin, and incline that towards the side of two, a little, and keep it from behind.</end_turn
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	And put the mattress under the hip, and make a point in the hip as much as you hope; and elevate the two little bones gradually, until everything that is outside is forgotten until the fractured part returns to its place as much as you hope and the fractured bone returns.</end_turn
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	And pause the powder over the two of them, and when you wish to urinate, remain in the groin easily and approach; and reduce and return that as you commanded at the beginning, and approach returning the powder first.</end_turn
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	And do thus for seven days or until it is restored.</end_turn
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if you wish, take once of vinegar and strengthen over the ankle a tube of glass; and put the whole bladder into the hip, and approach sprinkle in the tube with force until the bladder is inflated within the hip, because the fracture returns.</end_turn
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And approach both with hip and stay for five days as we have recommended, until it is healed.</end_turn
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	And when the bone of the fibula of the foot or of the thigh is fractured, then administer in the restoration and agility of them what we have recommended for the bone of the ankle.</end_turn
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And what is hidden in these principal fractures is not hidden in these fractures; and little do they know those who study and use this book well; for that fracture means to you in the greatest possibilities of physical restoration and in the strengthening of them, and therefore understand well.</end_turn
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	But when the heel bone is fractured, take gauze of wool, and put the heel bone in that; and pause over the covering of the cloth, and be covered, and approach leave it for three days or until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.</end_turn
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	Of the restoration of fracture of the bones when it is soft.</end_turn
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	It is convenient in that in which the fracture occurs with soft swelling, and more especially if the bone is great as for example the bone of the thigh or the ankle bone, or something similar, that you take care of these things and flebotomize them as much as possible if the conditions of flebulation allow you or if the testifiers tell you so as we have said.</end_turn
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the swelling subsides healed, then cover that you keep the retention of them in that way in which you powdered over them before it was shattered, if for another cause it does not exist.</end_turn
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	And approach commence to restore the fracture in that same day, and do not prolong that, if not after that.</end_turn
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	But if after that there is apostemal discharge, then leave the restoration of them until the apostemal discharge has ceased, and do not approach them for three days and three nights in total, for you will cause other accidents.</end_turn
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	But if the fractured bone is prominent over the edge of the wound, then cover that you perforate to reduce that and to equalize that as much as the greatest ease and with little extension.</end_turn
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	But if the extension is not to your liking and the equality of them with the thighs is not to your liking, then you reduce that as much as your greatest ease; and that is a wound that is made of iron, the length of which is of seven or eight and the width is according to the quantity of the swelling; and for that it is necessary for the doctor to anticipate those three or four according to the quantity that you indicate in the care of all sorts of fractures.</end_turn
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	Be gentle, and take little hold of the limb for fear of breaking it during the operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	Be cautious of the limb to which the mark is made in the groin; grasp it loosely so that you do not damage the surrounding area.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	This is how you do it:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	It is called in Greek "labre volentz atelarem", so be gentle
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	Because it must be held elevated above the limb bone that is prominent
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And pull out the limb until the bone returns, and keep it equalised with any bandage
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	Therefore force the limb to be equal between the fractures, and if the fractured limb is slight and you do not perceive any discomfort, then you must insert the limb back into the bone so that the instrument has power over it
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	If you are unable to reduce the bone completely with what we have recommended, then you must cover it with what covers the incision of the physicians who have advised you; or saw off that part with one of the saws in whatever way you can
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And remove that which remains in the bone of roughness and small sores.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	When the bone is reduced and the patient feels great pain, know that the bone has not been returned to its natural place; and then do what you can to comfort the patient greatly
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When the bone has been restored as you have done, and when you have submerged the limb in black vinegar, and properly if it is summer, and do not put anything greasy or oily on the wound, so that it does not cause swelling and corruption
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And immediately administer cold compresses at the time of the meal to complement the restoration of the bone, and leave the wound uncovered until you have sutured it with needles and used bandages according to the quantity of the wound
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	Beware that you do not pull the wound at the fracture, because it may cause the physicians to lose faith in the treatment, and it will cause great pain to the patient, either death or serious illness, so be careful
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if the limb is stiff, soft, different from the stiffness of other fractures
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	If the wound is large or bad, and you fear concerning that limb the accidents that we have recommended, and you feel pain in the area, know that you should not put on the stitches, but rather put on a dressing of coarse cloth instead of needles and strengthen it with those
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	And when a few days have passed since the wound began, if it has become engorged, know that the limb has regained its natural position, and immediately administer calamine, which is what we usually do for wounds, along with tetracycline and similar medications.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	Remember that you must remove the dressing and consider the wound every morning and evening until it is consolidated and stopped, and that the limb is prepared in such a way that the swelling will recede from the parts below with ease
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If several days have passed since the wound appeared, and it is neither consolidated nor has it been excised from the limb, know that here is an obstruction of the small ones so that you must examine the wound again with more attention
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And from those obstructions those that are separated remain and are extracted, those that are not separated remain and cause the limb to swell and cause pain, pierce through to insert them as you can.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	If gangrene or blackening occurs in the wound, it is a sign of festering or other kind of corruption and putrefaction, know that you must immediately seek advice from the chief physician regarding the treatment which is preceded by narration in the capital city
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o .xxx.; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And when you are in doubt as to what should be done and your appearance is poor: when the limb is bruised, pay attention to the limb as if it were the bone of the thigh or the knee, and like those of the great limbs, and do not presume any attraction of it, or the extraction of it which may cause death; have the limb left in peace until it has healed naturally, for it is likely that it will fall away by itself within approximately twenty or thirty days And if you take care of the wound as I have said, and if you do not leave it, it will heal by itself
Capitol .xx.	Capital city.
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	On the treatment of the wound which occurs in the aftermath of any fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	The swelling that has occurred in this fracture is particularly violent in the area of the joints and is often seen in this condition. It hinders the natural function of the limb.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Consider whether the swelling is recent and administer astringent medicines that have been shown to be useful in this condition, and see, and let the patient lie down, and ask about any nausea or vomiting, and look at the color of the urine; in this way you can take some of these medicines or all of them, and confirm that they are effective in stopping the bleeding, or amalgams of blood, or other hemorrhages, and place the hand over the swelling to prevent further bleeding.</end_of_turn>
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	Keep the limb still for several days; then remove it and repeat the process until the swelling subsides; or stretch over that lamina of membrane that hangs down, because it has the property of holding up everything that is swollen in the limb.</end_of_turn>
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Even if the swelling has already hardened and stretched, and it is necessary to drain it, do so cautiously, and take out the thickest parts first, and then remove the excess; or prick it with a needle so that the pus escapes, and keep it closed until it is healed; and take care of it until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
