De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	Restoration of the fracture when it is restored and then keep the limb still and flexible not according to its natural habit.</end_of_turn>
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a bone fracture has been restored, and then the limb is still and flexible, it is not useful for anything except for certain causes: of which one is the multitude of solutions of ligaments and that their tension is not sufficient; or for excessive tension of the ligaments so that the nourishment of the limb is prohibited; or for a multitude of unnecessary emboli; or for excessive movement that is not in its time; or for weakness in the body of the patient and for his debility.</end_of_turn
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	Care for this is to feed the patient and make him comfortable until his health is multiplied in him; administer baths; and give him wine and let him know about it.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And keep the limb still so that the wound does not prevent the limb from receiving nourishment, or continues to bleed excessively until the nourishment returns to its natural state.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxii.	End of treatise.</end_of_turn
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	Care for fractured bones when they are restored gently and prevent them from being operated on again by anything that covers them.</end_of_turn
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When an injury occurs to a limb that has already been restored, keep the healing process of the fracture slow and gentle to avoid further injury to the fractured bone and swelling, and is for this reason that faith is placed in the limb, even though the limb is not prohibited from its natural operation, however it does not cover that you must disobey the advice of the one who is responsible for the limb that it is to be treated for a new fracture.</end_of_turn
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	It is already known among doctors and restorers who have made use of us in this matter; and this operation is not to be repeated without great fear of the signal that is mortal.</end_of_turn
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	If swelling and nodulation are recent, it is necessary to drain them with lukewarm water in which there are many soothing herbs, such as chamomile, fennel, meadowsweet, and similar; or make an application of plaster with plaster of Paris or olive oil, and apply it; or take figs that are bruised with pomegranate seeds and dissolve them with honey or oil of chamomile.</end_of_turn
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	All these remedies are dissolved with constant gentle rubbing that is both in the hottest and coldest seasons, and is administered in every hour of the day.</end_of_turn
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	If the swelling has already hardened and is strong, and is converted into a stone, and is caused, it is necessary to care for it with fire, for the pus must be evacuated and the continuation of the bone must be dissolved, and it is to be understood that excess of swelling of the middle of the bone with the bone that is underneath is to be evacuated with ease and with study.</end>
Capitol .xxiii.	End of Book.</end_of_turn
De sermo en dislocacio.	On the matter of dislocation.</end_of_turn>
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the sudden displacement of any joint of the limb, which is prohibited from movement, and which causes pain and great lesions in the body.</end_of_turn
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when an accident occurs with dislocation, it is necessary to perform it as soon as possible so that it can be reduced, and do not delay, for if it is delayed, the limb is swollen and strong, and it is difficult to reduce the dislocation.</end_of_turn
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And let me remind you that during the apostate hour, neither must the patient be made to vomit nor stretch, for these things cause spasms and pains that are harmful.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	When this happens, the doctor must cover the patient's face with a wet cloth, and immediately administer cold water and oil; and gently reduce the pressure
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And all parts must be treated with the water from which the memory will arise in their location
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And thus I have ordered the heads of dislocation according to the order of fracture; from the upper part of the body inwards to the lower part of the body outwards.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIII.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	On the treatment of dislocation of the jawbone downwards
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	So dislocated are both mandibles if they are not taken hold of; and the dislocation of both is useful in two ways: that either they are slightly displaced from their places for little movement, or that they are completely dislocated and united, until they are softened at the junction where saliva from the patient escapes and which does not permit them to open their mouth or close their lips, and their tongue is wrapped in their word
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	When the dislocation is slight, the patient returns to their major position by themselves without any cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	When the dislocation is complete and united, the doctor must immediately administer reduction of it, and must not delay in doing so
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the minister has the head of the patient, and the doctor puts their thumb of their right hand at the root of the dislocation of the mandible inwards of the mouth, if the dislocation is of one side; or that they put their two thumbs together, if the dislocation is of two sides, and the others say from the rest of them to hold; and the doctor commands the patient to stop their mandibles and remove anything from their jaws; and the doctor should touch the mandible and bandage the mandible until it returns to its place
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction is difficult, and especially if both mandibles are simultaneously dislocated, the doctor should administer evaporation with cold water and oil, until the reduction of both is achieved and not delayed in both, as we have said
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And when they return and are softened, and the patient's mouth is closed and not softened, the doctor should suspend over those little particles of matter around the root, and apply wax and oil; and gently bind them with ligatures
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient sleep on their two sides, with the head between two cushions, so that neither side is injured; and do not force them to swallow anything further; have the patient's tongue tied, until when the pains have subsided and the mandibles are not dislocated, the doctor may give them something to drink again
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And let the drink be administered with ease, and do not work on the opening of the patient's mouth because of food and drink and conversation, until the mandible is healed and recovered
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if the reduction of two mandibles is difficult when they are dislocated at any time and is not converted to its proper place, the doctor must give the patient feverish sweats and vinegar drinks, and they are very likely to become agitated and vomit violently
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	When you have done this many times, the doctor will learn that it is a loss; and most of those to whom this has happened die within a few days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	On the reduction of the dislocation of the collarbone and the extremity of the muscle
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The collarbone is not displaced from the back because of its continuity with the ribs; and some say that it is displaced outwards, and this is known from the feeling

E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And thus this remedy is reduced to the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from the socket.

De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.

And thus this remedy is reduced to the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from the socket.

And thus this remedy is reduced to the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from the socket.

And thus this remedy is reduced to the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from the socket.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	And thus this remedy is reduced to the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from the socket.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And thus this remedy is reduced to the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from the socket.

And thus this remedy is reduced to the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from the socket.

And thus this remedy is reduced to the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from the socket.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And thus this remedy is reduced to the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from the socket.

E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And thus this remedy is reduced to the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from the socket.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	And thus this remedy is reduced to the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from the socket.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And thus this remedy is reduced to the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from the socket.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And thus this remedy is reduced to the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from the socket.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And thus this remedy is reduced to the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from the socket.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	If the joint is dislocated without any visible cause or due to some other reason, it is necessary to administer cautery three times, as it is said in the chapter on cautery.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	If all this is done and seven days have passed, and the ligament is not loosened and the joint is not stabilized, and the swelling and tension are reduced without any visible cause, and the limb is not elevated, it is known that the nerves of the limb are either numb or stretched or swollen, and that the limb is paralyzed forever
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	As for the dislocation of that which is useful to the feet and the knee or the buttocks, reduction is useful with an impulse and extension at the most, until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And let it be administered in the other place where there is tension, and care for that until it is healed
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if it happens that the healing takes place slowly in the limb and there is delay in its movement, it is necessary to support the limb greatly until that gravity is relieved and returns to its natural state
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter XXVVII.</end_of_turn>
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the treatment of dislocation of the knee.</end_of_turn>
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	You know that the knee joint is dislocated with difficulty and returns with difficulty; and that which is dislocated in all parts, especially in the part which is facing the part behind, and the dislocation of the limb is not recognized until it is displaced from its place; when you adjust the knee which is displaced, immediately you will know that the joint is depressed and cannot bend the limb, nor touch anything below the muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And you must tighten the knee, and reduce the dislocation as much as possible before applying cautery; for if you apply the cautery without reducing the dislocation, it is difficult to reduce it, and it is not good for healing; and especially when it is at the back of the limb, for it is worse of all other kinds of dislocation, and of greater pain, and many veins are swollen on that side.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of the limb, when it is possible to reduce it, is that the hand of the limb is extended with two thumbs, and the limb is expanded, and the hands of the physician are placed on the knee and leave it there, and the practitioner covers the joint with his thumbs, or with the base of his palm until it returns to its place
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	And even if the dislocation is at the front, it returns as soon as you bend your finger with your hand, until you perforate the knee with the base of your palm
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey the reduction, the physician must administer violent extension and great force
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And two assistants extend the limb, and hold this support of two assistants so that it does not slip from the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And let the limb be rotated throughout its extent, because it is wrapped around the thumb, or ligament
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the physician touches the joint with his hand, put some oil there so that these things which help to lubricate the joint facilitate; and then press the joint with force until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And when the reduction is made, cover it with that plaster in which is stipticity and exudation with a mixture of flour and water, and extend it with stricture descending, and suspend the limb from the column, and leave it like that for several days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And so if the joint is formed in its proper place, then you will loosen the ligament of the limb and leave it like that.</end_of_turn>
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if the joint is not healed, the physician will repeat the plaster and the ligament, and leave it like that for several days until it is extruded; and then loosen that.</end_of_turn>
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	And if it happens that gravity suddenly affects the reduction of the joint, and the limb is in movement, the physician must administer moisture in the limb and external friction, and pressure, until it is relieved; or rest over the joint without any greasy motion; and tie it up, and leave it like that during the day and night
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And so on, put it in water; and when the swelling subsides, the physician will cool the joint with temperate friction, and then repeat over that which was said, which is gentle rocking, a little bit of stretching, and the second, and the third time, etc.</end_of_turn

E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	Or if you wish, rest over that wound of the moist cow and cover it with a border and bandage; and make some veins, because that is moist and reduces the swelling.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xxviii.	Capitol XXVIII
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Treatment for dislocation of the bones, that is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	The bone of the hand is dislocated many times, and the reduction of the dislocation is easy, while the opposite is with the other joints, more so because speed is necessary in the reduction in the hour in which it is dislocated, so that the limb does not suffer from post-traumatic stiffness or that there occurs in it post-traumatic injury.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of the dislocation is that you place the wrist of the patient on a board and extend the hand of him, and the doctor places his hand or palm on the imminent part of the joint, and massages that until it returns to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However, it must be considered if the palm is already bowed towards the belly of the hand, for in that case the patient must hold two of his hands over a board during extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is antecedent, you must hold two of his hands, for in that case the position of his hand that is inside intrinsically over the board so that the hand of the doctor rests on that imminent part of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And therefore, if it returns well, it is good; and if not, when you have strained it as much as you can without causing further displacement, leave it; and do not attempt it again until the pain has disappeared from it.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	However, the joint remains according to its stiffness; and do not notice to the patient any cause, but that the hand is softened and cannot be strained without causing any cause; for the nerves are often torn or stretched, and it is not caused by it except for the stretching of the cautery at the time of treatment.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Therefore, when the limb is returned, leave it resting on the bandage that we have recommended, and leave it strapped for five days; and then let it be loosened and left, and exercise the hand of him.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	If the movement of the limb is delayed and happens in it any gravity, leave cold water on that and some greasy ointment, until the swelling is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXVIII
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Treatment for dislocation of the bones.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Some bones of the hand are dislocated throughout the body.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when one of those fingers is dislocated at the two of the palm or at the belly of the hand, the doctor must hold the finger and impel the dislocation towards the toes until it returns to its place
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And support the head of the finger, and suspend that beyond the part that is dislocated, and leave that for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend that and extend that until it is equal in that place again
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when that will not be, lie that according to that narration, and do not cease loosening that in the day and exercising, and lie that at night; and do this for several days until it is healed
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do the same with that, if it is dislocated at the belly of the hand, and leave that at that part and do that with the first operation, until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And do the same with that when it is dislocated in other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXIX
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Treatment for dislocation of the vertebrae of the back
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When an accident occurs to some of the vertebrae of the back or the pelvis, and some vertebrae of those bones remain locked in place, in that case there is no treatment, for death covers the patient
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And a sign of that is that the evacuation of the patient is outside of their will, and cannot be retained; and some bones of the hand are softened in some members of them or two limbs or two arms of them, or one of them; or a vertebra is dislocated from its place, which is neither softened nor can it be reduced to its place without causing the evacuation of those to four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore that is already dislocated behind and is called gelliosis.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	However, the treatment of that is that the doctor considers if the gelliosis occurred in infancy, for in that case it is neither a treatment nor a healing of everything
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	However, in those cases where it is seen in the case or by percussion or by appearance, I will say that the ancients spoke of long methods of treatment, of which the most return with profit; however, I have already mentioned that I will abbreviate that which is little useful from the abundance of that, for my proximity to the understanding of my exposition, to which I have exposed and explained it with various instruments that I have shown and explained with various instruments that I have used.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz. E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And these are not cured except for those which happen directly in the two places where I recommend it.</start_of_turn>

Capitol .xxxi.	Capitol .xxxi.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	Capital .xxxi.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Say that the ankle joint and the joint of the muscle do not deviate only by dislocation alone, but also by those that happen to the other joints of the foot, removing and concaving them
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the ankle joint is dislocated in four ways, that is, to the inside, or to the outside, or to the front, or to the back.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	Most often it is dislocated inwards, and little to the front or to the back
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of the dislocation of the ankle is that when you adjust the limb of the sick person to the limb of the healthy person, the heel of the sick person is more prominent than that of the healthy person, and the sick person cannot bend their foot without causing them pain, and that is where the tip of the cushion has already passed.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The sign of the dislocation of the ankle is that it happens on the outside of the ankle in the opposite way to this accident
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	The sign of the dislocation of the ankle is that the limb is extended towards the front, however, it does not bend where it hurts, and if you force it to bend there, you will not be able to walk on the front of the foot; the urine is retained and the swelling is posttraumatic, and you must walk on the ankle bone
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	The sign of the dislocation of the ankle is that neither the heel nor the toe can be bent, and the limb is shorter than the other limb, and the swelling is softened, and the cushion has passed over that place
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	The greatest reduction of this kind of dislocation is that you must consider, when, if the dislocation is old and ancient, that it is already outdated from when you should have administered a reduction to it and it remains according to its situation; in this case it is not in this treatment that you must look for benefit; for in this case there is no benefit in doing so
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	More in the one in which the dislocation is recent, and it is one of the four species of dislocation, then you must take care that you return the joint to its place and extend it outwards, and upwards and downwards, for strong pain will return if you do not do so and it will not be cured by any other treatment
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	More, if it does not return in this manner, you must prepare to minister strong and extend the limb of the side that you left behind, or at the least its most, or bind what is bound over the limb below the ankle; and another minister extend your hand of that side outwards so that your thumbs touch the tip of your toes; and strengthen the bandage around the ankle and keep another minister on the other extremity of the limb.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And the extension of the limb or of the outer part to the ankle or from the back to the heel, or from the front to the ankle bone.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And the extension of all of them together until the sick person’s limb is elevated above the ground and remains hanging down
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this kind of extension is common to all four of them
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	Therefore, if the dislocation returns as we have said, it is good; but if not, it is necessary in every kind of treatment that we speak of in this treatise.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of it, when it is dislocated, if the dislocation is inward, cover that the sick person is resting on their buttocks; and place the ligaments over the ankle in that place where the tip of the cushion passes over between the ankle and the heel; and extend the ligament from the part of the ankle towards the higher part of the ankle bone.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And another minister strongly grasps the toes, and immediately grasp the large part of the ankle of the sick person and extend outwards for a violent extension, so that the pain returns to its place
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	This kind of treatment is of less severe treatment than the others for this member.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	More, if you are excused for it and do not obey the order in this kind of treatment, it is necessary that you bind both feet of the sick person together with a strong and tight bandage, over both ankles and both toes
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And let the length of each be equal to the quantity of four fingers, and let the bandage of the sick person be extended more than the other by the quantity of two fingers
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And let the sick person be suspended above the head of the foot, and that it be in the middle; and let the length of the limb from the ground be equal to the quantity of two thumbs
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	Then command a strong youth to reduce the thigh bone, and suspend one hand of the patient with the other youth, and the other youth will reduce the thigh with force, so that the joint returns to its rightful place quickly.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	More in the proper reduction, when it is a displacement outwards, cover that the patient bites down on the jaw according to what we have recommended in the former case; and keep the ligament stretched over the affected limb and over the foot.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And two assistants shall be present, one at the feet of the patient, and the other at the head; and assistants shall be present with hands adjusted to the middle of the bed placed over which wet cloths are spread, so that the patient is not dampened because the cushion is between the patient's thighs, because you must extend the lower limbs without tension
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And every minister extends to their part, and the doctor with their hand grasps the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if you obey respectfully, it will go very well; but if not, pause diligently as we have said in the gelbozi for that treatment
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	More cover that the patient bites down on the jaw so that it will be released from the buttocks
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is at the front, it is necessary that the limb be extended forward, as it is said in the aforementioned treatise concerning the thigh; and the doctor places the thumb of their right hand on the affected area, and with the other hand grasp that which is at the other side, and at that grasping pause that which is extended to the lower limbs at the front.</start_turn>
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is at the back, it is not necessary that the patient's lower limbs be extended, but it is elevated above the ground; because it must be supported on a hard surface, as it is said about the swelling of the limb when the outer surface is dislocated; and it is over the face and the ligaments are extended, as we have said, without any spasm.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And it is necessary to administer pressure with a table over the area where the joint is located.<end_turn>
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Therefore when the reduction is completed as we have said — and the sign of the reduction of the limb is not hidden from you, that is to say that you extend two limbs of the patient, and when you have once grasped those and the patient extends their thigh limb and expands the lower limb, then you know that the limb is returned as it should be — and you adjust two cushions and pause close by and grasp the bandage so that the width is not swollen in any part; and keep the patient at rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And remove the ligament and the dressing, and compare one limb with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	When you see those swells vanish in the dressing, then you know that the dislocation is already stopped, and then you allow the patient to walk.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of discomfort, then you return and plaster that, and withdraw that according to your first structure, and leave that for three days
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And remove that, and make the patient walk slowly for a few days, until they are comfortable.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter XXXII.</start_of_turn>
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the care of dislocation of the thigh bone.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The thigh bone is dislocated in three ways, that is to say that it is dislocated outwards, and at the front, and downwards more than at the back; and it is not dislocated at the front
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of the dislocation of the limb is that the patient commands the patient to flex their limb over the cushion; knowing that the thigh is dislocated
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all these ways is that you make the patient grasp the limb with their hand, even if you can do it above what was said; put two cushions under the face of the limb, and place the foot of the limb between the thighs; and then order the patient to grasp the thigh of the limb with your hands, and hold that between the thighs of the limb as if it were about the thigh of the limb, and another minister extend the lower limb until the thigh returns to its place
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of the limb's recovery is that their limb adheres to the cushion without suffering.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And plaster that and make them adhere the limb to the cushion, and bind those together with a bandage for three days or four, and then remove those.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	Do not make the patient walk for a few days, until they are healthy and comfortable
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	If the reduction of the limb is excused, then administer strong extension to the ligaments that preceded the treatment of the groin.
Capitol .xxxiii.	When the reduction of the limb is excused, then administer strong extension to the ligaments that preceded the treatment of the groin.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	From the treatment of dislocation of the ankle
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	Some bones of the ankle are swollen due to slight displacement, and some bones are dislocated according to custom, and the dislocation is caused either by the ligaments or by the bones themselves
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	The sign of dislocation is that sometimes the ankle swells up proceeding from the part that is dislocated
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	The treatment for displacement is gentle reduction, and it is that it is facilitated by the most and that it is equalised as soon as it returns
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	When the dislocation is complete, cover that the patient groans in pain, and have a strong and valiant assistant behind the two of his legs in the middle of the limb
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And put your right hand on the top of the foot towards the heel, and your left hand on the front of the foot in the place of the ankle
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And pull the foot towards you with your right hand, and with the left hand make two fingers, and extend with the left; and press the heel of the foot against the right side of the limb.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do as we have counted two fingers
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And press the foot against the third finger, and you are at the ankle
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	So if it returns in one or two times according to this manner, and if sometimes the foot is equalised, it is good; otherwise, when the limb does not return, repeat the operation until it returns
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	If the reduction is prohibited for you as we have recommended, then make the patient walk on the toes over the ground, and loosen a little the plaster cast on the ground, and that he sits between the thighs, and you have already placed your hand over the limb to prevent it from moving
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And let the assistant of the limb hold his thighs, and another assistant extend the foot with his hands or with the ligaments that lie over the heel of the foot; and extend whichever minister against the extension of the heel, and that the plaster cast exists between the thighs, so that the body of the limb is not pulled towards the front beyond its extension
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And the doctor will wrap up the dislocation with the thighs, and another assistant will hold the healthy limb at the front, so that the dislocation returns with ease
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And thus when the dislocation returns and you are declared to have completed the reduction of the limb, then pause the plaster and gently stretch that which is strongly ligated, and join the foot to the limb with the cast
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And beware or take care of the nerves that are behind the ankle, because the ligament over that should not be tight and must not be stretched too much
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And leave it so for two days or three; and if the ligament is softened, stretch it out
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And take it off on the fourth day or on the fifth, and prohibit the patient from walking for forty days
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	If it is forced to go forward despite that space, it is not wrong to ensure that the dislocation is not dissolved and corrupted, and that it does not receive care
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	If by chance it happens after the removal of the cautery that the limb must be remade, then cover that you administer in the cessation of the pain that preceded our narration in another place of care and bandaging, until it is remade
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Treatment for dislocation of the bones of the foot.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	When it is dislocated, it must be equalised with little extension of the limb; and that which is not difficult, be joyful
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	If the dislocation is in the ankle bones of the two feet, then make the patient walk on the toes over the ground or on a table, and remain like this as if he were going
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And put your foot down, and stop the ankle on what comes out of the joints, and hold that until it returns, and that you see that it is already equalised and does not appear again in the immediate vicinity
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And place under the belly of the foot of the limb a board that covers the whole foot, with two caps, and hold that down by stretching and closing firmly for three days; and take it off and let him walk again after forty days, until it is restored and the redness is insured
Capitol .xxxv.	Capitol .xxxv.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	From the species of dislocation which are caused by swelling or fracture or any other lesion.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When these things happen, and you perforate the wound of the cure and restore it, the veins become swollen and blood is lost, which often leads to death
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And for this, do not presume that it is enough to take care of the wound, but rather that one who is skilled in the art, experienced, merciful and patient, should take charge; and that he should use at the outset medicines which do not cause nausea alone, but which will calm the patient, for the patient will be judged by God, not by us; and he should hope for salvation rather than for recovery from the disease, and in which hope there appears some possibility.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And so he should strive to reduce it as soon as possible at the outset of the disease, giving only as much caut as is necessary.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And when the limb returns as it should, then administer a regimen which will cause only slight caut and will cure the swelling in that which you agree with the surrounding desiccation.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is caused by a fracture and the bones are separated, then you perforate the soft tissue of the limb, and do as has been said in the simple diseases of those which precede these
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And keep and flee according to your virtue that of the instrument in the way of fear as I have foretold; for what is better for you than the Creator himself? More lasting is his glory, and more joyful is his peace than all the wealth of the world.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus I finish the words of Albucasim perfectly, for which God be praised.
Amen.	Amen.
